original: @206b # // rgya gar skad du /🔽de sha na sta ba bri tti /
analyzed: @206b # // rgya gar skad du / de sha na sta ba bri tti /
translated: In Sanskrit:🔽Desanastavatippaṇī

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: bshags pa'i bstod pa'i 'grel ba /
analyzed: bshags pa'i bstod pa'i 'grel ba /
translated: Explanation of the Praise of Confession

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to youthful Mañjuśrī.

original: 'di na bstod pa byed pa'i dus su bstod pa rtsom pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / dgos pa mdzad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas skabs rnam pa gsum las brtsams te smra bar byed la /🔽bstod pa byed pa de yang dad pa dang // mang du thos pa dang / nyam nga ba'i gnas skabs thob pa ste /
analyzed: 'di na bstod pa byed pa'i dus su bstod pa rtsom pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / dgos pa mdzad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas skabs rnam pa gsum las brtsams te smra bar byed la / bstod pa byed pa de yang dad pa dang // mang du thos pa dang / nyam nga ba'i gnas skabs thob pa ste /
translated: Here, when composing praises, those who undertake praise speak from the three perspectives of the cause, effect, and purpose of the Buddha.

original: rnam pa gsum yin no //🔽de la 'di ni gtso cher mang du thos pa'i rgyus dgos pa mdzad pa'i gnas skabs la brten te bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan brjod @207a * //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum yin no // de la 'di ni gtso cher mang du thos pa'i rgyus dgos pa mdzad pa'i gnas skabs la brten te bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan brjod @207a * //
translated: Moreover, that praise is threefold: faith, extensive learning, and the attainment of a state of distress.

original: pa'i sgo nas sdig pa bshags pa'i tshul smra bar 'dod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: pa'i sgo nas sdig pa bshags pa'i tshul smra bar 'dod pa'i phyir //
translated: Here, primarily based on the cause of extensive learning, the perspective of the purpose, and the state of distress, in order to speak the method of confessing misdeeds through expressing the qualities of the Blessed One,🔽the author of the commentary, with a mind of faith,

original: sman pa'i rgyal po mnyam med 'gro ba'i bla //
analyzed: sman pa'i rgyal po mnyam med 'gro ba'i bla //
translated: the king of physicians, the unequaled leader of beings,

original: nyes pa kun bral yon tan 'byung ba'i gnas //🔽skyabs khyed nye bar dmigs nas rtag na ba //
analyzed: nyes pa kun bral yon tan 'byung ba'i gnas // skyabs khyed nye bar dmigs nas rtag na ba //
translated: The abode of the arising of all virtues, free from all faults.

original: rang gi nyes pa'i 'gyur brjod bshags par bgyi ;🔽/ zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi nyes pa'i 'gyur brjod bshags par bgyi ; / zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Having seen you as the refuge, I always confess my faults.

original: sman pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba ni sman pa'i gtso bo ste /
analyzed: sman pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba ni sman pa'i gtso bo ste /
translated: The king of physicians is the chief physician,

original: nyon mongs pa'i nad kyis gdungs shing ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i sems can rnams gso ba'i rig pa mkhyen pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i nad kyis gdungs shing ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i sems can rnams gso ba'i rig pa mkhyen pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he knows the science of healing sentient beings who are afflicted by the disease of the afflictions and going to the miserable realms.

original: de nyid kyis na mnyam med ces bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na mnyam med ces bya ste /
translated: Therefore, he is called unequaled,

original: tshangs pa dang drag po la sogs pa'i nang na 'di dang thabs mnyam pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshangs pa dang drag po la sogs pa'i nang na 'di dang thabs mnyam pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because there is no equal to him among Brahmā, Śiva, and so on.

original: gzhan yang de nyid ni khams gsum pa rnams la lam gyi dam pa ston par mdzad pa yin pas na 'gro ba'i bla ma'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid ni khams gsum pa rnams la lam gyi dam pa ston par mdzad pa yin pas na 'gro ba'i bla ma'o //
translated: Moreover, he is the guru of migrating beings because he teaches the excellent path to those in the three realms.

original: gal te de lta na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag kyang 'gro ba'i bla ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag kyang 'gro ba'i bla ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are also gurus of migrating beings.

original: de las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir nyes pa kun bral zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir nyes pa kun bral zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: In order to distinguish him from those, he is called “free from all faults.”

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa ni sems kyi rgyun la yang dag pa'i ye shes skye ba'i gegs byed pas na nyes zhes bya la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa ni sems kyi rgyun la yang dag pa'i ye shes skye ba'i gegs byed pas na nyes zhes bya la /
translated: Attachment, hatred, delusion, etc., are called “faults” because they obstruct the arising of correct wisdom in the continuum of mind.

original: de bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus pa dang bral zhing nges par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus pa dang bral zhing nges par spangs pa'o //
translated: He is free from all of them without exception, together with their imprints, and has definitely abandoned them.

original: nyes pa dang bral ba 'ba' zhig tsam gyis bla mar gyur pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa dang bral ba 'ba' zhig tsam gyis bla mar gyur pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is he a guru merely by being free from faults?

original: de'i phyir yon tan 'byung ba'i gnas zhes bya ba smos te /🔽bslab cing byang bar bya ba yin pas na /
analyzed: de'i phyir yon tan 'byung ba'i gnas zhes bya ba smos te / bslab cing byang bar bya ba yin pas na /
translated: Therefore, he is called “the source of good qualities.”

original: yon tan te /
analyzed: yon tan te /
translated: They are called “good qualities” because they are to be trained in and mastered.

original: stobs dang / mi 'jigs ba la sogs pa la bya la //
analyzed: stobs dang / mi 'jigs ba la sogs pa la bya la //
translated: They are the powers, the fearlessnesses, and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi 'byung gnas ni bskyed pa'i gzhi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'byung gnas ni bskyed pa'i gzhi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The source of those is the basis for their generation.

original: rgyu de dag nyid kyis na skyabs su 'os pa yin pa'i phyir skyabs te /
analyzed: rgyu de dag nyid kyis na skyabs su 'os pa yin pa'i phyir skyabs te /
translated: He is a refuge because he is worthy of being a refuge due to those very causes.

original: gang la brten nas sdig pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zad par byed cing /
analyzed: gang la brten nas sdig pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zad par byed cing /
translated: The Blessed One is the supreme refuge because he is the one who, when relied upon, exhausts the unfavorable side of misdeeds, etc.,

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid che ba mnga' bas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni skyabs dam pa yin pa'i phyir skyabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan gyi bdag nyid che ba mnga' bas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni skyabs dam pa yin pa'i phyir skyabs zhes bya'o //
translated: and possesses the greatness of the nature of extraordinary qualities.

original: khyed ces bya ba mngon sum gyi shes pas dmigs pa'i yul du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: khyed ces bya ba mngon sum gyi shes pas dmigs pa'i yul du gyur pa'o //
translated: “You” refers to the object that is perceived by direct perception.

original: nyes par dmigs nas zhes bya ba ni mngon par dad pa'i sems kyis dmigs shing mngon sum du @207b byas nas nyes pa bshags par bgyi'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: nyes par dmigs nas zhes bya ba ni mngon par dad pa'i sems kyis dmigs shing mngon sum du @207b byas nas nyes pa bshags par bgyi'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “Having perceived the faults” means that one should confess the faults after perceiving and making them manifest with a mind of deep faith.

original: ci'i phyir bshags she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bshags she na /
translated: Why should one confess?

original: rtag na ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rtag na ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, “I am always sick.”

original: sems kyi rgyud nyon mongs pa'i nad kyis gdungs shing bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la bya'i rlung la sogs pa 'khrug pa la ni mi bya ste /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud nyon mongs pa'i nad kyis gdungs shing bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la bya'i rlung la sogs pa 'khrug pa la ni mi bya ste /
translated: This refers to the continuum of mind that is afflicted by the illness of the afflictions and possesses the characteristics of grasping at “I” and “mine.” It does not refer to the disturbance of wind, etc.,

original: 'dir gnas skabs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir gnas skabs ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is not the context here.

original: rang gi nyes pa'i 'gyur ba ni rang nyid kyi sems nyon mongs pa'i dbang gi rang bzhin nyams shing gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur ba'i tshul gang dag yin pa tshig gis brjod pa'i thal mo sbyar ba la sogs pa lus kyi gus pa'i tshul dang yang ldan pas
analyzed: rang gi nyes pa'i 'gyur ba ni rang nyid kyi sems nyon mongs pa'i dbang gi rang bzhin nyams shing gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur ba'i tshul gang dag yin pa tshig gis brjod pa'i thal mo sbyar ba la sogs pa lus kyi gus pa'i tshul dang yang ldan pas
translated: The change in one's faults is the change in one's nature, which is the degeneration of one's mind due to the power of the afflictions.

original: bshags par bgyi zhing mi bcab par mngon sum du brjod par bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bshags par bgyi zhing mi bcab par mngon sum du brjod par bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should confess one's faults with one's body, with gestures such as joining one's palms, and with one's speech, by not concealing one's faults but openly declaring them.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa dang po 'di ni bdag nyid kyi bya bar brjod par bya ba dang / 'brel pa dang / dgos pa dang / dgos pa'i yang dgos pa ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa dang po 'di ni bdag nyid kyi bya bar brjod par bya ba dang / 'brel pa dang / dgos pa dang / dgos pa'i yang dgos pa ston pa yin te /
translated: Thus, this first verse teaches the subject matter, the connection, the purpose, and the ultimate purpose of the text.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yon tan brjod pa'i sgo nas rang gi nyes pa bshags pa ni brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yon tan brjod pa'i sgo nas rang gi nyes pa bshags pa ni brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: The confession of one's faults by praising the qualities of omniscience is the subject matter.

original: bstod pa'i tshig ni brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bstod pa'i tshig ni brjod pa yin no //
translated: The words of praise are the expression.

original: de dag rgyu 'bras bu 'brel ba ni 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag rgyu 'bras bu 'brel ba ni 'brel pa yin no //
translated: The connection between them as cause and effect is the connection.

original: lam shes pa'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa las ldog pa ni dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: lam shes pa'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa las ldog pa ni dgos pa yin no //
translated: The purpose is to turn away from the afflictions by means of knowledge of the path.

original: de la brten te rim gyis sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang nyid 'thob pa ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: de la brten te rim gyis sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang nyid 'thob pa ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa yin no //
translated: The ultimate purpose is to gradually attain the state of a Buddha in dependence on that.🔽In order to teach the faults of that,

original: de'i nyes pa'i 'gyur ba de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i nyes pa'i 'gyur ba de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: it says:

original: shin tu rgal dka'i chu bo'i rgyun 'dra zhing //
analyzed: shin tu rgal dka'i chu bo'i rgyun 'dra zhing //
translated: Like a river current that is very difficult to cross,

original: rtog dang dpyod pa ngan pa'i dpa' rlabs can //
analyzed: rtog dang dpyod pa ngan pa'i dpa' rlabs can //
translated: with the waves of bad conceptuality and analysis,

original: nyon mongs chu srin 'dzin khris dkrugs pa na //
analyzed: nyon mongs chu srin 'dzin khris dkrugs pa na //
translated: agitated by the crocodile of the afflictions,

original: bdag gi rang gi sems la'ang zhi ma mchis //
analyzed: bdag gi rang gi sems la'ang zhi ma mchis //
translated: there is no peace in my own mind.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Thus, it says.

original: kye bcom ldan 'das bdag gi rang gi sems la zhi zhing nyon mongs pa dang bral ba ma mchis so //
analyzed: kye bcom ldan 'das bdag gi rang gi sems la zhi zhing nyon mongs pa dang bral ba ma mchis so //
translated: O Bhagavān, there is no peace, no freedom from the afflictions, in my own mind.

original: ji ltar med par gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar med par gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that there is no peace?

original: shin tu rgal dka'i chu bo'i rgyun 'dra zhes smos te /
analyzed: shin tu rgal dka'i chu bo'i rgyun 'dra zhes smos te /
translated: It says, “like a river current that is very difficult to cross.”

original: 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni dper bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni dper bya ba ste /
translated: “Like” is an example.

original: ji ltar chu bo'i rgyun drag pos bdas shing g-yengs par gyur pa dag sdug bsngal chen po nyams su myong bar gyur pa yin pa de bzhin du 'khor ba'i gnas su nyon mongs pa'i chu bo'i rgyun bzlog par dka' bas g-yengs par gyur pas na sems la zhi
analyzed: ji ltar chu bo'i rgyun drag pos bdas shing g-yengs par gyur pa dag sdug bsngal chen po nyams su myong bar gyur pa yin pa de bzhin du 'khor ba'i gnas su nyon mongs pa'i chu bo'i rgyun bzlog par dka' bas g-yengs par gyur pas na sems la zhi
translated: Just as those who are carried away and distracted by the violent current of a river experience great suffering, in the same way, in the realm of cyclic existence, the mind is distracted by the current of the river of afflictions, which is difficult to reverse.🔽

original: ba dang bde ba ma mchis so zhes bya @208a * //🔽ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba dang bde ba ma mchis so zhes bya @208a * // ba'i don to //
translated: Just as those who are carried away and tossed about by the violent current of a river experience great suffering, so also those who are carried away and tossed about by the violent current of the defilements in the realm of cyclic existence do not have peace and happiness in their minds.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rtog dang dpyod pa ngan pa'i dpa' rlabs can //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rtog dang dpyod pa ngan pa'i dpa' rlabs can // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is because of the waves of evil investigation and examination.

original: rtog pas na rtog pa ste sems kyi rgyu ba rtsing ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pas na rtog pa ste sems kyi rgyu ba rtsing ba'o //
translated: Because of investigation, there is investigation, which is the gross movement of mind.

original: dpyod pas na dpyod pa ste sems zhib pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pas na dpyod pa ste sems zhib pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Because of examination, there is examination, which is the subtle mode of mind.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa yang yin la ngan pa yang yin pas rtog dpyod ngan pa ste nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa yang yin la ngan pa yang yin pas rtog dpyod ngan pa ste nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: Since both investigation and examination are evil, i.e., defiled, they are evil investigation and examination.

original: de nyid ni dba' rlabs te sems gang la nyon mongs pa can gyi rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i rnam pas dkrugs shing g-yengs pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir dba' rlabs can te /
analyzed: de nyid ni dba' rlabs te sems gang la nyon mongs pa can gyi rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i rnam pas dkrugs shing g-yengs pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir dba' rlabs can te /
translated: That is the wave, because it is the state of mind that is disturbed and distracted by the waves of discursive thought and investigation.

original: de nyid kyis ni brgal bar dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni brgal bar dka' ba yin no //
translated: It is difficult to cross over just that.

original: gzhan yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how is it?

original: nyon mongs chu srin 'dzin khris dkrugs pa na //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nyon mongs chu srin 'dzin khris dkrugs pa na // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is agitated by the crocodile-like afflictions.🔽It is agitated by the crocodile-like afflictions.

original: rtog dpyod ngan pa'i dbang gis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa skyed par byed pa /
analyzed: rtog dpyod ngan pa'i dbang gis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa skyed par byed pa /
translated: It generates attachment and so on by the power of bad discursive thought and investigation.

original: de nyid ni sdug bsngal bskyed cing 'dzin pa dam po'i tshul gyis chos mthun par na chu srin te rgya mtsho'i srog chags so //
analyzed: de nyid ni sdug bsngal bskyed cing 'dzin pa dam po'i tshul gyis chos mthun par na chu srin te rgya mtsho'i srog chags so //
translated: That itself is similar to a crocodile, a sea creature, in the sense of generating suffering and holding on tightly.

original: de rnams kyi tshogs ni mang po'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi tshogs ni mang po'o //
translated: A multitude of those is a group.

original: des dkrugs pa ni khyab cing g-yengs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: des dkrugs pa ni khyab cing g-yengs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Agitated by that means pervaded and distracted.

original: rgyu des na ji srid nyon mongs pa can gyi rtog pa ma sangs pa de srid ni rang gi sems zhi zhing dkar po'i chos skye ba'i gzhir mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu des na ji srid nyon mongs pa can gyi rtog pa ma sangs pa de srid ni rang gi sems zhi zhing dkar po'i chos skye ba'i gzhir mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: For that reason, as long as the afflictive thoughts have not been purified, one’s mind will not become a basis for the arising of the virtuous qualities.

original: de yang lan tshva'i chu bo'i mdo las /
analyzed: de yang lan tshva'i chu bo'i mdo las /
translated: The Salt River Sūtra says:

original: bdag ni nor phrogs rkun po rnams la 'jigs pa yod min te //
analyzed: bdag ni nor phrogs rkun po rnams la 'jigs pa yod min te //
translated: I am not afraid of thieves who steal my wealth,

original: de dag gis ni nor bzangs 'phrog par byed na de yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: de dag gis ni nor bzangs 'phrog par byed na de yang yod ma yin //
translated: For they steal only my gold and silver, which are not even me.

original: yid kyi dge ba'i nor ni legs par rab tu bsags bsags pa //
analyzed: yid kyi dge ba'i nor ni legs par rab tu bsags bsags pa //
translated: But the wealth of virtuous mind I have well and truly gathered

original: bdag gi tha mal rnam rtog dag gi mngon du 'phrog par byed //
analyzed: bdag gi tha mal rnam rtog dag gi mngon du 'phrog par byed //
translated: Is stolen by my own ordinary thoughts.

original: ri khrod dang ni mun khang dag dang nags ni stug po ru //
analyzed: ri khrod dang ni mun khang dag dang nags ni stug po ru //
translated: In the mountains, in the dark house, in the thick forest,

original: nor ni rkun po rnams las 'di ni legs par bsrung nus kyi //🔽gang du dge ba'i nor ni 'phags min rtog pa 'di yis ni //
analyzed: nor ni rkun po rnams las 'di ni legs par bsrung nus kyi // gang du dge ba'i nor ni 'phags min rtog pa 'di yis ni //
translated: One can protect one’s wealth well from thieves.

original: bcom par ma gyur sa phyogs de ni 'gro na yod ma yin //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom par ma gyur sa phyogs de ni 'gro na yod ma yin //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: But there is no place in the world where one can go🔽Where this nonvirtuous thought will not steal one’s wealth of virtue.

original: de la dang po kho nar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang ldan pa rnams la go rims bzhin mi gtsang ba dang / byams pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ston par mdzad cing /
analyzed: de la dang po kho nar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang ldan pa rnams la go rims bzhin mi gtsang ba dang / byams pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ston par mdzad cing /
translated: First of all, the Lord taught the impure, loving kindness, and dependent origination to those who are endowed with attachment, hatred, and delusion, respectively.

original: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi gsungs pa dang mi mthun par gyur @208b pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi gsungs pa dang mi mthun par gyur @208b pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the occasion of the four abodes of Brahma, which is not in accord with the teaching of the four abodes of Brahma,🔽he said:

original: 'dod chags rgya mtsho'i dpa' rlabs che 'khrugs tshe //
analyzed: 'dod chags rgya mtsho'i dpa' rlabs che 'khrugs tshe //
translated: When the great waves of the ocean of attachment arise,

original: gal te mi gtsang rdzing la brten gyur na //
analyzed: gal te mi gtsang rdzing la brten gyur na //
translated: if you rely on the pond of the impure,

original: der ni bdag yid zhe sdang me yis ni /
analyzed: der ni bdag yid zhe sdang me yis ni /
translated: then the fire of hatred in your mind

original: rtsva skam bzhin du nges bsreg nye bar bcom //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rtsva skam bzhin du nges bsreg nye bar bcom // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: will certainly burn you like dry grass.

original: 'dod chags ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / dngos po'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / dngos po'i 'dod chags so //
translated: Attachment is attachment to desire and attachment to things.

original: de nyid ni mang ba dang stobs che ba'i phyir rgya mtsho'i //
analyzed: de nyid ni mang ba dang stobs che ba'i phyir rgya mtsho'i //
translated: It is an ocean because it is vast and powerful.

original: dba' rlabs ni de dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa du ma ste /
analyzed: dba' rlabs ni de dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa du ma ste /
translated: Waves are the many discursive thoughts that are associated with it.

original: des 'khrugs pa dang g-yo zhing bskyod par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: des 'khrugs pa dang g-yo zhing bskyod par gyur pa'o //
translated: The mind is agitated and disturbed by them.

original: de yang mdo de nyid las //
analyzed: de yang mdo de nyid las //
translated: And in that very sūtra it is said:

original: ji ltar dang ba'i chu 'bab rgya mtsho ni //
analyzed: ji ltar dang ba'i chu 'bab rgya mtsho ni //
translated: Just as the ocean, which is clear and has waves,

original: mi g-yo dba' rlabs kyis ni rab 'khrug byed //
analyzed: mi g-yo dba' rlabs kyis ni rab 'khrug byed //
translated: is agitated by the waves that do not move,

original: de bzhin rtse gcig gyur pa'i sems kyi chu //
analyzed: de bzhin rtse gcig gyur pa'i sems kyi chu //
translated: so the water of the mind, which is clear and one-pointed,

original: rnam par rtog pas rab tu 'khrug par byed //🔽ces bshad pa'i yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas rab tu 'khrug par byed // ces bshad pa'i yin no //
translated: is disturbed by the waves of discursive thought.

original: de ltar gyur pa de'i tshe ci zhig bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa de'i tshe ci zhig bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: What should one do when that happens?

original: gnyen po bsten par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyen po bsten par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: One should rely on the antidote. Therefore it is said:

original: gal te mi gtsang gzings la brten gyur na //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te mi gtsang gzings la brten gyur na // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If you rely on the raft of impurity,

original: gal te bsal ba'i phyir mi gtsang ba ste mi sdug pa'i dngos po bsgom zhing 'dod chags kyi rgya mtsho rgal ba'i thabs kyi gzings la rten cing gnas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gal te bsal ba'i phyir mi gtsang ba ste mi sdug pa'i dngos po bsgom zhing 'dod chags kyi rgya mtsho rgal ba'i thabs kyi gzings la rten cing gnas par gyur pa'o //
translated: If you rely on the raft of impurity, that is, meditate on the repulsive thing, which is impure, in order to eliminate desire, you will cross the ocean of desire.

original: gnas skabs der sems ji ltar gnas she na /
analyzed: gnas skabs der sems ji ltar gnas she na /
translated: How does the mind abide at that time?

original: der ni bdag yid zhe sdang me yis ni //
analyzed: der ni bdag yid zhe sdang me yis ni //
translated: There, my mind was consumed by the fire of hatred,

original: rtsva skam bzhin du nges bsregs nye bar bcom //
analyzed: rtsva skam bzhin du nges bsregs nye bar bcom //
translated: as if burned by dry grass.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is said.🔽At that time of meditation, due to the power of relying on an unpleasant object, my mind was harmed by the fire of hatred, as if dry grass were burned.

original: bsgom pa'i gnas skabs der yul yid du mi 'ong ba la brten pa'i dbang gis bdag gi yid zhe sdang gi mes rtsva skam po bsregs pa bzhin du yid la gnod par gyur gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems zhi ba ni rnyed par ma gyur to zhes
analyzed: bsgom pa'i gnas skabs der yul yid du mi 'ong ba la brten pa'i dbang gis bdag gi yid zhe sdang gi mes rtsva skam po bsregs pa bzhin du yid la gnod par gyur gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems zhi ba ni rnyed par ma gyur to zhes
translated: The mind free from attachment did not attain peace.

original: rang gi nyes pa brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi nyes pa brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is the expression of his own fault.

original: de ltar zhe sdang gis gnod par gyur pa la rang gi gnyen po bsten mod ce na /🔽de'i phyir / zhe sdang me yi gdung ba zhi bya'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar zhe sdang gis gnod par gyur pa la rang gi gnyen po bsten mod ce na / de'i phyir / zhe sdang me yi gdung ba zhi bya'i phyir //
translated: If it is asked, In that way, when harmed by hatred, did he rely on his own antidote?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽zhe sdang ni gzhan la gnod pa'i sems te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / zhe sdang ni gzhan la gnod pa'i sems te /
translated: For that reason, it is said, In order to pacify the torment of the fire of hatred, and so on.🔽Hatred is the intention to harm others.

original: mnar sems kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: mnar sems kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: It is the aspect of malice.

original: de nyid me ste de las byung ba'i yid mi bde ba'i gdung bas sems kyi rgyud kun nas yongs su sreg pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid me ste de las byung ba'i yid mi bde ba'i gdung bas sems kyi rgyud kun nas yongs su sreg pa'o //
translated: That is the fire, and the mental continuum is completely burned up by the distress of the mental dissatisfaction that arises from it.

original: zhi ba ni gnod pa de zhi ba ste sems kyi rgyun de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni gnod pa de zhi ba ste sems kyi rgyun de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Peace is the pacification of that harm, the cessation of that mental continuum.

original: phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i don du'o //🔽zhi ba'i @209a * //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i don du'o // zhi ba'i @209a * //
translated: For the sake of that, for the sake of peace.

original: phyir ci zhig byed ce na /
analyzed: phyir ci zhig byed ce na /
translated: What is done for the sake of peace?

original: gal te byams pa'i rdzing ni bsgoms gyur kyang //
analyzed: gal te byams pa'i rdzing ni bsgoms gyur kyang //
translated: If the lake of love is cultivated,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says.

original: gal te zhe sdang gi me'i gnyen por sems can thams cad bde bar 'dod pa'i byams pa ste /🔽mdza' ba'i sems rdzing gi chu ltar bsil ba zhe sdang gi me 'jil bar nus pa bsgoms shing mang du byas par gyur kyang ngo //
analyzed: gal te zhe sdang gi me'i gnyen por sems can thams cad bde bar 'dod pa'i byams pa ste / mdza' ba'i sems rdzing gi chu ltar bsil ba zhe sdang gi me 'jil bar nus pa bsgoms shing mang du byas par gyur kyang ngo //
translated: If the antidote to the fire of hatred is love, the desire for the happiness of all sentient beings,🔽the cool water of a loving mind, like a lake, is able to extinguish the fire of hatred.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens if it is cultivated and made much of?

original: der ni skye bo thams cad bder 'dod pa'i //
analyzed: der ni skye bo thams cad bder 'dod pa'i //
translated: There, all beings are desired to be happy,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says.

original: de ltar bsgoms pa'i gnas skabs der skye bo thams cad ces bya ba khams gsum par gtogs pa'i 'gro ba ma lus pa la byams pa'i sems kyis dmigs pa'i bde bar 'dod cing gnod pa dang bral bar dga' ba'i sems so //
analyzed: de ltar bsgoms pa'i gnas skabs der skye bo thams cad ces bya ba khams gsum par gtogs pa'i 'gro ba ma lus pa la byams pa'i sems kyis dmigs pa'i bde bar 'dod cing gnod pa dang bral bar dga' ba'i sems so //
translated: At the time of cultivating that, one should focus on all beings, all those who are included in the three realms, with a loving mind, wishing for their happiness and delighting in their being free from harm.

original: gal te yid 'di de ltar gtod pa na cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yid 'di de ltar gtod pa na cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one directs the mind in that way, what will happen?

original: chags pa'i 'dam gyis yid ni zin par gyur //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chags pa'i 'dam gyis yid ni zin par gyur // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The mind is seized by the mud of attachment.

original: byams pa'i sems kyis bde bar 'dod pa na rjes su dga' ba'i sems dang 'brel ba'i sred pa'i 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: byams pa'i sems kyis bde bar 'dod pa na rjes su dga' ba'i sems dang 'brel ba'i sred pa'i 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: The mind that wishes for happiness with a loving mind is connected with the mind of delight, and the craving of attachment arises.

original: de nyid ni sems zhen ching bying ba'i gnas su gyur pas na 'dam ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni sems zhen ching bying ba'i gnas su gyur pas na 'dam ste /
translated: That itself is a mud, because it is a place where the mind becomes attached and sinks.

original: de lta bus yid ni kun nas zin par gyur to //
analyzed: de lta bus yid ni kun nas zin par gyur to //
translated: The mind is completely seized by that.

original: 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: mngon par dga' ba dang bcas pa'i byams pa'i sems kyis 'gro ba rnams la chags pa'i kun tu 'dzin pa skye bar 'gyur bas na de nyid ni nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba dang bcas pa'i byams pa'i sems kyis 'gro ba rnams la chags pa'i kun tu 'dzin pa skye bar 'gyur bas na de nyid ni nyes pa yin no //
translated: Since the mind of love, which is full of delight, generates the grasping attachment to beings, that is the fault.

original: de ltar yang ji ltar sgrub par byed ce na /🔽de'i phyir / chags pa'i 'dam gyi dri ma rnam dag phyir //
analyzed: de ltar yang ji ltar sgrub par byed ce na / de'i phyir / chags pa'i 'dam gyi dri ma rnam dag phyir //
translated: How is that accomplished?🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to purify the stain of the mud of attachment.

original: chags pa ni dngos po rnams la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa ni dngos po rnams la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: Attachment is the adherence to things.

original: de nyid ni 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pas na 'dam lta bu'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pas na 'dam lta bu'o //
translated: Since that is the cause of cyclic existence, it is like a mud.

original: de nyid ni dri ma ste rang gi yid bdag dang bdag gir zhen pa'i skyon chags pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni dri ma ste rang gi yid bdag dang bdag gir zhen pa'i skyon chags pa'o //
translated: That is the stain, the fault of the adherence to the self and entities connected to the self.

original: de lta bu'i dri ma rnam par dag cing sbyang ba'i phyir ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i dri ma rnam par dag cing sbyang ba'i phyir ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: In order to purify and remove such a stain, what should be done?

original: gal te de ni btang snyoms chus 'khru yang //
analyzed: gal te de ni btang snyoms chus 'khru yang //
translated: If that is washed with the water of equanimity,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said.

original: 'dam gyi dri ma lta bur chags pa de shes rab kyi blos nyes pa yin par shes par bya la /
analyzed: 'dam gyi dri ma lta bur chags pa de shes rab kyi blos nyes pa yin par shes par bya la /
translated: Attachment, which is like the stain of mud, should be recognized as a fault by the mind of wisdom.

original: 'gro ba thams cad la kun du ltos pa med cing rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang bral ba'i btang snyoms chu lta bus 'khru zhing dri ma sel bar byed pa na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /🔽der ni 'gro kun nyam thag sel ba yi //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad la kun du ltos pa med cing rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang bral ba'i btang snyoms chu lta bus 'khru zhing dri ma sel bar byed pa na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na / der ni 'gro kun nyam thag sel ba yi //
translated: What is the fault if one bathes with impartiality like water, which is impartial and free from attachment and aversion to all beings?

original: 'jig @209b rten mgon po snying rje'ang rnam par nyams //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'jig @209b rten mgon po snying rje'ang rnam par nyams // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The protector of the world, whose compassion🔽removes the distress of all beings, would be destroyed.

original: kye 'jig rten gyi mgon po de ltar btang snyoms la bzhag pa'i gnas skabs der ni sems can thams cad 'don par byed pas rab tu 'jug pas 'gro ba thams cad kyi sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa'i snying rje chen po 'jig rten gyi mgon dang skyabs su
analyzed: kye 'jig rten gyi mgon po de ltar btang snyoms la bzhag pa'i gnas skabs der ni sems can thams cad 'don par byed pas rab tu 'jug pas 'gro ba thams cad kyi sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa'i snying rje chen po 'jig rten gyi mgon dang skyabs su
translated: O protector of the world, in that situation of impartiality, the great compassion that removes the suffering of all beings, which is engaged in delivering all beings, would be destroyed and would not exist.

original: gyur pa de yang rnam par nyams shing med par gyur pa des na bdag byang chub sems dpa' nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gyur pa de yang rnam par nyams shing med par gyur pa des na bdag byang chub sems dpa' nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, I would not be a bodhisattva.

original: 'on te snying rje de nyid kyang bsam mod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te snying rje de nyid kyang bsam mod ce na /
translated: But if you think that very compassion would be destroyed,

original: gtso bo gal te snying rje bsgom pa na //
analyzed: gtso bo gal te snying rje bsgom pa na //
translated: If, O Lord, one cultivates compassion,

original: bdag ni mya ngan chen po kun du skye //🔽zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: bdag ni mya ngan chen po kun du skye // zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: great sorrow arises in me.

original: gtso bo zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
translated: O Lord is an exclamation.

original: gal te skyon de mthong nas snying rje nyid bsgom zhing mngon du byed pa na bdag gi yid la snying rje'i tshul las byung ba'i mya ngan zhes bya ba yid kyi gdung ba chen po kun du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te skyon de mthong nas snying rje nyid bsgom zhing mngon du byed pa na bdag gi yid la snying rje'i tshul las byung ba'i mya ngan zhes bya ba yid kyi gdung ba chen po kun du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: If, having seen that fault, one cultivates compassion itself, makes it present, then great sorrow arises in my mind, which is called the distress of mind that arises from the method of compassion.

original: kye ma'o sems can 'di rnams sdug bsngal gyi kun du nyon mongs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i mya ngan gyi sems shin tu gdungs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kye ma'o sems can 'di rnams sdug bsngal gyi kun du nyon mongs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i mya ngan gyi sems shin tu gdungs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the mind is greatly tormented by the thought, “Alas, these sentient beings are afflicted by suffering.”

original: de ci zhig bya zhe na /🔽'di ni zhi phyir gal te dga' bsten na //
analyzed: de ci zhig bya zhe na / 'di ni zhi phyir gal te dga' bsten na //
translated: What is to be done about that?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If one resorts to joy for the sake of pacifying that,

original: snying rje las byung ba'i gdung ba zhi zhing mnyam par gnas pa'i phyir dga' ba zhes bya ba'i tshangs pa'i gnas la brten cing gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: snying rje las byung ba'i gdung ba zhi zhing mnyam par gnas pa'i phyir dga' ba zhes bya ba'i tshangs pa'i gnas la brten cing gnas par gyur na /
translated: When one is based on and abides in the Brahmavihāra called “joy” which is the pacification and evenness of the distress that arises from compassion,

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: what happens?

original: g-yo ba'i sems ni rgod pa nyid du gyur //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: g-yo ba'i sems ni rgod pa nyid du gyur // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The agitated mind becomes excited.

original: de ltar dga' ba'i dngos po la yid gtang ba na yul la g-yo zhing rnam par 'gyur ba'i yid gzengs bstod pa'i dbang gis rgod cing khengs pa nyid du 'gyur gyi rang bzhin zhi bar mi gnas so //
analyzed: de ltar dga' ba'i dngos po la yid gtang ba na yul la g-yo zhing rnam par 'gyur ba'i yid gzengs bstod pa'i dbang gis rgod cing khengs pa nyid du 'gyur gyi rang bzhin zhi bar mi gnas so //
translated: When the mind is thus directed to the object of joy, the mind that is agitated and transformed in the object becomes excited and inflated by the power of the exaltation of mind. It does not abide in its natural peace.

original: 'on te de nyid zhi bar bya ba'i phyir thabs gzhan zhig la bsten mod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te de nyid zhi bar bya ba'i phyir thabs gzhan zhig la bsten mod ce na /
translated: But if one resorts to another method in order to pacify that, what happens?

original: gal te dga' ba zhi phyir skyo skyed na //
analyzed: gal te dga' ba zhi phyir skyo skyed na //
translated: If one generates sadness in order to pacify joy,

original: de ru sems ni dbang med zhum par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ru sems ni dbang med zhum par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the mind becomes powerless and depressed there.

original: dga' bas dregs pa'i sems zhi bar bya ba'i phyir skyo ba skyed par byed pa'i dngos po sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa la sogs pa la dmigs nas skyo ba skyed par byed pa na /
analyzed: dga' bas dregs pa'i sems zhi bar bya ba'i phyir skyo ba skyed par byed pa'i dngos po sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa la sogs pa la dmigs nas skyo ba skyed par byed pa na /
translated: In order to pacify a mind arrogant with joy, one should generate a sense of disenchantment by focusing on the aspects of suffering and so forth, which are the things that generate disenchantment.🔽At that time, the cause of generating disenchantment is the mind itself, which is powerless to be elated and unable to focus on the object.

original: gnas skabs de ru ni skyo bar byed pa nyid kyi rgyu sems rang dbang med par zhum zhing dmigs pa la gtod mi nus par rtsol ba zhan pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don @210a * //
analyzed: gnas skabs de ru ni skyo bar byed pa nyid kyi rgyu sems rang dbang med par zhum zhing dmigs pa la gtod mi nus par rtsol ba zhan pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don @210a * //
translated: The meaning is that the effort is weak.

original: to ; / de ltar gyur pa na spro bas gzengs bstod na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: to ; / de ltar gyur pa na spro bas gzengs bstod na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one is in that state, what is the fault if one encourages oneself with joy?

original: gal te brtson pas dman las bstod pa na /
analyzed: gal te brtson pas dman las bstod pa na /
translated: If one praises oneself for being inferior in effort,

original: nga rgyal dgra yi spyod yul dag tu 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nga rgyal dgra yi spyod yul dag tu 'gyur // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: one will be in the domain of the enemy, pride.

original: brtson zhing 'bad pa dang ldan pas sems zhum zhing dman pa las dregs pa skye bar byed pa'i tshul gang yang rung bas gzengs bstod par byas na yang nyes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: brtson zhing 'bad pa dang ldan pas sems zhum zhing dman pa las dregs pa skye bar byed pa'i tshul gang yang rung bas gzengs bstod par byas na yang nyes par 'gyur te /
translated: If one encourages oneself in any way whatsoever by being diligent and striving, and by being elated with joy from a depressed and inferior state of mind, there is a fault.

original: ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is that?

original: nga rgyal gyi dbang du gyur te /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi dbang du gyur te /
translated: One comes under the influence of pride.

original: nga rgyal dang lhag pa'i nga rgyal la sogs dgra ltar dge ba'i nor 'joms pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur zhing de'i dbang du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang lhag pa'i nga rgyal la sogs dgra ltar dge ba'i nor 'joms pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur zhing de'i dbang du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Pride, excessive pride, and so on become like enemies, destroying the wealth of virtue, and one comes under their influence.

original: nga rgyal zhes bya ba'i dgra bo de'i bran du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nga rgyal zhes bya ba'i dgra bo de'i bran du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one becomes a slave of that enemy called pride.

original: de ltar tshangs pa'i gnas pa bzhi la dmigs pa na sems kyi skyon du gyur pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar tshangs pa'i gnas pa bzhi la dmigs pa na sems kyi skyon du gyur pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the faults that arise in the mind when focusing on the four divine abodes,

original: da ni nga rgyal gyi gnyen po bsten pa na skyon du 'gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir //🔽de'i gnyen por thams cad stong nyid sgom //
analyzed: da ni nga rgyal gyi gnyen po bsten pa na skyon du 'gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir // de'i gnyen por thams cad stong nyid sgom //
translated: now, in order to teach the faults that arise when relying on the antidote to pride,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said:🔽The antidote to that is meditating on emptiness.

original: nga rgyal zhes bya ba'i dgra bo de bsal ba'i phyir de'i gnyen por gyur pa'i sems kyi 'jug pa thams cad sel ba thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya ba /
analyzed: nga rgyal zhes bya ba'i dgra bo de bsal ba'i phyir de'i gnyen por gyur pa'i sems kyi 'jug pa thams cad sel ba thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya ba /
translated: In order to eliminate that enemy called pride, the antidote to that is the mental engagement called emptiness of all.

original: rgya ba dang mi rgyu ba dngos po thams cad rnam par 'jig pa'i stong pa nyid bsgoms pas pa rgyal la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad ldog par 'gyur ba ni gcig gi gcig spangs pa'i mtshan nyid mun pa dang snang ba lta bu'am /
analyzed: rgya ba dang mi rgyu ba dngos po thams cad rnam par 'jig pa'i stong pa nyid bsgoms pas pa rgyal la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad ldog par 'gyur ba ni gcig gi gcig spangs pa'i mtshan nyid mun pa dang snang ba lta bu'am /
translated: Since one meditates on the emptiness that is the complete destruction of all things, both those that expand and those that do not, all unfavorable conditions such as pride are reversed. This is like the case of light and darkness, which are characterized by the mutual exclusion of one from the other.

original: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid gzugs can gyi rdzas yul bum pa dang snam bu lta bu dang 'dra ba yin pa las /
analyzed: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid gzugs can gyi rdzas yul bum pa dang snam bu lta bu dang 'dra ba yin pa las /
translated: Or it is like the case of material substances, which are characterized by the mutual exclusion of one from the other, as in the case of a pot and a cloth.

original: 'dir gzugs can gyi lhan cig mi gnas pa bsal te stong pa nyid kyi don sgom pa la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzugs can gyi lhan cig mi gnas pa bsal te stong pa nyid kyi don sgom pa la bya'o //
translated: Here, the mutual exclusion of material substances is set aside, and one should meditate on the meaning of emptiness.

original: de ltar stong nyid kyi don sgom pa na yang cir 'gyur zhe na /🔽der ni gzhan gyi don la brtson med gyur //
analyzed: de ltar stong nyid kyi don sgom pa na yang cir 'gyur zhe na / der ni gzhan gyi don la brtson med gyur //
translated: What happens when one meditates on the meaning of emptiness in this way?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It says, “One does not strive for the benefit of others.”

original: thams cad stong par sgom pa'i gnas skabs der rang dang sems can ma dmigs pa'i phyir 'gro ba gzhan dag smin cing 'gro ba'i don bya ba la brtson zhing 'bad pa med de /
analyzed: thams cad stong par sgom pa'i gnas skabs der rang dang sems can ma dmigs pa'i phyir 'gro ba gzhan dag smin cing 'gro ba'i don bya ba la brtson zhing 'bad pa med de /
translated: At the time of meditating on everything as empty, since neither oneself nor sentient beings are observed, one does not strive and exert oneself in ripening other beings and working for the welfare of beings.

original: de las ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one turns away from that.

original: skyon de ltar gyur pas ci zhig dmigs she na /🔽ci'i phyir / gal te de yi don du kun rdzob bsten //
analyzed: skyon de ltar gyur pas ci zhig dmigs she na / ci'i phyir / gal te de yi don du kun rdzob bsten //
translated: What is observed due to that fault?🔽Why?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “If one relies on the conventional for that purpose.”

original: stong @210b pa nyid du blta ba'i skyon de bsal ba'i don du kun rdzob ces bya ba yang dag pa'i don mthong ba la sgrib pa dngos po'i chos la rten cing gnas par byed pa na'o //
analyzed: stong @210b pa nyid du blta ba'i skyon de bsal ba'i don du kun rdzob ces bya ba yang dag pa'i don mthong ba la sgrib pa dngos po'i chos la rten cing gnas par byed pa na'o //
translated: In order to eliminate the fault of viewing emptiness, one relies on the conventional, which is the obscuration to seeing the perfect meaning, the phenomena of entities.

original: de las kyang skyon ci zhig 'byung zhe na /🔽der yid nor gyi bsam pa skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de las kyang skyon ci zhig 'byung zhe na / der yid nor gyi bsam pa skye bar 'gyur //
translated: What fault arises from that?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “The conception of the mind as a treasure arises there.”

original: de ltar dngos po la sems sbyar ba nyo tshong la sogs pa ci nas kyang nor spel zhing sgrub pa'i bsam pa skye bas yid gdung zhing nyon mongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po la sems sbyar ba nyo tshong la sogs pa ci nas kyang nor spel zhing sgrub pa'i bsam pa skye bas yid gdung zhing nyon mongs par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, when the mind is applied to wealth, the thought of acquiring and increasing wealth arises in every way, such as through buying and selling, and the mind becomes tormented and defiled.

original: kun rdzob la rten cing sbyin pa la sogs gtong bar 'dod pa na gser dang nor bu la sogs pa nor gyi dngos po du ma dag nye bar sogs pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob la rten cing sbyin pa la sogs gtong bar 'dod pa na gser dang nor bu la sogs pa nor gyi dngos po du ma dag nye bar sogs pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When one wishes to give gifts and so on in dependence on the conventional, the thought of accumulating many things such as gold, jewels, and so on arises in the mind.

original: gal te de ltar nor sog pa'i bsam pa bskyed kyang nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar nor sog pa'i bsam pa bskyed kyang nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: If one generates the thought of accumulating wealth in this way, what is the problem?

original: gal te yid ni nor sog la sbyar na //
analyzed: gal te yid ni nor sog la sbyar na //
translated: If the mind is applied to accumulating wealth,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it will be difficult to practice generosity.

original: gal te nor la sred pa bskyed nas bsam gtan la sogs pa'i khyad par can gyi sbyor ba spangs nas rang gi yid gser la sogs pa nor sog cing sdud pa la nye bar sbyar zhing sred pa skyed na de'i tshe yid phyin ci log gi dbang du
analyzed: gal te nor la sred pa bskyed nas bsam gtan la sogs pa'i khyad par can gyi sbyor ba spangs nas rang gi yid gser la sogs pa nor sog cing sdud pa la nye bar sbyar zhing sred pa skyed na de'i tshe yid phyin ci log gi dbang du
translated: If one generates craving for wealth and abandons the special practices of meditative concentration and so on, and if one applies the mind to accumulating and gathering wealth such as gold and so on, and generates craving, at that time the mind is under the power of error.

original: gyur pa nyid yin pas //
analyzed: gyur pa nyid yin pas //
translated: because of that,

original: nyes pa kun gyi chang ni ldud 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: nyes pa kun gyi chang ni ldud 'gyur zhing //
translated: he is the one who pours out the liquor of all faults.

original: zhes bya ba gzhan gyis brnyas pa na bag med par gyur pa dang / lus nyon mongs la sogs pa'i nyes pa 'byung la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gzhan gyis brnyas pa na bag med par gyur pa dang / lus nyon mongs la sogs pa'i nyes pa 'byung la /
translated: When he is despised by others, he becomes heedless, and faults such as bodily dejection arise.

original: nyes pa de nyid kyis ni de ni nor gyis skyob pa'i skyes bu la nyes pa'i rgyur gyur pa chang lta bu de ldud cing skye ba yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa de nyid kyis ni de ni nor gyis skyob pa'i skyes bu la nyes pa'i rgyur gyur pa chang lta bu de ldud cing skye ba yin no //
translated: And because of those faults, he is the one who pours out the liquor of faults, which is like the cause of the protection of wealth for a person.

original: gzhan yang nyes pa ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /🔽dregs dang rmongs pa'i gnyid kyis myos pas na //
analyzed: gzhan yang nyes pa ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na / dregs dang rmongs pa'i gnyid kyis myos pas na //
translated: What other faults are there?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “intoxicated by the sleep of pride and delusion,”

original: rgyu de dag nyid kyis sems bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa'i dbye ba mi shes pas myos par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu de dag nyid kyis sems bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa'i dbye ba mi shes pas myos par byas pa yin no //
translated: because of those causes, the mind is intoxicated, not knowing the difference between what should be done and what should not be done.

original: gang gis myos par byas she na /
analyzed: gang gis myos par byas she na /
translated: By what is he intoxicated?

original: dregs dang rmongs pa'i gnyid kyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dregs dang rmongs pa'i gnyid kyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: By the sleep of pride and delusion.

original: ra ro ba'i skyes bu dang 'dra bar dregs shing khengs pa dang rmongs pas blo gros nyams pa dang / gnyid dang rmugs pa'i dbang du gyur pa ste dregs pas ni rmongs pa yin la /
analyzed: ra ro ba'i skyes bu dang 'dra bar dregs shing khengs pa dang rmongs pas blo gros nyams pa dang / gnyid dang rmugs pa'i dbang du gyur pa ste dregs pas ni rmongs pa yin la /
translated: Like a person who is drunk, one's mind is impaired by arrogance, conceit, and delusion, and one is overcome by sleep and lethargy.

original: rmongs pas ni gnyid kyis myos par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pas ni gnyid kyis myos par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: Arrogance causes delusion, and delusion causes sleep and lethargy.

original: de dag las kyang nyes pa ci zhig 'byung zhe na /🔽mngon 'dod thams cad bcom pa nyid du gyur //
analyzed: de dag las kyang nyes pa ci zhig 'byung zhe na / mngon 'dod thams cad bcom pa nyid du gyur //
translated: What faults arise from these?🔽All one's goals are destroyed.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /🔽mthong ba'i chos dang skye ba gzhan du dam pas bsgrub par bya ba gang dag yin pa'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te / mthong ba'i chos dang skye ba gzhan du dam pas bsgrub par bya ba gang dag yin pa'am /
translated: All one's goals are destroyed.

original: mngon @211a * //
analyzed: mngon @211a * //
translated: Whatever goals are to be accomplished by the holy ones in this life or in other lives,🔽or whatever goals are the causes of high status and the definite good,

original: par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don thams cad bcom zhing brlag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don thams cad bcom zhing brlag par 'gyur ro //
translated: all one's desired goals are destroyed and lost.

original: nyid ces bya ba ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: The word only is for emphasis.

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The condensed meaning of this verse is as follows:

original: nor sog pa sred pa yin la de ni yongs su brnyes par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnams kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: nor sog pa sred pa yin la de ni yongs su brnyes par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnams kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: The craving for accumulating wealth is the cause of the faults of completely losing it and so on.

original: de yang lan tshva'i chu bo'i mdo las /
analyzed: de yang lan tshva'i chu bo'i mdo las /
translated: The Laltsiwa Bo states:🔽This craving destroys all respect

original: 'di de gus pa thams cad dang // yon tan rnams ni 'jig byed de //🔽gang gis ri rab ltar lci ba'ang //
analyzed: 'di de gus pa thams cad dang // yon tan rnams ni 'jig byed de // gang gis ri rab ltar lci ba'ang //
translated: and all good qualities.🔽It makes what is heavy like Mount Meru

original: shing bal lta bur yang bar byed //🔽sred pas dgun gyi dus su ni //
analyzed: shing bal lta bur yang bar byed // sred pas dgun gyi dus su ni //
translated: as light as cotton.🔽Craving makes the snowy mountains

original: kha ba can yang grang ba'ang //
analyzed: kha ba can yang grang ba'ang //
translated: cold even in the winter.

original: mya ngan dag tu nyi ma'i zer //
analyzed: mya ngan dag tu nyi ma'i zer //
translated: It makes the sun's rays

original: 'bar ba dag kyang tshar mi tshor //🔽sred pas gting mtha' med pa dang // gnod pa du mas nyam nga ba'i //
analyzed: 'bar ba dag kyang tshar mi tshor // sred pas gting mtha' med pa dang // gnod pa du mas nyam nga ba'i //
translated: not feel hot even in the summer.🔽Craving makes the fathomless,🔽fearful ocean

original: rgya mtsho'ang glang rjes tsam nyid du //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'ang glang rjes tsam nyid du //
translated: seem as small as an elephant's footprint.

original: shin tu chung ba nyid du sems //
analyzed: shin tu chung ba nyid du sems //
translated: It makes it seem very small.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is taught that craving is not a proper state of mind.

original: de ltar sems mi mnyam pa'i tshul bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sems mi mnyam pa'i tshul bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the improper state of mind,

original: nor bsags pa las snying por bya ba'i sbyin pa nyid du yang rjes su mi mthun pa'i sems bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nor bsags pa las snying por bya ba'i sbyin pa nyid du yang rjes su mi mthun pa'i sems bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the mind that is not in accord with the giving of wealth that is accumulated, he says:

original: gang tshe bdag ni sbyin par 'dod na yang //
analyzed: gang tshe bdag ni sbyin par 'dod na yang //
translated: When I want to give,

original: ser sna stobs can gyis ni nges par 'dzin //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ser sna stobs can gyis ni nges par 'dzin // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: I am definitely held by the powerful miserliness.

original: dus gang gi tshe dka' bas bsags pa'i nor slong ba rnams la bdag sbyin par bya bar 'dod cing 'gyed par spro ba na yang ser sna stobs can zhes bya ba dngos po la mngon par zhen cing chags par byed pa'i ser sna'i kun tu 'ching bar thog
analyzed: dus gang gi tshe dka' bas bsags pa'i nor slong ba rnams la bdag sbyin par bya bar 'dod cing 'gyed par spro ba na yang ser sna stobs can zhes bya ba dngos po la mngon par zhen cing chags par byed pa'i ser sna'i kun tu 'ching bar thog
translated: At whatever time I want to give, to distribute, the wealth that is accumulated with difficulty to the petitioners, then the powerful miserliness, the powerful fetter of miserliness that is the attachment to things, the powerful one that has existed since beginningless time, definitely holds me.

original: ma med pa'i dus can stobs dang ldan pa dag gis nges par 'dzin cing blo la dam por chags pas gtong ba'i mthu med par byed do //
analyzed: ma med pa'i dus can stobs dang ldan pa dag gis nges par 'dzin cing blo la dam por chags pas gtong ba'i mthu med par byed do //
translated: It makes me powerless to give by causing my mind to be tightly attached.

original: de'i tshe ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What should I do at that time?

original: gal te de bsal ci ste byin gyur na'ang //
analyzed: gal te de bsal ci ste byin gyur na'ang //
translated: If I remove it, and give,

original: de tshe yun ring dus su rjes su 'gyod //
analyzed: de tshe yun ring dus su rjes su 'gyod //
translated: then I will regret it for a long time.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse text says:🔽Even if you give a few things to a few fields

original: gnyen po'i phyogs sgom pa'i stobs kyis ser sna de bsal zhing spangs nas zhing du gyur pa 'ga' zhig la dngos po 'ga' zhig byin par gyur na yang /
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs sgom pa'i stobs kyis ser sna de bsal zhing spangs nas zhing du gyur pa 'ga' zhig la dngos po 'ga' zhig byin par gyur na yang /
translated: out of a sense of shame,

original: de'i tshe slar yang ser sna'i sred pa las byung ba'i sems kyi gdung bas yun ring po'i dus su rdzas btang ba rjes su 'gyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe slar yang ser sna'i sred pa las byung ba'i sems kyi gdung bas yun ring po'i dus su rdzas btang ba rjes su 'gyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: you will later regret it.🔽Even if you stop it through firm faith,

original: gal te mos pa brtan pas sems de slar bzlog pa na yang cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mos pa brtan pas sems de slar bzlog pa na yang cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: what will happen?

original: @211b gal te dad pas slar yang dad byas kyang //
analyzed: @211b gal te dad pas slar yang dad byas kyang //
translated: Even if you give again out of faith,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: you will later regret it.

original: dad pa ni sems kyi dang ba ste /
analyzed: dad pa ni sems kyi dang ba ste /
translated: Faith is clarity of mind.

original: yid ches pa dang yon tan mngon par 'dod pa'i dad pas sems kyi dri ma bsal te dang zhing rnyog pa med par byas kyang 'jig rten gzhan gyi 'bras bur de ltung 'gyur zhes bya ba rdzas btang ba'i 'bras bu yang mngon par zhen cing lan la re
analyzed: yid ches pa dang yon tan mngon par 'dod pa'i dad pas sems kyi dri ma bsal te dang zhing rnyog pa med par byas kyang 'jig rten gzhan gyi 'bras bur de ltung 'gyur zhes bya ba rdzas btang ba'i 'bras bu yang mngon par zhen cing lan la re
translated: Even though one has removed the stains of the mind by means of the faith of conviction and the faith of desire for good qualities, and has made the mind clear and unclouded, still, the mind becomes flawed by the attitude of clinging to the result of giving, and by the hope for a reward.

original: ba'i tshul gyis sems de skyon chags par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba'i tshul gyis sems de skyon chags par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one gives with the hope of getting something in return.

original: de ltar skyon chags pa na /
analyzed: de ltar skyon chags pa na /
translated: When it is flawed in this way,

original: mi rtag shes pas re ba med byas na //
analyzed: mi rtag shes pas re ba med byas na //
translated: one should reflect on the impermanence of the gift, the giver, and the recipient, and on the fact that the result of giving is also impermanent.

original: zhes bya ba 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa zhes smos pa'i ston pa'i bka' dran zhing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa zhes smos pa'i ston pa'i bka' dran zhing /
translated: Thus, one should reflect on the Teacher's words, which state that all compounded things are impermanent.🔽Having examined the impure mode of impermanence, one should understand that the gift and so on are not permanent, but are momentary.

original: mi rtag pa'i tshul du ma dag pa la brtags nas rdzas la sogs pa rtag pa med de skad cig ma'i tshul yin par shes par bya ba'i gnyen po des lan la re ba'am sbyin pa'i rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i longs spyod la sogs pa la
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i tshul du ma dag pa la brtags nas rdzas la sogs pa rtag pa med de skad cig ma'i tshul yin par shes par bya ba'i gnyen po des lan la re ba'am sbyin pa'i rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i longs spyod la sogs pa la
translated: By this antidote, one should eliminate the hope for a reward or the enjoyment that arises from the evolution of the act of giving.

original: ma chags par byas nas sems kyi rnyog pa de bsal ba na yang rjes su mthun par gnas te /
analyzed: ma chags par byas nas sems kyi rnyog pa de bsal ba na yang rjes su mthun par gnas te /
translated: When one has removed the turbidity of mind by being free of attachment, one still abides in accordance with the Dharma.

original: ci zhig gi zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig gi zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rgyu mtshan med pas le los rnam par zhum //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med pas le los rnam par zhum //
translated: One is discouraged by the absence of a reason.

original: zhes bya ba rgyu sbyin pa btang ba 'dis longs spyod chen po 'di lta bu zhig thob pas na de lta bu'i 'bras bu bsgrub pa'i phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa rgyur gyur pa rnams la 'bad par byed pa yin na ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyu sbyin pa btang ba 'dis longs spyod chen po 'di lta bu zhig thob pas na de lta bu'i 'bras bu bsgrub pa'i phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa rgyur gyur pa rnams la 'bad par byed pa yin na ;
translated: One strives for the causes, generosity, etc., in order to achieve such a result as that.

original: 'bras bu la re ba med par byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu la re ba med par byas pa'i phyir /
translated: But because one has no hope for a result,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos la rtsol mi 'dod cing le lo'i dbang gis sems rnam par zhum zhing sgyid zhan pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽rang gi don la nyams par brjod de bshags pa bstan nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos la rtsol mi 'dod cing le lo'i dbang gis sems rnam par zhum zhing sgyid zhan pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // rang gi don la nyams par brjod de bshags pa bstan nas /
translated: one does not want to strive for the qualities of generosity, etc., and one is discouraged, one’s mind becomes slack and weak, through the influence of laziness.🔽Having explained the confession of the degeneration of one’s own aim,

original: gzhan gyi don las kyang nyams par gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don las kyang nyams par gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: in order to demonstrate the degeneration of the aim of others, he says:

original: mgon po 'jig rten sdug bsngal gyis rab gzir //
analyzed: mgon po 'jig rten sdug bsngal gyis rab gzir //
translated: The protector is greatly oppressed by the world’s suffering.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /🔽kye mgon po sems can gyi 'jig rten 'di dag 'du byed la sogs pa'am skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gsum mam /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te / kye mgon po sems can gyi 'jig rten 'di dag 'du byed la sogs pa'am skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gsum mam /
translated: This is what is meant.🔽Alas, protector! This world of sentient beings is greatly oppressed, greatly afflicted, by the three sufferings of conditioned existence and so on, or by the eight kinds of suffering that are well known.

original: brgyad du grags pa dag gis rab tu gzir cing shin tu nyam thag par byas pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: brgyad du grags pa dag gis rab tu gzir cing shin tu nyam thag par byas pa de dag kyang /
translated: And those who are now my friends,🔽having seen that they were my relatives in the past as well,🔽having seen with the mind and reflected with the mind,🔽I will strive to benefit them.🔽And not only now, but also in the past,

original: sngon tshe'ang gnyen du gyur pa la bltas nas zhes bya ba 'khor ba'i gnas 'dir skye ba brgyud pa'i tshe gzhan dag tu yang pha ma la sogs pa gnyen du gyur cing bdag dang rjes su 'brel bar gyur pa yin par @212a * //
analyzed: sngon tshe'ang gnyen du gyur pa la bltas nas zhes bya ba 'khor ba'i gnas 'dir skye ba brgyud pa'i tshe gzhan dag tu yang pha ma la sogs pa gnyen du gyur cing bdag dang rjes su 'brel bar gyur pa yin par @212a * //
translated: in this place of cyclic existence, in other lives as well, they were my relatives, my parents and so on, and were connected with me.

original: blos bltas shing yid kyis bsams nas so //
analyzed: blos bltas shing yid kyis bsams nas so //
translated: Having seen that with the mind and reflected on it with the mind,

original: yang zhes bya ba ni da ltar 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni da ltar 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
translated: and not only now, but also in the past,

original: rgyu de las brten nas ci zhig byed ce na /
analyzed: rgyu de las brten nas ci zhig byed ce na /
translated: what will I do on the basis of that cause?

original: gal te gzhan don spyod par 'dod na yang //
analyzed: gal te gzhan don spyod par 'dod na yang //
translated: If I wish to engage in benefiting others,

original: zhes bya ba sems can sdug bsngal gyis nyen pa dag gnyen du ma gyur pa med pas de rnams kyi gnod pa bsal ba'i phyir sbyin pa la sogs pas gzhan gyi don bya'i /
analyzed: zhes bya ba sems can sdug bsngal gyis nyen pa dag gnyen du ma gyur pa med pas de rnams kyi gnod pa bsal ba'i phyir sbyin pa la sogs pas gzhan gyi don bya'i /
translated: Since there is no sentient being who has not been a close relative of mine, I should benefit others through generosity and so forth in order to remove their harms.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod par 'dod cing bya ba de rdzogs par rtsom pa na yang de'i ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod par 'dod cing bya ba de rdzogs par rtsom pa na yang de'i ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one wishes to practice the bodhisattva deeds and begins to complete those deeds, what will happen?

original: bdag tu 'du shes pa yi dbang med 'dzin /🔽zhes bya ba smos te /🔽nye du la sogs pa la zhen pa las bag chags las byung ba'i bdag dang bdag gi 'du shes kyis rang dbang med par 'dzin cing dbang du byed pas bdag med pa la bdag tu lta ba'i phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de ltar bdag tu lta ba la nyes pa ci zhig yod ce na ;🔽bdag tu lta ba'i rjes su nga rgyal 'brang //

analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni yod do zhes bya ba ni bdag tu lta ba ste /
translated: The statement “the self exists” is the view of self.

original: des kyang nyes pa ci zhig skyed ce na /
analyzed: des kyang nyes pa ci zhig skyed ce na /

original: de ni nga'i zhes yongs su 'dzin par byed //🔽ces bya ba smos te /🔽nga rgyal las byung ba'i ltung ba de yang nga'i zhes bya ba'am /
