analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na de las /
translated: What is more harmful than that?🔽What is more harmful than that?🔽What is more harmful than that?🔽What is more harmful than that?🔽What is more harmful than that?🔽What is more harmful than that?🔽What is more harmful than that?🔽What is more harmful than that?

original: sems bzlog cing spang bar rigs pa yin pa las de ltar yang bzod par mi nus par bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: sems bzlog cing spang bar rigs pa yin pa las de ltar yang bzod par mi nus par bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: It is therefore appropriate to turn away from and abandon the mind.🔽

original: gal te sna tshogs sdug bsngal rgyur gyur pa'i //
analyzed: gal te sna tshogs sdug bsngal rgyur gyur pa'i //
translated: It is right to turn away from and abandon the mind, but it has been shown that one is unable to be patient in that way.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽If anger is the cause of various sufferings

original: 'di ltar bzod pa ni bde ba thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bzod pa ni bde ba thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin la /
translated: In this way, patience is the source of all happiness,

original: khro ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa yin pas /
analyzed: khro ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa yin pas /
translated: and anger is the basis of all suffering.

original: gal te sna tshogs sdug bsngal rgyur gyur pa'i //
analyzed: gal te sna tshogs sdug bsngal rgyur gyur pa'i //
translated: Therefore, if anger is the cause of various sufferings

original: zhes bya ba 'jig rten 'di dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal lus dang sems kyi cha las byung ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gzhi dang rgyur gyur pa ni zhe sdang yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'jig rten 'di dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal lus dang sems kyi cha las byung ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gzhi dang rgyur gyur pa ni zhe sdang yin te /
translated: The basis and cause of the various sufferings of this world and the next, which arise from the physical and mental aspects, is hatred.

original: de las ni sems can la 'tshe bar byed pa 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las ni sems can la 'tshe bar byed pa 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because from it arises the harm of sentient beings.

original: gzhan la gnod pa byed pa las bzlog na //
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa byed pa las bzlog na //
translated: Therefore, if one turns away from harming others

original: zhes bya ba khong khro ba las byung ba'i rgyus gzhan la gnod cing sdug bsngal bar byed pa las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba khong khro ba las byung ba'i rgyus gzhan la gnod cing sdug bsngal bar byed pa las /
translated: The cause that arises from anger is the harm and suffering of others.

original: khro ba'i nyes pa rnams dran pa'i sgo nas de las sems rjes su bzlog cing gnyen po dran pas bzod pa sten par byed pa na'o //
analyzed: khro ba'i nyes pa rnams dran pa'i sgo nas de las sems rjes su bzlog cing gnyen po dran pas bzod pa sten par byed pa na'o //
translated: One should cultivate patience by recalling the faults of anger and turning the mind away from it, by relying on the antidote.

original: de ltar gnas pa'i tshe cing 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa'i tshe cing 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens when one abides in that way?

original: skye bo ngan pa nyes med dgrar gyur pa //
analyzed: skye bo ngan pa nyes med dgrar gyur pa //
translated: The verse says, Evil people, who are faultless enemies,

original: ral gri'i so ltar gdug pas de 'khrug byed //🔽ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ral gri'i so ltar gdug pas de 'khrug byed // ces bya ba smos te /
translated: agitate it with malice, like the edge of a sword.

original: bzod par mi nus kyi blo 'khrugs shing sems kyi rgyun rnyog pa can du byed do //
analyzed: bzod par mi nus kyi blo 'khrugs shing sems kyi rgyun rnyog pa can du byed do //
translated: One is unable to be patient, and the mind is agitated and the continuum of the mind becomes turbid.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By whom?

original: skye bo ngan pa nyes med dgrar gyur pa //
analyzed: skye bo ngan pa nyes med dgrar gyur pa //
translated: Evil people, who are faultless enemies,

original: ral gri'i so ltar gdug pas de 'khrug byed //
analyzed: ral gri'i so ltar gdug pas de 'khrug byed //
translated: agitate it with malice, like the edge of a sword.

original: zhes bya ba skye bo'i tshogs tshul khrims dang bzod pa la sogs pa dam @214a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba skye bo'i tshogs tshul khrims dang bzod pa la sogs pa dam @214a * //
translated: The assembly of people, who are disciplined by morality, patience, and so on,

original: pa'i spyod pa dang bral ba rang bzhin ngan par gyur pa rnams ni bdag gis gnod par byas pa'i nyes pa gzhi mod par yang rgyu med pa'i dgra bor gyur cing rjes su sdang bar gyur pa rnams kyi spyod pa ral gri'i so ltar gdug cing zhe gcod🔽par byed pas bdag gi sems 'khrug par byed do //
analyzed: pa'i spyod pa dang bral ba rang bzhin ngan par gyur pa rnams ni bdag gis gnod par byas pa'i nyes pa gzhi mod par yang rgyu med pa'i dgra bor gyur cing rjes su sdang bar gyur pa rnams kyi spyod pa ral gri'i so ltar gdug cing zhe gcod par byed pas bdag gi sems 'khrug par byed do //
translated: their conduct is like the edge of a razor, it is cruel and harsh.

original: 'on te rang bzhin ngan pa de dag la yang bzod pa bsten cing de la brtse bar bya mod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te rang bzhin ngan pa de dag la yang bzod pa bsten cing de la brtse bar bya mod ce na /
translated: But if you say, “I will cultivate patience toward those who are naturally evil and I will have compassion for them,”🔽then I say this:

original: gang cho bdag yid bzod byed 'dod na yang //🔽de tshe de yi nyes spyod 'ching bas bsdams //
analyzed: gang cho bdag yid bzod byed 'dod na yang // de tshe de yi nyes spyod 'ching bas bsdams //
translated: Even if you want to be patient,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: at that time you are bound by the fetters of their bad conduct.

original: dus sam skad cig gang gi tshe bdag gi yid 'khrug par byed pa de las bzlog cing gnyen pos sems dang bar byas te /
analyzed: dus sam skad cig gang gi tshe bdag gi yid 'khrug par byed pa de las bzlog cing gnyen pos sems dang bar byas te /
translated: At whatever time your mind is disturbed, you should turn away from that and pacify your mind with its antidote.

original: bzod pa'i tshul la gnas par byed 'dod na yang de'i tshe rang bzhin ngan pa'i dgra bo de'i rang bzhin ngan zhing gnod pa sna tshogs byed pa'i nye bar spyod pa sna tshogs pa sems kyi 'ching bar gyur pa rnams kyi sems slar yang bsdams shing dam du
analyzed: bzod pa'i tshul la gnas par byed 'dod na yang de'i tshe rang bzhin ngan pa'i dgra bo de'i rang bzhin ngan zhing gnod pa sna tshogs byed pa'i nye bar spyod pa sna tshogs pa sems kyi 'ching bar gyur pa rnams kyi sems slar yang bsdams shing dam du
translated: If you want to abide in the way of patience, then at that time, the mind of the enemy who is evil by nature, and the various behaviors that are harmful and the various objects of experience that are the bonds of the mind, are again bound and tightly

original: 'ching bar byed pas zhe sdang gi dbang du 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'ching bar byed pas zhe sdang gi dbang du 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: bound. The meaning is that one goes under the power of hatred.

original: de ltar na yang de'i nyer spyod btang snyoms su gzhag cing sems glan mod ce na /
analyzed: de ltar na yang de'i nyer spyod btang snyoms su gzhag cing sems glan mod ce na /
translated: Even so, if you say that you set aside his behavior and are patient,🔽it is said:

original: de ni bkag cing yongs bsdams drag po yi //
analyzed: de ni bkag cing yongs bsdams drag po yi //
translated: That is blocked and tightly bound.

original: zhe sdang me yis yongs skems brtse dang bral //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhe sdang me yis yongs skems brtse dang bral //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The fire of hatred burns it, and it is without compassion.

original: de'i nye bar spyod pa ngan pa de las byung ba'i zhe sdang gi 'ching ba de nan gyis bkag cing yongs su bsdams pa na brnags drags pa nyid kyis sems kyi rgyun so na mi gnas shing khong khro ba'i dbang du gyur la /
analyzed: de'i nye bar spyod pa ngan pa de las byung ba'i zhe sdang gi 'ching ba de nan gyis bkag cing yongs su bsdams pa na brnags drags pa nyid kyis sems kyi rgyun so na mi gnas shing khong khro ba'i dbang du gyur la /
translated: When the binding of hatred that arises from that bad conduct is forcibly stopped and completely restrained, by the very intensity of it, the continuum of the mind does not remain in its natural state and falls under the power of anger.

original: des na de las byung ba'i zhe sdang drag po de ni bdag dang gzhan gdung bar byed pas me lta bu yin la /
analyzed: des na de las byung ba'i zhe sdang drag po de ni bdag dang gzhan gdung bar byed pas me lta bu yin la /
translated: Therefore, that intense hatred that arises from that burns both oneself and others, and so is like fire.

original: me de yis 'phags pa chos kyi rlan dang sems bral bar byed pas sems kyi rgyud skems par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: me de yis 'phags pa chos kyi rlan dang sems bral bar byed pas sems kyi rgyud skems par byed pa yin la /
translated: That fire dries up the continuum of the mind, because it separates the mind from the moisture of the Dharma.

original: de lta bu des na sems brtse ba dang bral zhing snying rje med de dam pa'i spyod pa bzod cing dang ba dang bral bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu des na sems brtse ba dang bral zhing snying rje med de dam pa'i spyod pa bzod cing dang ba dang bral bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, it is said that the mind is devoid of love and compassion, and is separated from the patience and clarity of holy conduct.

original: de ltar brtse ba dang bral ba'i sems ni ji ltar gnas she na /🔽ji ltar mi bzad lta ba'i dug can dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar brtse ba dang bral ba'i sems ni ji ltar gnas she na /🔽ji ltar mi bzad lta ba'i dug can dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: How does the mind that is thus devoid of love remain?🔽It is said, “How can the mind remain in a state of anger, like a poisonous snake?”

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba dper bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba dper bya ba ni /
translated: The example is stated in the line “Just as, for example, a poisonous snake.

original: mi bzad lta ba'i dug can dag / ces pa sbrul gang bltas pa tsam gyis gsod par mi nus @214b shing ;
analyzed: mi bzad lta ba'i dug can dag / ces pa sbrul gang bltas pa tsam gyis gsod par mi nus @214b shing ;
translated: ” A poisonous snake is not able to kill by merely being seen.

original: dug can gyi dbugs kyis brgyal bar byed nus pa'o //🔽nang gnas shing ni mkhas rnams spong bar byed //
analyzed: dug can gyi dbugs kyis brgyal bar byed nus pa'o // nang gnas shing ni mkhas rnams spong bar byed //
translated: It is able to kill by the poison in its breath.🔽“The wise avoid the tree that is inhabited by it.”

original: ces bya ba ni shing gang gi khong stong gi cha na de lta bu'i sbrul gdug pas gnas bcas pa'i shing de ni mkhas pa blo dang ldan pa rnams rgyang ring por mod kho na la spong bar byed do ;
analyzed: ces bya ba ni shing gang gi khong stong gi cha na de lta bu'i sbrul gdug pas gnas bcas pa'i shing de ni mkhas pa blo dang ldan pa rnams rgyang ring por mod kho na la spong bar byed do ;
translated: The wise, the intelligent, avoid from afar the tree in which there is a hollow and which is inhabited by such a poisonous snake.

original: / de bzhin khong khro'i spyod pa sbed pa yi //
analyzed: / de bzhin khong khro'i spyod pa sbed pa yi //
translated: The line “Likewise, the wise avoid the person who conceals his angry behavior”🔽is the application of the meaning of the example.

original: bdag gi bsam pa dge ba rnam spong byed //
analyzed: bdag gi bsam pa dge ba rnam spong byed //
translated: The line “and who rejects my virtuous intentions”

original: ces bya ba ni dpe bshad pa'i don bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni dpe bshad pa'i don bstan pa ste /
translated: teaches the meaning of the example that was explained.

original: tshul de bzhin du khong khro ba zhes bya ba sprul gdug pa lta bu'i zhe sdang gi cha las byung ba'i spyod pa gzhan la gnod par byed pa dug lta bu nang na gnas pa'i tshul sbed par byed cing 'chab par byed pa'i bdag gi bsam pa ste
analyzed: tshul de bzhin du khong khro ba zhes bya ba sprul gdug pa lta bu'i zhe sdang gi cha las byung ba'i spyod pa gzhan la gnod par byed pa dug lta bu nang na gnas pa'i tshul sbed par byed cing 'chab par byed pa'i bdag gi bsam pa ste
translated: In the same way, “anger” is the conduct that arises from the part of hatred that is like a poisonous snake, the attitude of the self that conceals and hides the poison that is like the harm done to others.

original: / sems kyi rnam pa shing lta bu ste /
analyzed: / sems kyi rnam pa shing lta bu ste /
translated: The aspect of the mind is like a tree.

original: de dge ba rnams zhes bya ba bslab pa gsum la sogs pa mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i las kyi tshogs rnams kyis spong bar byed cing 'dor bar byed pa 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: de dge ba rnams zhes bya ba bslab pa gsum la sogs pa mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i las kyi tshogs rnams kyis spong bar byed cing 'dor bar byed pa 'di skad ston te /
translated: “The virtuous ones” are the accumulations of karma that are the causes of the higher realms and definite goodness, such as the three trainings. It is taught that they are abandoned and rejected by that.

original: gal te bdag gi sems la mnar sems dang ldan pa'i zhe sdang gi spyod pa sbrul lta bu gnas na de ni snod dug can lta bu yin pas dge ba'i chos rnams mi gnas shing spong bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te bdag gi sems la mnar sems dang ldan pa'i zhe sdang gi spyod pa sbrul lta bu gnas na de ni snod dug can lta bu yin pas dge ba'i chos rnams mi gnas shing spong bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the conduct of hatred that is like a poisonous snake resides in the mind that is full of ill will, then, since it is like a poisonous vessel, the virtuous dharmas do not reside there and are rejected.

original: sems la skyon chags pas chos kyi snod du mi 'gyur ba'i tshul gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems la skyon chags pas chos kyi snod du mi 'gyur ba'i tshul gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Another way of showing how the mind becomes flawed and unfit for the Dharma is🔽stated in the following:

original: nyi ma'i zer gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nyi ma'i zer gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Like a rock scorched by the sun’s rays,🔽The mind of the miserly cannot be moistened by the rain of Dharma.

original: bdag gi bsam pa la dam pa'i chos kyi char 'bab pa don ma mchis so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bdag gi bsam pa la dam pa'i chos kyi char 'bab pa don ma mchis so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The thought here is that the rain of the sublime Dharma will be meaningless.

original: tshul ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: tshul ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: nyi ma'i zer gyis bsregs pa'i rdo 'dra zhing //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nyi ma'i zer gyis bsregs pa'i rdo 'dra zhing // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Like a rock scorched by the sun’s rays,🔽The mind of the miserly cannot be moistened by the rain of Dharma.

original: so ga'i nyi ma'i 'od zer shin tu tsha zhing rno bas bsregs shing gdungs pa'i rdo leb la char 'bab pa dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: so ga'i nyi ma'i 'od zer shin tu tsha zhing rno bas bsregs shing gdungs pa'i rdo leb la char 'bab pa dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: This is similar to rain falling on a rock slab scorched by the intense heat of the summer sun.

original: 'dra zhing zhes bya ba ni chos mthun pa ste /
analyzed: 'dra zhing zhes bya ba ni chos mthun pa ste /
translated: The phrase “like a rock” indicates a similarity.🔽Just as rain falling on a rock face does not appear to penetrate or moisten the rock from within,

original: ji ltar rdo ba'i ngos la char gyi rgyun 'bab tu zin kyang 'phel ba'am myu gu skye ba la sogs pa mi snang zhing nang du yang ba ngas par mi 'gyur gyi phyi rol brlan pa tsam kho nar 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji ltar rdo ba'i ngos la char gyi rgyun 'bab tu zin kyang 'phel ba'am myu gu skye ba la sogs pa mi snang zhing nang du yang ba ngas par mi 'gyur gyi phyi rol brlan pa tsam kho nar 'gyur la /
translated: and only the surface becomes wet,

original: de yang skad cig tsam na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang skad cig tsam na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, it will not appear even for a moment.

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i tshogs nyi ma'i zer ltar drag pa brgya phrag gis gdungs par gyur pa'i sems la ni chos kyi char ba'i don med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i tshogs nyi ma'i zer ltar drag pa brgya phrag gis gdungs par gyur pa'i sems la ni chos kyi char ba'i don med do //
translated: In the same way, the mind that is tormented by the mass of afflictions, like the fierce rays of the sun, is not the object of the rain of Dharma.

original: gzhan yang ji lta bu zhe na /🔽yongs @215a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang ji lta bu zhe na / yongs @215a * //
translated: Moreover, how is that?

original: su bskams pas rdul gyur thal ba 'dra //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: su bskams pas rdul gyur thal ba 'dra // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is like a mass of dust that is completely dried up.

original: ji ltar thal ba'i tshogs nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis yongs su gdungs shing kun nas bskams par byas pa ni rdul du gyur cing shin tu rtsub par gnas par thal ba dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar thal ba'i tshogs nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis yongs su gdungs shing kun nas bskams par byas pa ni rdul du gyur cing shin tu rtsub par gnas par thal ba dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: It is like a mass of dust that is completely dried up and becomes very rough by the rays of the sun.

original: ji ltar thal ba'i phung po bskams shing rtsub par gyur pa la char 'bab tu zin kyang khyad par du gyur ba'i dngos po mi skye bas don med pa yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar thal ba'i phung po bskams shing rtsub par gyur pa la char 'bab tu zin kyang khyad par du gyur ba'i dngos po mi skye bas don med pa yin la /
translated: Just as a rain that falls on a mass of dry, rough dust is meaningless because a special thing does not arise,

original: 'on te mang du 'bab pas brlan pa tsam du gyur pas dus gzhan na de bzhin du gnas so //
analyzed: 'on te mang du 'bab pas brlan pa tsam du gyur pas dus gzhan na de bzhin du gnas so //
translated: or if it is moistened by a lot of rain, it becomes just as it was before and remains that way for another time.

original: tshul de 'dra bar bdag gi sems thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi rnam par rtog pa ngan pa'i tshogs kyis bsdams shing rdul can du gyur pa la chos kyi char 'bab pa don med do //
analyzed: tshul de 'dra bar bdag gi sems thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi rnam par rtog pa ngan pa'i tshogs kyis bsdams shing rdul can du gyur pa la chos kyi char 'bab pa don med do //
translated: In the same way, it is pointless for the rain of Dharma to fall on the mind that is bound by the multitude of bad thoughts that have existed since beginningless time and that is dusty.

original: gzhan yang ji lta bu zhe na /🔽bye ma'i tshogs kyis khyab pa'i lam lta bu //
analyzed: gzhan yang ji lta bu zhe na / bye ma'i tshogs kyis khyab pa'i lam lta bu //
translated: Moreover, how is it like that?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It says, “like a road covered with a mass of sand.”

original: bye ma'i tshogs ni bye ma'i phung po ste mang po zhes bya ba'i don la /
analyzed: bye ma'i tshogs ni bye ma'i phung po ste mang po zhes bya ba'i don la /
translated: A mass of sand is a heap of sand, meaning many.

original: des khyab pa ni kun nas g-yogs shing khebs pa ste /
analyzed: des khyab pa ni kun nas g-yogs shing khebs pa ste /
translated: Covered with that, it is completely covered and concealed.

original: de lta bu'i phyogs kyi rgyun lam du ni char 'bab pa don med do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i phyogs kyi rgyun lam du ni char 'bab pa don med do //
translated: In that way, it is pointless for rain to fall on a road that is continuous in that way.

original: lta bur zhes bya ba ni dper bya ba ste ji ltar bye ma'i tshogs kyis khyab pa'i lam du char gyi rgyun mang du bab kyang dgos pa byed par mi 'gyur gyi ring po mi thogs par snga mkho bzhin du gnas so //
analyzed: lta bur zhes bya ba ni dper bya ba ste ji ltar bye ma'i tshogs kyis khyab pa'i lam du char gyi rgyun mang du bab kyang dgos pa byed par mi 'gyur gyi ring po mi thogs par snga mkho bzhin du gnas so //
translated: Like that is the example. Just as it is pointless for a rain shower to fall on a road covered with a mass of sand, even if it falls many times, because it does not serve a purpose, it remains as before without lasting long.

original: tshul de bzhin du /
analyzed: tshul de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: bdag gi bsam par chos char don ma mchis //
analyzed: bdag gi bsam par chos char don ma mchis //
translated: I think the rain of Dharma is useless for me.

original: zhes bya ba bdag gi sems ma rig pa dang sred pa la sogs pa bye ma lta bus khyab pa'i gzhi la yang dag pa'i chos kyi char 'bab pa don med do //🔽dpe 'di dag gis ni 'di skad du ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba bdag gi sems ma rig pa dang sred pa la sogs pa bye ma lta bus khyab pa'i gzhi la yang dag pa'i chos kyi char 'bab pa don med do // dpe 'di dag gis ni 'di skad du ston te /
translated: This is because the ground of my mind is covered with the sand of ignorance, craving, and so on, and the rain of the true Dharma is useless for me.🔽These examples show that the rain of Dharma is not useless for those whose minds are like good fields, but it is useless for those whose minds are like bad fields.

original: ji ltar zhing sa bzang po dag tu char 'bab pa ni 'bras bu la sems pa 'bru'i tshogs dang 'bras bu'i tshogs rnams 'phel zhing rgyas par byed pas don yod pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar zhing sa bzang po dag tu char 'bab pa ni 'bras bu la sems pa 'bru'i tshogs dang 'bras bu'i tshogs rnams 'phel zhing rgyas par byed pas don yod pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as rain falling on good fields increases and expands the crops of rice and other grains, so the rain of Dharma falling on those whose minds are like good fields increases and expands the crops of the qualities of abandonment and realization.

original: rdo ba'i rgyab dang thal ba'i tshogs dang bye ma'i lam du ni de lta ma yin no zhes chos mi mthun pa'i dpes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo ba'i rgyab dang thal ba'i tshogs dang bye ma'i lam du ni de lta ma yin no zhes chos mi mthun pa'i dpes bstan pa yin no //
translated: But it is not like that for those whose minds are like rocky cliffs, heaps of ashes, or sandy deserts.

original: dpe gsum smos pa ni lung dang / rtogs pa dang / don dam pa ste chos rnam pa gsum yod pas de dag brten pa don med pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: dpe gsum smos pa ni lung dang / rtogs pa dang / don dam pa ste chos rnam pa gsum yod pas de dag brten pa don med pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ba'am /
translated: The three examples are mentioned because there are three kinds of Dharma: scripture, realization, and the ultimate.

original: theg pa gsum gyi chos bstan pa'i snod du ma gyur pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi chos bstan pa'i snod du ma gyur pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The three vehicles are not vessels for teaching the Dharma.

original: 'di @215b slob dpon gyi dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di @215b slob dpon gyi dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the purport of the master.

original: yon tan gyi tshogs mang pos brgyan cing dam pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa dag gis kyang re zhig bdag la smad pa ni bya ba'i cha yin te /🔽gal te nye bar ma brtags pa'am /
analyzed: yon tan gyi tshogs mang pos brgyan cing dam pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa dag gis kyang re zhig bdag la smad pa ni bya ba'i cha yin te / gal te nye bar ma brtags pa'am /
translated: Those who are adorned with many collections of good qualities and who possess the conduct of the holy should at least reproach themselves.

original: mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi dbang gis sdig pa mi dge ba byas pa na de sbyang ba'i thabs ni bdag la smod pa yin pa'am /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi dbang gis sdig pa mi dge ba byas pa na de sbyang ba'i thabs ni bdag la smod pa yin pa'am /
translated: If they act nonvirtue due to not examining or due to the influence of a nonvirtuous friend, the method of purifying that is to reproach oneself.🔽Or, others should engage in fault in accordance with that teaching.

original: gzhan dag tshul de ltar bstan pa'i sgo nas nyes pa 'tshams su 'jug pa ni rnam par sun 'byin pa'i stobs kyis sdig pa dang bral bar gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag tshul de ltar bstan pa'i sgo nas nyes pa 'tshams su 'jug pa ni rnam par sun 'byin pa'i stobs kyis sdig pa dang bral bar gyur te /
translated: The power of repudiation is free from sin.

original: sdig pa shin tu mi bzad byas pa yang //
analyzed: sdig pa shin tu mi bzad byas pa yang //
translated: Even though one has committed a very terrible sin,

original: bdag la rnam par smod pas bas par 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag la rnam par smod pas bas par 'gyur //
translated: it is purified by self reproach.

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained.

original: tshul 'di ni skabs 'di dang gzhan dag tu yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshul 'di ni skabs 'di dang gzhan dag tu yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This method should be applied in this and other contexts.

original: bdag la smod pa'i tshul gzhan dag kyang bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bdag la smod pa'i tshul gzhan dag kyang bstan pa ni /
translated: Another method of disparaging oneself is indicated by the words,

original: rang gi sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: “I am unable to bear my own suffering.”

original: de'i don kyang kye 'jig rten gyi mgon po zhes bcom ldan 'das la bos te /
analyzed: de'i don kyang kye 'jig rten gyi mgon po zhes bcom ldan 'das la bos te /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: “Alas, Lord of the World,” he says to the Blessed One,

original: de yang bdag gis bzod par mi nus te /
analyzed: de yang bdag gis bzod par mi nus te /
translated: “I am unable to bear my own suffering.

original: khyed kyis bstan par mdzad pa'i lam la gus pa med cing don med par ma zad kyi khyed kyang bdag gis shes shing rten par ma nus so zhes bya ba ni'ang zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: khyed kyis bstan par mdzad pa'i lam la gus pa med cing don med par ma zad kyi khyed kyang bdag gis shes shing rten par ma nus so zhes bya ba ni'ang zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: Not only do I lack respect for the path that you have taught and do not practice it, but I am also unable to understand and rely on you.” The word “also” means that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rang gi sdug bsngal mi bzad ma dpyad pas //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / rang gi sdug bsngal mi bzad ma dpyad pas //
translated: Why is that?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because I have not examined my own unbearable suffering.

original: bdag rang nyid kyis nyams su myong ba'i sdug bsngal gyi tshogs drag cing rtsub pa mi bzad cing brnag par dka' ba de sdig pa'i rnam par smin pa las byung ba yin pas blos ma dpyad cing rtog par ma gyur pas rgyu des na /
analyzed: bdag rang nyid kyis nyams su myong ba'i sdug bsngal gyi tshogs drag cing rtsub pa mi bzad cing brnag par dka' ba de sdig pa'i rnam par smin pa las byung ba yin pas blos ma dpyad cing rtog par ma gyur pas rgyu des na /
translated: Therefore, without analyzing it with the mind, without thinking about it,🔽You who strive to help me as if I were a friend,

original: gang zhig bdag la phan brtson lta bur ni //
analyzed: gang zhig bdag la phan brtson lta bur ni //
translated: you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,

original: zhes pa khyed lta bu gang zhig bdag la phan par brtson zhing gnod pa las bzlog pa'i mdza' bshes lta bur gyur pa'am /🔽lta bu zhes bya ba dper mi drang bar /
analyzed: zhes pa khyed lta bu gang zhig bdag la phan par brtson zhing gnod pa las bzlog pa'i mdza' bshes lta bur gyur pa'am / lta bu zhes bya ba dper mi drang bar /
translated: you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,

original: gang zhig bdag la phan par brtson pa nyid //
analyzed: gang zhig bdag la phan par brtson pa nyid //
translated: you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,

original: ces nges par gzung bar drang du yang rung ste bdag la phan par brtson pa nyid du gyur pa'o //🔽gang gis she na /
analyzed: ces nges par gzung bar drang du yang rung ste bdag la phan par brtson pa nyid du gyur pa'o // gang gis she na /
translated: you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,

original: bzod dang sbyin pas bdag la phan 'dogs pa //🔽'jig rten mgon de'ang bdag gis bzod mi nus //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bzod dang sbyin pas bdag la phan 'dogs pa //🔽'jig rten mgon de'ang bdag gis bzod mi nus //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,🔽you who strive to help me as if I were a friend,

original: bzod pa dang ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa dang ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: and patience is the perfection of patience.

original: sbyin pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /🔽'di gnyis ni gzhan @216a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste / 'di gnyis ni gzhan @216a * //
translated: Generosity is the perfection of generosity.

original: la phan gdags pa'i thabs kyi dam pa yin pas gtsor smos pa yin te /🔽de dag gis mchog tu phan 'dogs shing dgos pa sgrub par byed pa'i ngang tshul can yin pa las de dag rjes su ston par mdzad pa na /
analyzed: la phan gdags pa'i thabs kyi dam pa yin pas gtsor smos pa yin te / de dag gis mchog tu phan 'dogs shing dgos pa sgrub par byed pa'i ngang tshul can yin pa las de dag rjes su ston par mdzad pa na /
translated: These two are mentioned primarily because they are the best means of benefiting others.

original: bdag gis bzod cing bsten par mi nus so //
analyzed: bdag gis bzod cing bsten par mi nus so //
translated: When they are taught, one is unable to bear and rely on them,

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because they have the nature of providing the highest benefit and accomplishing the goal.

original: bdag ci zhig byed cing bzod mi nus she na /
analyzed: bdag ci zhig byed cing bzod mi nus she na /
translated: What is one unable to bear and do?

original: sdang bar byed dam 'bros shing 'byol ba'am //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sdang bar byed dam 'bros shing 'byol ba'am // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: One is unable to bear and do what is hostile, or what flees and avoids.

original: sdang bar byed pa ni dgra bor 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: sdang bar byed pa ni dgra bor 'du shes pa'o //
translated: What is hostile is the perception of an enemy.

original: gzhan yang ci zhig byed ce na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ci zhig byed ce na /
translated: What else is one unable to do?

original: 'bros shing 'byol ba ste /
analyzed: 'bros shing 'byol ba ste /
translated: One is unable to bear and do what flees and avoids.

original: phan pa'i gdams ngag bstan pa na de mi bzod par gzhan du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: phan pa'i gdams ngag bstan pa na de mi bzod par gzhan du 'gro ba'o //
translated: When taught beneficial advice, one is unable to bear it and goes elsewhere.

original: rab tu g-yeng ngam zlog par byed na yang //
analyzed: rab tu g-yeng ngam zlog par byed na yang //
translated: Even if they are very distracted or hostile.

original: zhes bya ba ni gdams ngag mi len par phan tshun rgyu zhing gnas su sems phyogs par byed pa'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gdams ngag mi len par phan tshun rgyu zhing gnas su sems phyogs par byed pa'am /
translated: This means that they do not accept the instructions, but go around here and there, their minds turned away from the teacher's abode.

original: zlog par byed dam zhes bya ba ni gnas na gnas pa nyid na yang slar tshig gis bzlog cing gshe bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zlog par byed dam zhes bya ba ni gnas na gnas pa nyid na yang slar tshig gis bzlog cing gshe bar byed pa'o //
translated: Or hostile means that even if they stay in the teacher's abode, they are hostile and abusive to him.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni shin tu dka' ba'i tshul te /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni shin tu dka' ba'i tshul te /
translated: Even means in a very difficult way.

original: 'di ltar gdul dka' ba mi srun pa sems kyi rgyun log par mos pas skal pa med par gyur pa de lta bu la yang ston par mdzad cing /🔽dam pa'i chos kyi char gyis sbyin par mdzad pas bdag 'dra ba skal ba med cing rang bzhin ngan pa la yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar gdul dka' ba mi srun pa sems kyi rgyun log par mos pas skal pa med par gyur pa de lta bu la yang ston par mdzad cing / dam pa'i chos kyi char gyis sbyin par mdzad pas bdag 'dra ba skal ba med cing rang bzhin ngan pa la yang /
translated: Thus, the teacher acts even for those who are difficult to train, who are unruly, whose mental continuum is perverted, who are unfortunate.🔽He showers them with the rain of the holy Dharma.🔽He teaches me, who am unfortunate and of bad character,

original: rgyun mi 'chad par bdag 'dra la slob byed //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par bdag 'dra la slob byed //
translated: Without interruption.

original: de 'dra'ang bla ma yin snyam bdag mi sems //
analyzed: de 'dra'ang bla ma yin snyam bdag mi sems //
translated: I do not think that such a one is a teacher.

original: zhes bya ba rgyun mi 'chad par slob par mdzad cing rig pa la 'dzud par mdzad cing skal ba can du byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyun mi 'chad par slob par mdzad cing rig pa la 'dzud par mdzad cing skal ba can du byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, he is the one who teaches without interruption, who introduces to knowledge, and who makes one worthy.

original: de 'dra zhes bya ba de lta bu la yang phan pa'i gdams ngag bstan pa'i bla ma yin pa snyam du bdag mi sems te /
analyzed: de 'dra zhes bya ba de lta bu la yang phan pa'i gdams ngag bstan pa'i bla ma yin pa snyam du bdag mi sems te /
translated: I do not think that such a one is a teacher who teaches beneficial advice.

original: ma rig pas blo'i mig ldongs pa'i phyir log par 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma rig pas blo'i mig ldongs pa'i phyir log par 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because of the blindness of the eye of the mind due to nescience, one would grasp wrongly. This is the meaning.

original: 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: ji ltar dmus long dag gis nyi ma dang zla ba'i rnam pa mi shes pa bzhin du lus dang sems kyi rgyud ma bsgom pa'i sems can dag gis kyang chos zab mo'i don rtogs shing phan pa'i gdams ngag len par mi nus so //
analyzed: ji ltar dmus long dag gis nyi ma dang zla ba'i rnam pa mi shes pa bzhin du lus dang sems kyi rgyud ma bsgom pa'i sems can dag gis kyang chos zab mo'i don rtogs shing phan pa'i gdams ngag len par mi nus so //
translated: Just as the blind do not know the form of the sun and moon, so also sentient beings whose mind-streams are not cultivated are not able to realize the meaning of the profound Dharma and to take up beneficial advice.

original: de ltar sems kyi skyon gyi 'gyur ba rnam pa sna tshogs smras nas /
analyzed: de ltar sems kyi skyon gyi 'gyur ba rnam pa sna tshogs smras nas /
translated: Having thus spoken of the various faults of the mind,

original: da ni rnal ma'i sems kyis yang bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshul bstan pa'i @216b phyir ;
analyzed: da ni rnal ma'i sems kyis yang bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshul bstan pa'i @216b phyir ;
translated: now, in order to demonstrate the way of supplicating the Bhagavān with a natural mind,

original: song ste gsol ba btab kyang rnyed dka' zhing //
analyzed: song ste gsol ba btab kyang rnyed dka' zhing //
translated: Even if you go to him and make requests, it is difficult to find him.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse continues:🔽Even if you go to him and make requests, it is difficult to find him.

original: song ste zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu 'ga' zhig yod na don du gnyer ba de de'i thad du song nas bsnyen bkur la sogs pas mnyes par byas te /
analyzed: song ste zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu 'ga' zhig yod na don du gnyer ba de de'i thad du song nas bsnyen bkur la sogs pas mnyes par byas te /
translated: If you have some cause for help, you go to him, and by serving him and so on, you please him.🔽Even if you do this, it is difficult to find him, difficult to obtain him.

original: gsol ba btab par gyur kyang rnyed par dka' zhing thob par dka' ba lta bu yin pa dang / bzod pa'i dus su sman chen mchog gyur pa //
analyzed: gsol ba btab par gyur kyang rnyed par dka' zhing thob par dka' ba lta bu yin pa dang / bzod pa'i dus su sman chen mchog gyur pa //
translated: When you are in a state of patience, he is a great, supreme medicine.

original: bzod pa'i ngang tshul gal te mi bzod na //
analyzed: bzod pa'i ngang tshul gal te mi bzod na //
translated: If you are not patient when you should be patient,

original: zhes bya ba gang gi tshe khro ba'i dgra bos gtses pa'i sems rme byung ba na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gang gi tshe khro ba'i dgra bos gtses pa'i sems rme byung ba na /
translated: when your mind is wounded by the enemy of anger,

original: sdug bsngal dang du len pa la sogs pa'i thabs kyis gso dgos pa yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang du len pa la sogs pa'i thabs kyis gso dgos pa yin la /
translated: you need to heal it with the methods of willingly accepting suffering and so on.

original: des na de'i tshe bsten pa'i sman sems kyi nad gso bas chen por gyur pa thabs gzhan las khyad par 'phags pa mchog tu gyur pa ni bzod pa yin pas bzod pa bsten dgos na bzod pa'i ngang tshul lam rang bzhin te /🔽gal te ma bzod cing bsten par ma byas na zhe sdang gi nad gso ba'i /
analyzed: des na de'i tshe bsten pa'i sman sems kyi nad gso bas chen por gyur pa thabs gzhan las khyad par 'phags pa mchog tu gyur pa ni bzod pa yin pas bzod pa bsten dgos na bzod pa'i ngang tshul lam rang bzhin te / gal te ma bzod cing bsten par ma byas na zhe sdang gi nad gso ba'i /
translated: Therefore, at that time, the medicine to be relied upon is patience, which is the great healer of the disease of the mind. It is superior to other methods and is supreme.

original: bzod pa'i rgyu gzhan bdag la ci zhig mchis //
analyzed: bzod pa'i rgyu gzhan bdag la ci zhig mchis //
translated: If one is not patient and does not rely on it, what other cause of patience is there for me to heal the disease of hatred?🔽What other method of patience is there for me?

original: zhes pa bzod pa'i rgyu'i thabs gzhan bdag la ci zhig mchis te ma mchis so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa bzod pa'i rgyu'i thabs gzhan bdag la ci zhig mchis te ma mchis so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is none.

original: da ni nyon mongs pa rang dbang med pa nyid du gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni nyon mongs pa rang dbang med pa nyid du gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show that the afflictions are powerless,

original: nyon mongs srin pos zin pas sems dkrugs shing //
analyzed: nyon mongs srin pos zin pas sems dkrugs shing //
translated: The mind is disturbed by being seized by the demon of the afflictions,

original: rim bcas bdag phan la yang brtson med pa'i //
analyzed: rim bcas bdag phan la yang brtson med pa'i //
translated: And, having lost its order, one is not even diligent in one’s own welfare.

original: 'jig rten blta bar 'os pa mthong ba na //
analyzed: 'jig rten blta bar 'os pa mthong ba na //
translated: When one sees the world, which is worthy of being seen,

original: gtso bo bdag sdang nyid skye'i snying rje'i min //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gtso bo bdag sdang nyid skye'i snying rje'i min //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: One’s chief attitude is one of hatred, not of compassion.

original: gtso bo zhes pos nas bdag gi sems la ni zhe sdang skye'i snying rje nam yang skye bar ma gyur to zhes ston to //
analyzed: gtso bo zhes pos nas bdag gi sems la ni zhe sdang skye'i snying rje nam yang skye bar ma gyur to zhes ston to //
translated: The word “chief” shows that anger arises in my mind and compassion never arises.

original: su zhig la snying rje mi skye zhe na /
analyzed: su zhig la snying rje mi skye zhe na /
translated: With regard to whom does compassion not arise?

original: 'jig rten la'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten la'o //
translated: It is with regard to the world.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the world like?

original: nyon mongs srin pos zin pas sems dkrugs shing //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nyon mongs srin pos zin pas sems dkrugs shing // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is disturbed by the demon of afflictions.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni 'jigs shing gnod pa skyed pas srin po lta bu yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni 'jigs shing gnod pa skyed pas srin po lta bu yin la /
translated: Attachment, anger, and so on are like demons because they cause fear and harm.

original: des zin cing dbang du byas pas sems kyi rgyud dkrugs shing rang dbang med par byas pa yin la /
analyzed: des zin cing dbang du byas pas sems kyi rgyud dkrugs shing rang dbang med par byas pa yin la /
translated: Since they seize and control the mind, the continuum of the mind is disturbed and made powerless.

original: de nyid kyis na rims dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na rims dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: By that alone, the mind is feverish.

original: sems skyon dang bcas shing mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis myos par gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: sems skyon dang bcas shing mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis myos par gyur pa yin la /
translated: The mind is flawed and intoxicated by discordant states.

original: rgyu des ni bdag la phan par byas pa'i thabs 'jig rten 'di'am gzhan du sdug @217a * //
analyzed: rgyu des ni bdag la phan par byas pa'i thabs 'jig rten 'di'am gzhan du sdug @217a * //
translated: By that cause, the world is not a means to benefit me in this life or the next.

original: bsngal med par bya ba'i las kyi rtsom pa la 'jug pa la yang brtson pa med cing yongs su dor bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: bsngal med par bya ba'i las kyi rtsom pa la 'jug pa la yang brtson pa med cing yongs su dor bar byed pa'am /
translated: They are not diligent in engaging in the composition of actions that would eliminate suffering.🔽Or else, because they are disturbed by the afflictions, they harm themselves by jumping off a cliff or by ingesting poison.

original: yang na nyon mongs pas dkrugs pa'i phyir bdag nyid g-yang sar mchong ba dang / dug za ba'i sbyor bas rang nyid la gnod pa byed pa'i 'jig rten pa dag ni blta bar 'os pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pas dkrugs pa'i phyir bdag nyid g-yang sar mchong ba dang / dug za ba'i sbyor bas rang nyid la gnod pa byed pa'i 'jig rten pa dag ni blta bar 'os pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The world is not worthy of being seen,🔽but when one sees them, a compassionate mind arises and they become the object of compassion.

original: gang zhig mthong na rjes su brtse ba'i sems skye zhing snying rje'i yul du gyur pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pas blta bar rigs pa yin na /
analyzed: gang zhig mthong na rjes su brtse ba'i sems skye zhing snying rje'i yul du gyur pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pas blta bar rigs pa yin na /
translated: That is worthy of being seen, because it is the cause for being in accord with the bodhisattva way of life.

original: de lta bu mthong ba na yang nyon mongs pa'i stobs che ba nyid kyis zhe sdang nyid skye bar byed kyi snying rje skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu mthong ba na yang nyon mongs pa'i stobs che ba nyid kyis zhe sdang nyid skye bar byed kyi snying rje skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But when one sees such people, because the power of the afflictions is great, hatred arises, not compassion.

original: da ni rang nyid rigs pa'i tshul la gnas kyang nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pa'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rang nyid rigs pa'i tshul la gnas kyang nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pa'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the way in which one who abides in the method of reasoning is still subject to the afflictions, he says:

original: skye bo rang gi las 'bras la spyod cang  //
analyzed: skye bo rang gi las 'bras la spyod cang  //
translated: People experience the results of their own actions.

original: thams cad dbang med 'jigs pa yin par shes //
analyzed: thams cad dbang med 'jigs pa yin par shes //
translated: All are powerless and subject to fear.

original: gzhan dag nyes med par ni brtags gyur kyang ;
analyzed: gzhan dag nyes med par ni brtags gyur kyang ;
translated: Even if others are not at fault,

original: / zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says.

original: skye bo zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i 'gro ba rnams te /
analyzed: skye bo zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i 'gro ba rnams te /
translated: “People” refers to beings who are produced by karma and the afflictions.

original: de ni rang gi las 'bras la spyod cing //
analyzed: de ni rang gi las 'bras la spyod cing //
translated: “They experience the results of their own actions”🔽means that they experience the results of the karma they have created with their own body, speech, and mind, whether pleasant or unpleasant.

original: zhes bya ba gang rang gi lus dang ngag dang yid kyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba la spyod pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rkyen las gyur pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong yang de
analyzed: zhes bya ba gang rang gi lus dang ngag dang yid kyis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba la spyod pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rkyen las gyur pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong yang de
translated: Therefore, even though they experience suffering that is caused by external conditions,

original: nyid rang nyid kyis spyad pa'i las kyi 'bras bu yin pas gzhan dag gis nyes pa ma yin pa dang / sems can thams cad kyang rang dbang med par 'jig pa yin zhing skad cig ma'i chos can yin pa'i phyir thams cad mi rtag par yang shes la /
analyzed: nyid rang nyid kyis spyad pa'i las kyi 'bras bu yin pas gzhan dag gis nyes pa ma yin pa dang / sems can thams cad kyang rang dbang med par 'jig pa yin zhing skad cig ma'i chos can yin pa'i phyir thams cad mi rtag par yang shes la /
translated: Since the results of actions are experienced by oneself, others are not at fault. And since all sentient beings are powerless and subject to destruction, and since they are momentary phenomena, one should understand that everything is impermanent.

original: des na rang gi bde sdug la myong ba ni rang gi las byung bar gzhan dag gis nyes par gyur pa med do //
analyzed: des na rang gi bde sdug la myong ba ni rang gi las byung bar gzhan dag gis nyes par gyur pa med do //
translated: Thus, the experience of one’s own happiness and suffering arises from one’s own karma. Others are not at fault.🔽Even though one understands that this is one’s own fault, if one is unable to be patient, it is because one’s mind is obscured by the darkness of ignorance and delusion.

original: rang gi skyon yin par blos brtags shing shes par gyur kyang bzod par ma nus pa ni rang gi sems gti mug cing ma rig pa'i mun pas bsgribs pa yin pas na mi shes pa'i rab rib dag gis rnam par bslus par gyur pa'i rnam par 'khrul pa'am
analyzed: rang gi skyon yin par blos brtags shing shes par gyur kyang bzod par ma nus pa ni rang gi sems gti mug cing ma rig pa'i mun pas bsgribs pa yin pas na mi shes pa'i rab rib dag gis rnam par bslus par gyur pa'i rnam par 'khrul pa'am
translated: Thus, it is said that one is deceived by the cataract of ignorance.

original: nus pa ni ngo mtshar che ba yin pas /🔽rmongs pa rab rib dag gi rnam 'khrul gzigs //
analyzed: nus pa ni ngo mtshar che ba yin pas / rmongs pa rab rib dag gi rnam 'khrul gzigs //
translated: It is amazing that one is unable to be patient.

original: zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said that one sees the error of the delusion of the cataract of ignorance.

original: rnam par 'khrul pa de nyid @217b yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par 'khrul pa de nyid @217b yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very confusion,🔽he says:

original: bdag ni nyes pa'i rgya mtsho yin na yang //
analyzed: bdag ni nyes pa'i rgya mtsho yin na yang //
translated: Even though I am an ocean of faults,

original: su yi nyes pa'i cha yang bzod mi bgyid //🔽ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: su yi nyes pa'i cha yang bzod mi bgyid // ces bya ba smos te /
translated: I cannot bear even a fraction of others’ faults.

original: de la re zhig bdag nyid ni lus dang sems kyi rgyud ngan par byed pa'i nyes pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / de las byung ba'i las mi dge ba rgya mtsho snyed du mang zhing rgya che ba yod pa yin na yang /
analyzed: de la re zhig bdag nyid ni lus dang sems kyi rgyud ngan par byed pa'i nyes pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / de las byung ba'i las mi dge ba rgya mtsho snyed du mang zhing rgya che ba yod pa yin na yang /
translated: Therein, even though I have many faults that create a bad continuum of body and mind, such as the afflictions of desire and so on, and the nonvirtuous karma that arises from them, which are as vast as the ocean,

original: gzhan su yang rung ba'i nyes pa'i rnam pa shin tu phra ba'i cha tsam mam thigs pa tsam yang bzod par mi bgyid cing brnag mi nus pa de ni bdag gi sems ngo mtshar che'o //🔽gzhan yang / bzod pa yon tan phun tshogs gzhan mchis kyang //
analyzed: gzhan su yang rung ba'i nyes pa'i rnam pa shin tu phra ba'i cha tsam mam thigs pa tsam yang bzod par mi bgyid cing brnag mi nus pa de ni bdag gi sems ngo mtshar che'o // gzhan yang / bzod pa yon tan phun tshogs gzhan mchis kyang //
translated: I cannot bear even a fraction or a drop of the faults of others. That is amazing!🔽Moreover, he says:

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Even though there are other perfections of patience,

original: bzod pa ni khro ba'i gnyen por gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gzugs bzang ba la sogs par 'gyur ba'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa mtha' yas pa dag yod pa'am /🔽yang gzhan gyi bzod pa yon tan phun sum tshogs kyang zhes bshad du yang rung ste /
analyzed: bzod pa ni khro ba'i gnyen por gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gzugs bzang ba la sogs par 'gyur ba'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa mtha' yas pa dag yod pa'am / yang gzhan gyi bzod pa yon tan phun sum tshogs kyang zhes bshad du yang rung ste /
translated: Patience is not only the antidote to anger, but also has the infinite excellent qualities of becoming a good physical form and so on.🔽Or, it is also possible to explain that others have the excellent qualities of patience,

original: yon tan dang ldan pa gzhan rnams kyis bzod pa dang tshul khrims la bzod pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa yod pa dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa gzhan rnams kyis bzod pa dang tshul khrims la bzod pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa yod pa dag kyang ngo //
translated: and that others have the excellent qualities of patience and morality.

original: gang phyir mi bzod de 'dir ngo mtshar che //
analyzed: gang phyir mi bzod de 'dir ngo mtshar che //
translated: How amazing that I cannot endure even a fraction of that!🔽This means that the nature of my mind is confused and amazing,

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gis bzod pa'i yon tan mtha' yas kyang de'i cha tsam yang brten cing bzod par mi nus pa de ni rmongs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi bdag gi sems 'di ngo mtshar te /🔽rmad du byung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gis bzod pa'i yon tan mtha' yas kyang de'i cha tsam yang brten cing bzod par mi nus pa de ni rmongs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi bdag gi sems 'di ngo mtshar te /🔽rmad du byung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: since, although the excellent qualities of patience are infinite, I cannot endure even a fraction of them.

original: kyang zhes bya ba ni 'gal bar snang ba'i tshul ston pa yin te /
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba ni 'gal bar snang ba'i tshul ston pa yin te /
translated: The word “also” indicates the mode of appearance of the contradiction.

original: nyes pa'i rgya mtsho yin yang nyes pa mi bzod la /
analyzed: nyes pa'i rgya mtsho yin yang nyes pa mi bzod la /
translated: Even though it is an ocean of faults, one is intolerant of faults.

original: yon tan mtha' yas kyang yon tan mi brten pa ni 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan mtha' yas kyang yon tan mi brten pa ni 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though there are limitless good qualities, one does not rely on good qualities. This is a contradiction.

original: nyes pa de nyid 'byung ba'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyes pa de nyid 'byung ba'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the mode of the arising of that fault, he says:

original: dbyar dus mkha' la ldang ba lta bur ni //
analyzed: dbyar dus mkha' la ldang ba lta bur ni //
translated: Like clouds rising in the sky during the rainy season,

original: bdag gi yid la nyon mongs sprin tshogs rnams //
analyzed: bdag gi yid la nyon mongs sprin tshogs rnams //
translated: the masses of afflictive clouds in my mind

original: yang dang yang du 'gro zhing 'ong gyur pa //
analyzed: yang dang yang du 'gro zhing 'ong gyur pa //
translated: go and come again and again.

original: ngo tsha rnam spangs le lo can bdag ngan //🔽zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: ngo tsha rnam spangs le lo can bdag ngan // zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: I am shameless, lazy, and evil.🔽Like clouds rising in the sky during the rainy season, the masses of rain clouds gather and rise up and then rain falls.

original: dbyar gyi dus su nam mkha' la char sprin gyi tshogs 'dus shing ldang bar gyur nas char 'bebs pa lta bur bdag gi yid kyi mkha' la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs glo bur du 'byung zhing sprin dang chos mthun pas sprin lta bu'i tshogs
analyzed: dbyar gyi dus su nam mkha' la char sprin gyi tshogs 'dus shing ldang bar gyur nas char 'bebs pa lta bur bdag gi yid kyi mkha' la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs glo bur du 'byung zhing sprin dang chos mthun pas sprin lta bu'i tshogs
translated: In the same way, the masses of afflictive emotions such as attachment suddenly arise in the sky of my mind.

original: te mang po rnams @218a * //
analyzed: te mang po rnams @218a * //
translated: The many afflictions

original: 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: 'byung ba yin la /
translated: arise.

original: ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
translated: How do they arise?

original: yang dang yang du 'gro zhing 'ong gyur pa //
analyzed: yang dang yang du 'gro zhing 'ong gyur pa //
translated: They go and come again and again.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: rgyun du yang dang yang du phan tshun du 'gro zhing slar 'ong ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyun du yang dang yang du phan tshun du 'gro zhing slar 'ong ba yin te /
translated: They go and come again and again, in a stream.

original: ji ltar sprin dag mkha' la ldang zhing rgyu ba dang chu'i rgyun 'bebs par byed pa de bzhin du bdag gi sems la nyon mongs pa rnams rtag tu 'byung zhing ldang la sdig pa'i char bskyed nas 'bebs par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar sprin dag mkha' la ldang zhing rgyu ba dang chu'i rgyun 'bebs par byed pa de bzhin du bdag gi sems la nyon mongs pa rnams rtag tu 'byung zhing ldang la sdig pa'i char bskyed nas 'bebs par byed do //
translated: Just as clouds rise and move in the sky and pour down a stream of water, in the same way, the afflictions arise and move in the sky of the mind and pour down a stream of evil.

original: de bas na nyon mongs pa de lta bu dang ldan zhing 'byung bar bdag nyid shes bzhin du ngo tsha ba'i chos rnam par spangs nas nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir brtson 'grus la mi brten cing le lo'i dbang du gyur pa ni bdag nyid shin tu ngan
analyzed: de bas na nyon mongs pa de lta bu dang ldan zhing 'byung bar bdag nyid shes bzhin du ngo tsha ba'i chos rnam par spangs nas nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir brtson 'grus la mi brten cing le lo'i dbang du gyur pa ni bdag nyid shin tu ngan
translated: Therefore, knowing that the afflictions arise in this way, having abandoned the quality of shamelessness, if one does not rely on effort to eliminate the afflictions, and instead falls under the power of laziness, one is very bad,

original: te smad par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: te smad par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: one is to be despised.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa bsal ba'i thabs kyi ting nge 'dzin dang mi mthun par gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa bsal ba'i thabs kyi ting nge 'dzin dang mi mthun par gyur pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is not a method for eliminating the afflictions, he says:

original: gal te nyon mongs grang lhags byung gyur na //
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs grang lhags byung gyur na //
translated: If the afflictions of cold and wind arise,

original: ting 'dzin 'bar bas rgyal bar spro gyur kyang //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ting 'dzin 'bar bas rgyal bar spro gyur kyang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: even if one is delighted by the blazing of samadhi,

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: The afflictions are desire and so forth.

original: de nyid ni tshul khrims 'chal ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba la lus dang sems nyon mongs par byed pa'i tshul gyis grang lhags drag po lta bu yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ni tshul khrims 'chal ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba la lus dang sems nyon mongs par byed pa'i tshul gyis grang lhags drag po lta bu yin te /
translated: They are like a strong cold wind, the cause of harm such as immorality, by way of afflicting the body and mind.

original: ji ltar grang lhags kyis lus rengs pa na rtsol mi nus pa dang 'dra bar nyon mongs pa'i grang bas nyen pa na 'phags pa'i lam la 'jug mi nus pas grang ba dang 'dra la /
analyzed: ji ltar grang lhags kyis lus rengs pa na rtsol mi nus pa dang 'dra bar nyon mongs pa'i grang bas nyen pa na 'phags pa'i lam la 'jug mi nus pas grang ba dang 'dra la /
translated: Just as when the body is paralyzed by a cold wind, one is unable to exert oneself, when one is afflicted by the cold of the afflictions, one is unable to enter the path of the aryas.

original: de ni ma rig pa'i rgyu las byung bar gyur pa na sems kyi rgyud las bsal dgos na gang gis bsal zhe na /
analyzed: de ni ma rig pa'i rgyu las byung bar gyur pa na sems kyi rgyud las bsal dgos na gang gis bsal zhe na /
translated: When that arises from the cause of ignorance, it must be removed from the continuum of the mind. By what is it removed?

original: ting nge 'dzin te gnyen po bsgoms pa las sems rtse gcig tu bya bas so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin te gnyen po bsgoms pa las sems rtse gcig tu bya bas so //
translated: Through concentration, one-pointedness of mind is achieved by cultivating the antidote.

original: khyad par ji lta bus she na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bus she na /
translated: What kind of distinction?

original: 'bar bas rgyal bar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'bar bas rgyal bar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The bodhisattva is said to be victorious through blazing.

original: bsam gtan gyi gtsub shing las byung ba'i ye shes kyi me 'bar bas nyon mongs pa'i grang lhags zil gyis gnon cing brgyal bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi gtsub shing las byung ba'i ye shes kyi me 'bar bas nyon mongs pa'i grang lhags zil gyis gnon cing brgyal bar bya ba ste /
translated: The fire of wisdom that arises from the kindling wood of meditative concentration overwhelms and conquers the cold wind of the afflictions,

original: gang gi phyir grang ba'i gnyen po me yin pa dang 'dra bar chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir grang ba'i gnyen po me yin pa dang 'dra bar chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is similar to the fact that fire is the antidote to cold.

original: de lta bu bya bar mngon par spro zhing rtsol bar gyur kyang ngo //
analyzed: de lta bu bya bar mngon par spro zhing rtsol bar gyur kyang ngo //
translated: Even though one is eager to act in that way and makes an effort,

original: de ltar rtsol ba na nyes pa ci zhig 'byung zhe na /🔽gnyid dang rmugs pa'i rab rib bde gyur pas //
analyzed: de ltar rtsol ba na nyes pa ci zhig 'byung zhe na / gnyid dang rmugs pa'i rab rib bde gyur pas //
translated: what fault occurs when one makes an effort in that way?🔽The Sūtra says:

original: mal stan 'dod pa dag kyang rnam par 'phel //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mal stan 'dod pa dag kyang rnam par 'phel // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The veil of sleep and lethargy increases, and the desire for bedding increases.

original: gnyid ni @218b gang gis 'jug pa rang dbang med par sems sdud pa'o //
analyzed: gnyid ni @218b gang gis 'jug pa rang dbang med par sems sdud pa'o //
translated: Sleep is the involuntary withdrawal of the mind.

original: rmugs pa ni gang gis sems blong zhing yul legs par 'dzin mi nus pa ste de gnyis ni mi shes pa'i rgyu yin pas na rab rib po //
analyzed: rmugs pa ni gang gis sems blong zhing yul legs par 'dzin mi nus pa ste de gnyis ni mi shes pa'i rgyu yin pas na rab rib po //
translated: Lethargy is that which makes the mind heavy and incapable of grasping the object well. Since these two are the cause of ignorance, they are like cataracts.

original: de bdo ba ni shugs drag par 'byung bas sems gsal ba zil gyis gnon par nus pa'o //
analyzed: de bdo ba ni shugs drag par 'byung bas sems gsal ba zil gyis gnon par nus pa'o //
translated: When they are strong, they arise with great force and are able to overwhelm the clarity of mind.

original: rgyu des na /
analyzed: rgyu des na /
translated: For this reason,

original: mal stan 'dod pa dag kyang rnam par 'phel //
analyzed: mal stan 'dod pa dag kyang rnam par 'phel //
translated: the desire for bedding increases.

original: zhes bya ba gnyid dang rmugs pa'i shugs kyis ting nge 'dzin gyi yul la gtod par mi nus kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gnyid dang rmugs pa'i shugs kyis ting nge 'dzin gyi yul la gtod par mi nus kyi /
translated: Because of the force of sleep and lethargy, one is unable to focus on the object of concentration.

original: ci nas kyang mal stan bde mo dag la nyal bar 'dod pa'i sems 'gyur zhing le lo rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci nas kyang mal stan bde mo dag la nyal bar 'dod pa'i sems 'gyur zhing le lo rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In every way, one desires to lie down on comfortable bedding, and laziness increases.

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po la bsten mi nus pas cing 'gyur zhe na /🔽bdag yid 'dod chags zhags pas dbang med bgyis //
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po la bsten mi nus pas cing 'gyur zhe na / bdag yid 'dod chags zhags pas dbang med bgyis //
translated: In this way, one is unable to rely on the antidotes to the afflictions.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, “My mind is powerless, bound by the noose of desire.”

original: bdag gi yid ting nge 'dzin dang bral bas nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pa yin pas /
analyzed: bdag gi yid ting nge 'dzin dang bral bas nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pa yin pas /
translated: Since my mind is separated from concentration, it is under the power of the afflictions.

original: 'dod chags zhags pas dbang med bgyis //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod chags zhags pas dbang med bgyis // zhes bya ba la /
translated: I have been made powerless by the noose of desire.

original: 'dod chags ni yul la mngon par zhe na cing chags pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni yul la mngon par zhe na cing chags pa yin la /
translated: Here, desire is the strong attachment to an object.

original: de nyid ni 'ching ba dam po yin pas zhags pa dang 'dra la des sems kyi rgyud rang dbang med par bsdams shing gol ba'i dbang med par byas pas na dbang med bgyis zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni 'ching ba dam po yin pas zhags pa dang 'dra la des sems kyi rgyud rang dbang med par bsdams shing gol ba'i dbang med par byas pas na dbang med bgyis zhes bya ste /
translated: Since it is a strong bondage, it is like a noose. Since it binds the continuum of the mind without independence and makes it powerless to escape, it is said to make one powerless.

original: stobs med par byas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: stobs med par byas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that it makes one weak.

original: zhe sdang mes bsregs nga rgyal dag gis bcom //
analyzed: zhe sdang mes bsregs nga rgyal dag gis bcom //
translated: I have been burned by the fire of hatred, and destroyed by pride.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa'i mes rang gi rgyud la gnas pa'i 'phags pa'i lam dang rjes su mthun pa'i dge ba rnams bsregs shing zad par byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa'i mes rang gi rgyud la gnas pa'i 'phags pa'i lam dang rjes su mthun pa'i dge ba rnams bsregs shing zad par byas pa'o //
translated: The fire of mental resentment burns and destroys the virtues that are conducive to the noble path and remain in one's continuum.

original: nga rgyal dag gis bcom zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal la sogs pas sems kyi rgyud khengs shing 'phags pa'i nor dang bral bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal dag gis bcom zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal la sogs pas sems kyi rgyud khengs shing 'phags pa'i nor dang bral bar byas pa'o //
translated: Destroyed by pride means that the continuum of the mind is inflated by pride, great pride, and so forth, and is deprived of the wealth of the noble ones.

original: de dag 'ba' zhig tu zad dam zhe na /
analyzed: de dag 'ba' zhig tu zad dam zhe na /
translated: Are only these the faults?

original: ma yin te /🔽nyes pa kun gyi mda' mdung mtshon cha yis //
analyzed: ma yin te / nyes pa kun gyi mda' mdung mtshon cha yis //
translated: No, they are not.🔽The entire world is powerless,

original: kun tu gang bas dbang med pa rgyal bar gyur //
analyzed: kun tu gang bas dbang med pa rgyal bar gyur //
translated: overwhelmed by the weapons of all faults.

original: zhes bya ba nyes pa yang yin la kun yang yin pas na nyes pa kun gyi ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyes pa yang yin la kun yang yin pas na nyes pa kun gyi ste /
translated: Since they are faults and also all, they are all faults.

original: ji skad smos pa'i nyon mongs pa de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs rnams so //
analyzed: ji skad smos pa'i nyon mongs pa de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs rnams so //
translated: They are the collection of afflictions and secondary afflictions other than those mentioned.

original: nyon mongs pa de dag nyid rno ba'i phyir dang sems kyi rgyud phra rab 'bigs pa'i phyir mda' lta bu yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dag nyid rno ba'i phyir dang sems kyi rgyud phra rab 'bigs pa'i phyir mda' lta bu yin la /
translated: Since those afflictions are sharp and pierce the subtle continuum of the mind, they are like arrows.

original: rags pa'i tshul gyis 'bigs shing @219a * //
analyzed: rags pa'i tshul gyis 'bigs shing @219a * //
translated: Since they pierce in a coarse way,

original: gnod pa tshabs che bar bskyed pa'i phyir ni mdung lta bu yin te /
analyzed: gnod pa tshabs che bar bskyed pa'i phyir ni mdung lta bu yin te /
translated: they are like spears, since they generate great harm.

original: de lta bu'i mtshon cha gang yin pa de yis sems kyi rgyud kun tu gang ba ste lus la phog pa'i mtshon cha zug rngur lus pa dang / phyi rol mchod pa dang 'dra bar bag la nyal ba dang / kun nas dkris pa'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyis sems la khyab pa'i rgyu des na gnyen po'i chos la rtsol ba'i dbang med par shin tu zhum par gyur cing 'phags pa'i lam la rtsol mi nus par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: de lta bu'i mtshon cha gang yin pa de yis sems kyi rgyud kun tu gang ba ste lus la phog pa'i mtshon cha zug rngur lus pa dang / phyi rol mchod pa dang 'dra bar bag la nyal ba dang / kun nas dkris pa'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyis sems la khyab pa'i rgyu des na gnyen po'i chos la rtsol ba'i dbang med par shin tu zhum par gyur cing 'phags pa'i lam la rtsol mi nus par gyur pa'am /
translated: For that reason, it is unable to exert itself in the Dharma of antidotes, and becomes extremely depressed, or unable to exert itself in the noble path.

original: nga rgyal zhing myos pa lta bur gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nga rgyal zhing myos pa lta bur gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is like being proud and intoxicated.

original: nyon mongs pas sems dbang du byas pa'i nyes pa gzhan dag kyang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas sems dbang du byas pa'i nyes pa gzhan dag kyang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate other faults of the mind being controlled by afflictions,🔽it says:

original: dran pa rnyed nas bcings shing myur skrag la //
analyzed: dran pa rnyed nas bcings shing myur skrag la //
translated: Having attained mindfulness, it is bound and quickly frightened.

original: rab tu bcom pas rnam par zhum gyur cing //
analyzed: rab tu bcom pas rnam par zhum gyur cing //
translated: Being completely destroyed, it becomes depressed,

original: g-yo dang sgyu rnams kyis kyang bslus gyur pas //
analyzed: g-yo dang sgyu rnams kyis kyang bslus gyur pas //
translated: and is deceived by deceit and pretense.

original: dman pa bdud kyi spyod yul dag na 'khyam //
analyzed: dman pa bdud kyi spyod yul dag na 'khyam //
translated: And wander in the lower realms, the domain of Mara.🔽

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The inferior ones wander in the domain of the māras.

original: de ltar nyon mongs pas zil gyis mnan te brgyal ba lta bur gnas pa las slar sems kyi gnas skabs rnal du 'dug pa'i dran pa rnyed pa na yang slar nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bcings shing de'i dbang du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pas zil gyis mnan te brgyal ba lta bur gnas pa las slar sems kyi gnas skabs rnal du 'dug pa'i dran pa rnyed pa na yang slar nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bcings shing de'i dbang du 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, having been overcome by the afflictions and remaining as if fainting, when one regains the mindfulness of the mind’s natural state, again one is bound by the afflictions and comes under their power.

original: de nyid kyis na myur du skrag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na myur du skrag par 'gyur te /
translated: By that alone, one quickly becomes frightened.

original: sems rnal du 'dug pa'i tshul la ring por mi gnas par nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyi mtshon cha rnams kyis dkrugs shing skrag par byas la rab tu bcom zhing zil gyis mnan par byas pas sems kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi yul la rtsol mi nus par rnam par
analyzed: sems rnal du 'dug pa'i tshul la ring por mi gnas par nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyi mtshon cha rnams kyis dkrugs shing skrag par byas la rab tu bcom zhing zil gyis mnan par byas pas sems kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi yul la rtsol mi nus par rnam par
translated: The mind does not remain long in a natural state. It is agitated and frightened by the weapons of the mass of afflictions. Since it is thoroughly destroyed and overcome, the mind is unable to strive in the object of samādhi.

original: zhum par 'gyur zhing nus pa dang bral bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhum par 'gyur zhing nus pa dang bral bar 'gyur la /
translated: It becomes depressed and loses its ability.

original: de nyid kyis na sems mi mthun pa'i dbang du gyur pas g-yo sgyu la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang 'byung bas des sems bslus shing 'phags pa'i lam stor bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na sems mi mthun pa'i dbang du gyur pas g-yo sgyu la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang 'byung bas des sems bslus shing 'phags pa'i lam stor bar 'gyur la /
translated: Since the mind is under the influence of that, afflictions such as deceit and hypocrisy also arise. Therefore, the mind is deceived and the noble path is lost.

original: des na sems gnyen po'i stobs dang bral te nus ba zhan cing dman pas mi shes pa'i dbang gis bdud kyi spyod yul nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyi nang na gnas shing yun ring por don med par 'khyam par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na sems gnyen po'i stobs dang bral te nus ba zhan cing dman pas mi shes pa'i dbang gis bdud kyi spyod yul nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyi nang na gnas shing yun ring por don med par 'khyam par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the mind is separated from the power of the antidote. Since it is weak and inferior, through ignorance it remains in the midst of the mass of afflictions, the domain of Mara. For a long time, it wanders aimlessly. This is the meaning.

original: de lta bu'i nyon mongs pa de bsal ba'i phyir zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa yin na yid gtod mi nus par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bu'i nyon mongs pa de bsal ba'i phyir zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa yin na yid gtod mi nus par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to remove such afflictions, if one cultivates serenity and insight, in order to show that one is unable to focus the mind,🔽it says,

original: ji ltar ji ltar zhi gnas la dmigs shing //
analyzed: ji ltar ji ltar zhi gnas la dmigs shing //
translated: However much one focuses on serenity,

original: de dag der yid yang yang gtad pa na //
analyzed: de dag der yid yang yang gtad pa na //
translated: and repeatedly directs the mind to that,

original: @219b de dang de las nyon mongs zhags pa ni //
analyzed: @219b de dang de las nyon mongs zhags pa ni //
translated: from that and that, the noose of afflictions

original: yul la chags pa'i thag pas dbang med drangs //
analyzed: yul la chags pa'i thag pas dbang med drangs //
translated: is helplessly dragged by the rope of attachment to objects.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: As such, how does one abide in śamatha?🔽As such, how does one abide in śamatha?🔽As such, how does one abide in śamatha?🔽As such, how does one abide in śamatha?

original: tshul ji lta ji ltar zhi gnas zhes bya ba dmigs pa'i yul la rtse gcig pa bsam gtan gyi tshul la gnas shing sems kyis dmigs par byed la /
analyzed: tshul ji lta ji ltar zhi gnas zhes bya ba dmigs pa'i yul la rtse gcig pa bsam gtan gyi tshul la gnas shing sems kyis dmigs par byed la /
translated: As such, how does one abide in śamatha?🔽As such, how does one abide in śamatha?

analyzed: rtse gcig pa de thob par bya ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gyi yul gang yang rung ba de dang der yid yang dang yang du gtod cing rtse gcig pa la slob par byed pa na yang de ltar gnas par mi 'gyur te /

original: 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston te /
translated: As such, how does

original: rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs bsal ba'i phyir gang gi tshe zhig gnas kyi stobs kyis sems nang du bsdus te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs bsal ba'i phyir gang gi tshe zhig gnas kyi stobs kyis sems nang du bsdus te /
translated: In order to dispel the host of discursive thoughts, when the mind is withdrawn inward by the power of abiding in solitude,

original: shes rab kyis chos rnams rang bzhin gyis dben zhing rtog pa dang bral ba'i yul la gtad pa na yang nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyis bskyod pas sngon nyams su myong ba'i yul gyi dbang du 'gyur zhing g-yengs par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyis chos rnams rang bzhin gyis dben zhing rtog pa dang bral ba'i yul la gtad pa na yang nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyis bskyod pas sngon nyams su myong ba'i yul gyi dbang du 'gyur zhing g-yengs par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and when the mind is directed by wisdom to the object that is devoid of intrinsic nature and free from discursive thought, still, because of being shaken by the host of afflictions, the mind is carried away by the power of the object experienced in the past and becomes distracted.🔽This is the meaning.

original: de ltar gyur kyang yul la blan pa'i rtsol ba bstan te sems mnyam par gzhag mod ce na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur kyang yul la blan pa'i rtsol ba bstan te sems mnyam par gzhag mod ce na /
translated: Even though this happens, if one teaches the effort of relying on the object, the mind is indeed concentrated.

original: de ltar gnas par dka' bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gnas par dka' bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that this is difficult,

original: brtson pa bsten na rgod pa 'byung 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: brtson pa bsten na rgod pa 'byung 'gyur zhing //
translated: it is said: “If one relies on effort, excitation arises.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is said.🔽

original: brtson pa ni 'dir dge ba'i phyogs la mngon par spro bas bsgrims te 'jug pa la bya'i /
analyzed: brtson pa ni 'dir dge ba'i phyogs la mngon par spro bas bsgrims te 'jug pa la bya'i /
translated: Here, effort is to be understood as the tight focus of the mind on the virtuous side, which is the exertion of the mind.
