original: ra ma na dang / bar ta'i sgrung las byung ba'i si t'a dang / gro bi ta slar dgug pa'i phyir rtsol ba la sogs pa lta bu 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gis kun nas bslang ba las byung ba'i rtsol ba la ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: ra ma na dang / bar ta'i sgrung las byung ba'i si t'a dang / gro bi ta slar dgug pa'i phyir rtsol ba la sogs pa lta bu 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gis kun nas bslang ba las byung ba'i rtsol ba la ni mi bya'o //
translated: One should not make effort that is motivated by attachment and aversion, as in the stories of Rāmaṇa, Sītā, and Drova, or in the effort to summon a ghost.

original: des na 'dir le lo'i gnyen po brtson 'grus kyi sbyor ba bsten cing gnas pa na rtsol bas sems zhi ba las nyams pa'i phyir sems phyi rol du rgod cing 'phyar ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'dir le lo'i gnyen po brtson 'grus kyi sbyor ba bsten cing gnas pa na rtsol bas sems zhi ba las nyams pa'i phyir sems phyi rol du rgod cing 'phyar ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when one is engaged in and devoted to effort, the antidote to laziness, the mind becomes agitated and wild because of effort, and one loses the pacification of the mind.

original: de ltar gyur na brtson pa yang spong mod ce na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na brtson pa yang spong mod ce na /
translated: If one thinks, “In that case, one should abandon effort,”

original: de spangs na ni zhum pa skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de spangs na ni zhum pa skye bar 'gyur //
translated: then, if one abandons it, slackness arises.

original: 'di yi rigs par mnyam 'jug rnyed dka' na //
analyzed: 'di yi rigs par mnyam 'jug rnyed dka' na //
translated: It is difficult to find the proper balance of these two.

original: bdag gi sems dkrugs pa ni ji @220a * //🔽ltar bgyi // zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bdag gi sems dkrugs pa ni ji @220a * // ltar bgyi // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What should I do with my agitated mind?

original: rgod par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa mthong nas brtson pa de spangs te rtsol ba btang bar gyur na /
analyzed: rgod par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa mthong nas brtson pa de spangs te rtsol ba btang bar gyur na /
translated: Seeing the fault of agitation, one abandons effort and slackens one’s exertion.

original: sems nang du zhum zhing dmigs pa la gtod pa mi skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems nang du zhum zhing dmigs pa la gtod pa mi skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind sinks inward and the generation of the focus does not arise.

original: de bas na nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i sems 'di'i tshul las /
analyzed: de bas na nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i sems 'di'i tshul las /
translated: Therefore, from the perspective of this mind that is endowed with afflictions,🔽both the mode of excitation and the mode of sinking are absent and the mind remains in equipoise.

original: rgod pa dang zhum pa'i tshul gnyis ka dang bral zhing cha mnyam par gnas pa ni sems rigs par mnyam du 'jug pa yin pa las de ni shin tu rnyed cing thob par dka' ba nyid kyis na /
analyzed: rgod pa dang zhum pa'i tshul gnyis ka dang bral zhing cha mnyam par gnas pa ni sems rigs par mnyam du 'jug pa yin pa las de ni shin tu rnyed cing thob par dka' ba nyid kyis na /
translated: Since it is very difficult to find and attain the mind that is properly engaged in equipoise,

original: bdag gi sems mi brtan zhing nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyis dkrugs pa ji ltar bgyi zhes pa ste gnyis ka ltar yang skyon du 'gyur zhing brtan pa dang bral bas de ci zhig la spyod par bgyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gi sems mi brtan zhing nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyis dkrugs pa ji ltar bgyi zhes pa ste gnyis ka ltar yang skyon du 'gyur zhing brtan pa dang bral bas de ci zhig la spyod par bgyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is said, “What should I do with this mind of mine that is unstable and disturbed by the mass of afflictions?” In both cases, there is a fault. Since it is devoid of stability, what should one do? This is the meaning.

original: spang ba dang blang ba'i cha ni shes rab kyis 'grub par 'gyur bas de bsten par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: spang ba dang blang ba'i cha ni shes rab kyis 'grub par 'gyur bas de bsten par bya'o zhe na /
translated: Since the aspect of abandonment and adoption is accomplished by wisdom, one should rely upon it.🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir / shes rab la spyod na ni rgod pa 'byung //
analyzed: de'i phyir / shes rab la spyod na ni rgod pa 'byung //
translated: if one engages in wisdom, excitation arises.

original: 'dzin la brten na zhum pa skye bar 'gyur ;
analyzed: 'dzin la brten na zhum pa skye bar 'gyur ;
translated: If one relies on fixation, slackness arises.

original: /'di ni zung du 'jug pa rnyed dka' na //
analyzed: /'di ni zung du 'jug pa rnyed dka' na //
translated: This is the difficulty of attaining the union.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is meant.

original: shes rab ni chos rnams kyi spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid la khyab par ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dpyad pa yin la /
analyzed: shes rab ni chos rnams kyi spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid la khyab par ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dpyad pa yin la /
translated: Wisdom is the thorough analysis of the general and specific characteristics of phenomena just as they are.

original: de lta bu de la gzhan zhig spyod par 'gyur na ni rgod pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bu de la gzhan zhig spyod par 'gyur na ni rgod pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one engages in that kind of analysis, excitation arises.

original: 'di ltar sems zhes bya ba'i yul sna tshogs la rnam par 'phyos pas zhi bar mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems zhes bya ba'i yul sna tshogs la rnam par 'phyos pas zhi bar mi nus so //
translated: In that case, the so-called mind is unable to be at peace because it is distracted by various objects.

original: gal te de spangs nas sems zhi gnas kyi yul gang yang rung ba la gtad pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin cing nang du sdud pa kho na la brten par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te de spangs nas sems zhi gnas kyi yul gang yang rung ba la gtad pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin cing nang du sdud pa kho na la brten par 'gyur na ni /
translated: If one abandons that and relies on fixation alone, by the method of directing the mind to any object of śamatha,

original: shes rab dang bral zhing yul rnams las blan pa'i phyir shes rab kyi cha gsal ba dang bral bas sems nang du zhum pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab dang bral zhing yul rnams las blan pa'i phyir shes rab kyi cha gsal ba dang bral bas sems nang du zhum pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then, because one is separated from wisdom and because one is separated from the clarity of the aspect of wisdom, slackness arises in the mind.

original: de ltar na skyon chags pa 'di'i zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ba zhi gnas dang lhag mthong cha mnyam par gnas pa ni zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na skyon chags pa 'di'i zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ba zhi gnas dang lhag mthong cha mnyam par gnas pa ni zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, the so called union of serenity and insight is called union because serenity and insight remain in equipoise.

original: 'di ltar glang gnyis kyi gnya' shing cha mnyam par gnas pas zhings shin tu sra ba dag kyang legs par 'byed par nus pa dang 'dra bar gang gi tshe sems zhi gnas dang lhag mthong cha mnyam par gnas pa mar me rlung gis ma bskyod pa ltar gnas
analyzed: 'di ltar glang gnyis kyi gnya' shing cha mnyam par gnas pas zhings shin tu sra ba dag kyang legs par 'byed par nus pa dang 'dra bar gang gi tshe sems zhi gnas dang lhag mthong cha mnyam par gnas pa mar me rlung gis ma bskyod pa ltar gnas
translated: Just as a pair of oxen yoked to a single harness remain in equipoise, and thus can be used to plow a very hard field, so too, when the mind remains in equipoise with serenity and insight, it remains like a lamp undisturbed by wind.🔽At that time, the wisdom that abandons the mass of afflictions arises.

original: pa'i tshe nyon mongs pa'i tshogs spangs pa'i ye shes skye ba yin la las dang po pa'i sems ka zung du 'jug pa de shin tu rnyed dka' zhing de ltar @220b gnas par mi nus la /
analyzed: pa'i tshe nyon mongs pa'i tshogs spangs pa'i ye shes skye ba yin la las dang po pa'i sems ka zung du 'jug pa de shin tu rnyed dka' zhing de ltar @220b gnas par mi nus la /
translated: For a beginner, it is very difficult to attain the union of serenity and insight.

original: de nyid kyis na sems nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na sems nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: And since the mind is not able to remain in that way, it is under the power of afflictions.🔽Thus, he says,

original: bdag gi sems dkrugs pa ni ji ltar bgyi //🔽zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bdag gi sems dkrugs pa ni ji ltar bgyi //🔽zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: What shall I do with my disturbed mind?

original: bdag gi sems zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang bral bas rnam par 'jug pa la gnas mi nus pas /
analyzed: bdag gi sems zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang bral bas rnam par 'jug pa la gnas mi nus pas /
translated: Since my mind is devoid of serenity and insight, I am unable to abide in the process of mental attention.

original: dkrugs shing g-yengs par gyur pa 'di ltar spyad par bgyi zhing ci zhig bsgrub par bgyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dkrugs shing g-yengs par gyur pa 'di ltar spyad par bgyi zhing ci zhig bsgrub par bgyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus agitated and distracted, what should I do? What should I accomplish?

original: don de nyid la rtsol ba kho nas 'jug mod ce na /🔽'bad pas 'jug na rgod pa 'byung 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: don de nyid la rtsol ba kho nas 'jug mod ce na / 'bad pas 'jug na rgod pa 'byung 'gyur zhing //
translated: If you say, I am engaged in that very object by striving alone,🔽[the verse] states, If I engage with effort, agitation arises.

original: de glod na ni zhum pa skye bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de glod na ni zhum pa skye bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If I relax, slackness arises.

original: zung du 'jug pa la sogs pa'i tshul du sems de gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa la sogs pa'i tshul du sems de gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: In order for the mind to abide in the manner of union, etc.,

original: shin tu 'bad par bsgrims te 'jug cing rtsol ba na ni sems de rgod cing g-yeng ba 'byung bar 'gyur bas bcom pas rtsol ba las kyang sems gnas pa mi rnyed la /
analyzed: shin tu 'bad par bsgrims te 'jug cing rtsol ba na ni sems de rgod cing g-yeng ba 'byung bar 'gyur bas bcom pas rtsol ba las kyang sems gnas pa mi rnyed la /
translated: if one engages with great effort, with intense concentration, and with striving, then since the mind is overcome by agitation and distraction, mental stability is not attained due to striving.

original: de ltar de nyes pa nyid yin pas de bzlog pa'i phyir 'bad pas 'jug pa'i sems de glod cing rtsol ba btang bar gyur na ni dmigs pa'i yul brjod pa la sogs pa'i skyon gyis sems nang du zhum zhing bying ba skye ba 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de ltar de nyes pa nyid yin pas de bzlog pa'i phyir 'bad pas 'jug pa'i sems de glod cing rtsol ba btang bar gyur na ni dmigs pa'i yul brjod pa la sogs pa'i skyon gyis sems nang du zhum zhing bying ba skye ba 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
translated: Since this is a fault, in order to eliminate it, if you relax the mind that is engaged and let go of your effort, then the fault of the mind sinking and becoming dull will arise due to the mind being withdrawn into the object of meditation.

original: tshul 'di ltar gnas pa las kyang ting nge 'dzin la sems rtse gcig pa'i sems skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul 'di ltar gnas pa las kyang ting nge 'dzin la sems rtse gcig pa'i sems skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the mind that is one-pointed concentration will not arise from abiding in this way.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: 'di yi dbu mar sgrub pa'ang rnyed dka' na //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di yi dbu mar sgrub pa'ang rnyed dka' na // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is difficult to find the middle way in this.🔽This means that it is difficult to find the middle way in this mind that has the faults of excitement and sinking.

original: de ltar rgod pa dang zhum pa'i nyes pa dang ldan pa'i sems 'di dbu mar bsgrub pa zhes bya ba zhum rgod kyi mtha' gnyi ga dang bral bas dbu mar bsgrub cing mnyam par gnas pa gang yin pa de'ang shin tu rnyed par dka' ste /
analyzed: de ltar rgod pa dang zhum pa'i nyes pa dang ldan pa'i sems 'di dbu mar bsgrub pa zhes bya ba zhum rgod kyi mtha' gnyi ga dang bral bas dbu mar bsgrub cing mnyam par gnas pa gang yin pa de'ang shin tu rnyed par dka' ste /
translated: The middle way is to be free from both extremes of sinking and excitement, and to abide in equipoise.

original: sems ni rang zhin gyis gdul dka' ba yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i dbang du gyur pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: sems ni rang zhin gyis gdul dka' ba yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i dbang du gyur pa kho na yin no //
translated: The mind is naturally difficult to tame, and so it is only subject to adverse conditions.

original: de'i phyir / bdag gi sems ni dkrugs pa ji ltar bgyi //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / bdag gi sems ni dkrugs pa ji ltar bgyi // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says: How can my mind be disturbed?

original: sems rang bzhin gyis dag cing 'od gsal ba yin na yang glo bur ba'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyis dkrugs shing rnyog pa can du gyur pas yang dag pa'i don gyi gzugs brnyan 'char zhing mthong bar mi nus na /
analyzed: sems rang bzhin gyis dag cing 'od gsal ba yin na yang glo bur ba'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyis dkrugs shing rnyog pa can du gyur pas yang dag pa'i don gyi gzugs brnyan 'char zhing mthong bar mi nus na /
translated: Even though the mind is pure and luminous by nature, it is disturbed and made turbid by the mass of adventitious afflictions, so that it is unable to see and perceive the reflection of the truth.

original: ji ltar gnas shing bsgrub par bgyi //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas shing bsgrub par bgyi //
translated: How can it be settled and accomplished?

original: zhes sems nyid kyi nyes pa brjod pa'i sgo nas bshags pa'o //
analyzed: zhes sems nyid kyi nyes pa brjod pa'i sgo nas bshags pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is a confession through stating the faults of the mind itself.

original: da ni nyes pa'i rtsa ba ma rig pa las byung ba'i bdag tu 'dzin pa yin par bstan pa'i @221a * //🔽phyir ; bsam gtan nags mes yang dang yang du ni //
analyzed: da ni nyes pa'i rtsa ba ma rig pa las byung ba'i bdag tu 'dzin pa yin par bstan pa'i @221a * // phyir ; bsam gtan nags mes yang dang yang du ni //
translated: Now, in order to show that the root of faults arises from the self-grasping that comes from ignorance,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it says: Again and again, the forest fire of concentration

original: bsam gtan zhes bya ba sems mnyam par gzhag pa ste bsam gtan bzhi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan zhes bya ba sems mnyam par gzhag pa ste bsam gtan bzhi la sogs pa'o //
translated: Concentration is the mind in equipoise, such as the four concentrations.

original: des ni nyon mongs pa'i tshang tshing rnams sreg cing zad par byed pas na nags la mched par byed pa'i me chen po dang 'dra la /
analyzed: des ni nyon mongs pa'i tshang tshing rnams sreg cing zad par byed pas na nags la mched par byed pa'i me chen po dang 'dra la /
translated: Since it burns and consumes the thickets of afflictions, it is like a great fire spreading through a forest.

original: de lta bu'i me des yang dang yang zhes bya ba skad cig ma re re'i dus dag tu'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i me des yang dang yang zhes bya ba skad cig ma re re'i dus dag tu'o //
translated: That fire, again and again, at the time of each moment,

original: ci zhig byed ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig byed ce na /
translated: what does it do?

original: nyes pa'i nags tshal bsregs par gyur na yang //
analyzed: nyes pa'i nags tshal bsregs par gyur na yang //
translated: Even though the thicket of faults is burned,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said:

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa ste /
translated: The faults are desire and so on.

original: de nyid mang zhing bsreg par bya ba'i gzhir gyur pas nags tshal dang 'dra ba de bsam gtan gyi mes bsregs par gyur cing bsal bar gyur kyang /
analyzed: de nyid mang zhing bsreg par bya ba'i gzhir gyur pas nags tshal dang 'dra ba de bsam gtan gyi mes bsregs par gyur cing bsal bar gyur kyang /
translated: Since they are numerous and the basis for what is to be burned, they are like a thicket. Even though that is burned and removed by the fire of concentration,

original: bdag lta'i rtsa ba brtan po ma zad pas //
analyzed: bdag lta'i rtsa ba brtan po ma zad pas //
translated: the root of the view of self is not destroyed.

original: zhes bya ba bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa nyon mongs pa skye ba'i gzhir gyur pas rtsa ba lta bu'i thog ma med pa'i dus nas byung bas shin tu brtan pa gang yin pa de yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis zad par ma byas shing drungs nas dbyung
analyzed: zhes bya ba bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa nyon mongs pa skye ba'i gzhir gyur pas rtsa ba lta bu'i thog ma med pa'i dus nas byung bas shin tu brtan pa gang yin pa de yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis zad par ma byas shing drungs nas dbyung
translated: It is not destroyed by the wisdom of meditative equipoise, nor is it uprooted.

original: bar ma byas par slar yang rab tu skye ba yin no //
analyzed: bar ma byas par slar yang rab tu skye ba yin no //
translated: It arises again.

original: tshul ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: tshul ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How does it arise?

original: char gyis brlan bzhin mdun na rab tu skye //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: char gyis brlan bzhin mdun na rab tu skye // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It arises in the presence of moisture, like a fire.

original: ji ltar dbyar gyi tshe rtsva dang shing dag bsreg par gyur kyang gang zhig rtsa ba tshig cing bton par ma gyur pa de brlan dang phrad pa na slar skye ba dang 'dra bar bdag tu lta ba ni nyes pa kun gyi rtsa ba yin pas de ma
analyzed: ji ltar dbyar gyi tshe rtsva dang shing dag bsreg par gyur kyang gang zhig rtsa ba tshig cing bton par ma gyur pa de brlan dang phrad pa na slar skye ba dang 'dra bar bdag tu lta ba ni nyes pa kun gyi rtsa ba yin pas de ma
translated: Just as when grass and trees are burned in the summer, those whose roots have not been burned and have not been pulled out grow again when they come in contact with moisture, the view of the transitory collection is the root of all faults.

original: spangs na yul gyi rkyen dang ldan pa na nyon mongs pa'i kun du rgyu ba mdun na gnas pa'i tshul du mngon du skye bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: spangs na yul gyi rkyen dang ldan pa na nyon mongs pa'i kun du rgyu ba mdun na gnas pa'i tshul du mngon du skye bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: If one abandons it, then when the conditions of the object are present, the afflictions will arise in the manner of standing in front of one.

original: / nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba ni gang zag la bdag med par mthong bas kyang sel bar 'gyur bas shes rab kyi cha de tsam gyis tshog go zhe na /
analyzed: / nyon mongs pa'i rtsa ba ni gang zag la bdag med par mthong bas kyang sel bar 'gyur bas shes rab kyi cha de tsam gyis tshog go zhe na /
translated: If one asks, “Is it sufficient to have just that much of the part of wisdom that eliminates the root of the afflictions by seeing the selflessness of persons?”

original: gang zhig nyon mongs las 'bras tsam gyi rgyun //
analyzed: gang zhig nyon mongs las 'bras tsam gyi rgyun //
translated: The root of the afflictions is eliminated by seeing the selflessness of persons, but the root of the afflictions is not eliminated by seeing the mere continuum of the afflictions, karma, and results.

original: mthong ba yis kyang de ni ldog 'gyur la //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mthong ba yis kyang de ni ldog 'gyur la // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root of the afflictions is eliminated by seeing the selflessness of phenomena.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'o //
translated: The afflictions are attachment, hostility, and so forth.

original: las ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: las ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: Karma is that which has the nature of being virtuous, nonvirtuous, or neutral.

original: 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: Results are the ripened effects.

original: tsam zhes bya ba dbang phyug la sogs pa la dga' ba ste /
analyzed: tsam zhes bya ba dbang phyug la sogs pa la dga' ba ste /
translated: The word “mere” in the root text indicates that it is not the case that the root of the afflictions is eliminated by seeing Īśvara and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa dang las kyi 'bras bu nyi tshe tsam yin gyi de las logs @221b shig na byed pa po med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang las kyi 'bras bu nyi tshe tsam yin gyi de las logs @221b shig na byed pa po med do //
translated: Afflictions and karma are merely the results, and apart from them there is no agent.

original: de'i rgyu ni skad cig ma'i rgyun chags su 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni skad cig ma'i rgyun chags su 'byung ba ste /
translated: The cause of that is the arising of a continuum of moments.

original: de mthong zhing rnam par dpyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis mthong ba na yang bdag tu lta ba de ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de mthong zhing rnam par dpyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis mthong ba na yang bdag tu lta ba de ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: When the yogi sees that with insight endowed with mindfulness and vigilance, the view of self is reversed.

original: rnam par brtag na 'khor ba'i rgyun ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i 'ba' zhig tsam las 'byung gi de las logs shig na bdag ces bya ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par brtag na 'khor ba'i rgyun ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i 'ba' zhig tsam las 'byung gi de las logs shig na bdag ces bya ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When analyzed, the continuum of cyclic existence arises from just karma and afflictions, because apart from them, a self is not established.

original: de log pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de log pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is that reversed,

original: sems kyi rgyun kyang spong bar byed mod kyis //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun kyang spong bar byed mod kyis //
translated: the continuum of mind is also abandoned.

original: zhes bya ba 'phags pa nyan thos skad cig ma'i tshul du gnas pa'i sems kyi rgyun sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i ngo bo rnam par shes pa'i phung po rdzas su brtags pa de de'i gnyen por rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid ces bya ba 'gog pa'i bden
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'phags pa nyan thos skad cig ma'i tshul du gnas pa'i sems kyi rgyun sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i ngo bo rnam par shes pa'i phung po rdzas su brtags pa de de'i gnyen por rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid ces bya ba 'gog pa'i bden
translated: Thus, the noble śrāvakas, who abide in the momentary mode, eliminate the continuum of the mind, which is the entity of the truth of suffering, the aggregate of consciousness, which is substantially imputed, by the truth of the path that focuses on the truth of cessation, which is called the emptiness of consciousness, which is the antidote to that.

original: pa la dmigs pa'i lam gyi bden pa skyes pas mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i tshul du spong bar byed ce na /
analyzed: pa la dmigs pa'i lam gyi bden pa skyes pas mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i tshul du spong bar byed ce na /
translated: In the manner of opposing and antidotal, one might say.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bor gyur te bdag dang gzhan dmigs pa med pas 'gro ba'i don brtson pa las shin tu ring zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bor gyur te bdag dang gzhan dmigs pa med pas 'gro ba'i don brtson pa las shin tu ring zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It becomes the entity of emptiness, and since self and other are not observed, it is said to be very far from striving for the welfare of beings.

original: gcig tu stong pa'ang ma yin gcig tu mi stong pa'ang ma yin par lta ba'i shes rab khyad par can dang bral ba'i phyir 'khor bar gnas shing sdug bsngal gyis zhum pas gzhan gyi don yongs su rdzogs par byed mi nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig tu stong pa'ang ma yin gcig tu mi stong pa'ang ma yin par lta ba'i shes rab khyad par can dang bral ba'i phyir 'khor bar gnas shing sdug bsngal gyis zhum pas gzhan gyi don yongs su rdzogs par byed mi nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because of being devoid of the special wisdom that views it as neither exclusively empty nor exclusively non-empty, one abides in saṃsāra and is disheartened by suffering, and thus one is unable to completely accomplish the welfare of others. This is the meaning.

original: 'gro ba'i don las ji ltar na ring ba yin zhe na /🔽skyob pa chags pa tsam dang rnam bral bas //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don las ji ltar na ring ba yin zhe na / skyob pa chags pa tsam dang rnam bral bas //
translated: How is it far removed from the benefit of beings?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is free from mere attachment to protection.

original: skyob pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i chos kyis rang gi rgyud skyob par byed pa'am mchod par 'os pa la bya ste 'phags pa dgra bcom pa dag go //
analyzed: skyob pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i chos kyis rang gi rgyud skyob par byed pa'am mchod par 'os pa la bya ste 'phags pa dgra bcom pa dag go //
translated: Protection refers to the Dharma that is endowed with the four noble truths, which protects or is worthy of worship, namely, the noble arhats.

original: de ni chags pa tsam zhes bya ba 'khor bar 'gro ba la rjes su chags pa'i sred pa tsam dang bral zhing de spangs par gyur pas de dang rnam par bral ba yin la /
analyzed: de ni chags pa tsam zhes bya ba 'khor bar 'gro ba la rjes su chags pa'i sred pa tsam dang bral zhing de spangs par gyur pas de dang rnam par bral ba yin la /
translated: It is free from mere attachment to protection, free from mere craving for rebirth in samsara, and it has abandoned that.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / 'gro ba kun la ltos pa med gyur pa'i //
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'gro ba kun la ltos pa med gyur pa'i //
translated: it is indifferent to all beings.

original: zhes bya ba 'gro ba yang yin la kun kyang yin pas 'gro ba kun te khams gsum par gtogs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'gro ba yang yin la kun kyang yin pas 'gro ba kun te khams gsum par gtogs pa thams cad do //
translated: Beings are all, thus all beings are all those belonging to the three realms.

original: de la ltos pa med par gyur pa ni de rnams 'khor ba las gdon cing sdug bsngal las thar bar bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa'i ltos pa'i rtsol ba spangs par gyur pa ste rang gi don lhur len pa dag go //🔽de'i sems kyi rgyun ni mya @222a * //
analyzed: de la ltos pa med par gyur pa ni de rnams 'khor ba las gdon cing sdug bsngal las thar bar bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa'i ltos pa'i rtsol ba spangs par gyur pa ste rang gi don lhur len pa dag go // de'i sems kyi rgyun ni mya @222a * //
translated: The phrase they are not dependent on that means that they have abandoned the effort of dependence, which is the engagement in the liberation of those beings from cyclic existence and from suffering. They are intent on their own aim.

original: ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase the stream of their mind is nirvana indicates that.

original: sems khyi rgyun ni rgyu zad mar me bzhin //
analyzed: sems khyi rgyun ni rgyu zad mar me bzhin //
translated: The stream of mind is like a flame extinguished by the exhaustion of its fuel.

original: phung po lhag ma zad pa'i mya ngan 'das //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma zad pa'i mya ngan 'das // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Nirvana is the exhaustion of the aggregates.🔽The phrase the stream of mind is like a flame extinguished by the exhaustion of its fuel indicates that.

original: de la sems ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la sems ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Here, mind refers to the nature of consciousness.

original: de'i rgyun ni skad cig ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i tshogs te /
analyzed: de'i rgyun ni skad cig ma gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i tshogs te /
translated: The phrase the stream of mind refers to the collection of moments of consciousness that occur in a continuum.

original: rgyun de ye shes kyis dag cing gnas gyur pa na rgyu zad pa'i mar me bzhin zhes bya ba ji ltar mar me'i rgyu snum zad par gyur pa na mar me 'bar ba med par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: rgyun de ye shes kyis dag cing gnas gyur pa na rgyu zad pa'i mar me bzhin zhes bya ba ji ltar mar me'i rgyu snum zad par gyur pa na mar me 'bar ba med par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: When that stream is purified by transcendent wisdom and becomes a different entity, it is like a flame extinguished by the exhaustion of its fuel.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i ye shes kyis bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i ye shes kyis bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa yin la /
translated: Since the gnosis that arises from the vajra-like samadhi abandons the afflictions together with their traces, one attains nirvana.

original: de yang lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /🔽sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i phung po lhag ma tsam gnas pa de yang ye shes kyi mes bsregs te zad cing med par byas nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la gnas par 'gyur pas na 'gro ba'i don bya ba dang shin tu ring
analyzed: de yang lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste / sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i phung po lhag ma tsam gnas pa de yang ye shes kyi mes bsregs te zad cing med par byas nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la gnas par 'gyur pas na 'gro ba'i don bya ba dang shin tu ring
translated: Moreover, it is a nirvana without remainder,🔽for the mere remainder of the aggregates generated by past karma and afflictions is burned by the fire of gnosis, exhausted, and made to cease.

original: ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since one then abides in the expanse of nirvana, it is said that one is “far removed from acting for the welfare of beings.”

original: da ni de lta bu'i 'gro ba'i don ni byang chub kyi sems las byung na de dang rang gi rgyud mi mthun par bstan pa'i phyir /🔽gang yang 'gro kun nyam thag sel byed pa //
analyzed: da ni de lta bu'i 'gro ba'i don ni byang chub kyi sems las byung na de dang rang gi rgyud mi mthun par bstan pa'i phyir / gang yang 'gro kun nyam thag sel byed pa //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the welfare of beings arises from bodhicitta, but that it does not arise from one’s own continuum,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: it is said, “Whatever brings relief to all beings…”

original: gang yang zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The anything is the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: yon tan ji lta bu dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: yon tan ji lta bu dang ldan zhe na /
translated: What sort of good qualities does it have?

original: 'gro ba nyam thag ma lus sel byed pa //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'gro ba nyam thag ma lus sel byed pa // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It removes all the distress of the world.

original: skye ba bzhis bsdus pa'i sems can srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du gnas pa thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gsum gyis gzir cing nyam thag pa ma lus par sel zhing med par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba bzhis bsdus pa'i sems can srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du gnas pa thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gsum gyis gzir cing nyam thag pa ma lus par sel zhing med par byed pa yin no //
translated: It removes, makes non-existent, all the distress of all the sentient beings, up to the peak of existence, included in the four modes of birth, who are oppressed by the three sufferings.

original: de lta bu su zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu su zhig yin zhe na /
translated: Who is it that does that?

original: byang chub sems ni bdud rtsi bcud kyis len //🔽zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems ni bdud rtsi bcud kyis len // zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: The Thought of Enlightenment is the elixir of immortality.

original: byang chub tu smon pa dang 'jug pa'i bdag nyid can gyi byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: byang chub tu smon pa dang 'jug pa'i bdag nyid can gyi byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: It is the Thought of Enlightenment, which has the nature of the aspiration and the entrance to enlightenment.

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What sort of distinction does it have?

original: bdud rtsi bcud kyis len zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bdud rtsi bcud kyis len zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is the elixir of immortality.

original: bdud rtsi za ba ni 'chi bas mi tshugs pa dang 'dra bar byang chub kyi sems kyis 'phags pa'i lam gyi srog 'dzin cing go 'phang thams cad thob par byed pas bdud rtsi lta bu yin la /
analyzed: bdud rtsi za ba ni 'chi bas mi tshugs pa dang 'dra bar byang chub kyi sems kyis 'phags pa'i lam gyi srog 'dzin cing go 'phang thams cad thob par byed pas bdud rtsi lta bu yin la /
translated: Consuming nectar is like being invulnerable to death, because the spirit of enlightenment sustains the life of the noble path and causes one to attain all the states of spiritual greatness.

original: sman bcud kyis len bsten pas ni skra dkar dang gnyer ma sel zhing nad med par @222b byed pa dang 'dra bar byang chub kyi sems kyis bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang nyon mongs pa 'joms par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sman bcud kyis len bsten pas ni skra dkar dang gnyer ma sel zhing nad med par @222b byed pa dang 'dra bar byang chub kyi sems kyis bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang nyon mongs pa 'joms par byed pa yin no //
translated: Relying on the elixir of medicine is like removing gray hair and wrinkles and becoming free of illness, because the spirit of enlightenment conquers the sufferings and afflictions of oneself and others.

original: de ltar yon tan dang ldan pa nyid kyis na nyams su blangs dgos pa nyid kyi phyir /🔽byang chub rgyu ru mi rtog bsgom pa na //
analyzed: de ltar yon tan dang ldan pa nyid kyis na nyams su blangs dgos pa nyid kyi phyir / byang chub rgyu ru mi rtog bsgom pa na //
translated: Since it has such qualities, it is necessary to practice it.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says:🔽If you do not meditate on it as the cause of enlightenment,

original: byang chub ni rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: byang chub ni rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Enlightenment is the gnosis of omniscience.

original: de thob par bya ba'i rgyu dang gzhir mi rtog pa bsgom pa na zhes gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa'i tshul gyis spros pa med pa'i don yid la bya ba la slob na'o //
analyzed: de thob par bya ba'i rgyu dang gzhir mi rtog pa bsgom pa na zhes gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa'i tshul gyis spros pa med pa'i don yid la bya ba la slob na'o //
translated: When one is training in the meaning of non-conceptuality and non-elaboration by way of abandoning the apprehended and apprehender, when one is meditating on the cause and basis for attaining that.

original: gnas skabs der sems de ltar gnas sam zhe na /
analyzed: gnas skabs der sems de ltar gnas sam zhe na /
translated: Is the mind at that time abiding in that way?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: de tshe bdag ni rnam rtog kho nar rgyug / ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de tshe bdag ni rnam rtog kho nar rgyug / ces bya ba smos te /
translated: At that time, I run only with discursive thought.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi ye shes chen po bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir slob par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi ye shes chen po bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir slob par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: At the time of training in order to accomplish the great wisdom of the mind of enlightenment,

original: de tshe bdag ni rnam rtog kho nar rgyug / ces smos te /
analyzed: de tshe bdag ni rnam rtog kho nar rgyug / ces smos te /
translated: at that time, I run only with discursive thought.

original: las dang po pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las dang po pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because one is a beginner,

original: bdag gi sems ni rnam par rtog pa kho nar rgyug ste /
analyzed: bdag gi sems ni rnam par rtog pa kho nar rgyug ste /
translated: one’s mind runs only with discursive thought.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pas bskyed pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa du ma la rgyug cing phyogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pas bskyed pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa du ma la rgyug cing phyogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It runs and moves in many ways with discursive thought, which is generated by incorrect imagination.

original: kho na zhes bya ba'i sgras ni tshul gzhan las rang dga' ba ste /
analyzed: kho na zhes bya ba'i sgras ni tshul gzhan las rang dga' ba ste /
translated: The word “only” in the verse indicates that the mind is independent of other conditions.

original: des na gzhan gyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir sems kyi gzhi la ni rnam par rtog pa kho na rten gyis gzhan dag ma yin te /
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir sems kyi gzhi la ni rnam par rtog pa kho na rten gyis gzhan dag ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the mind is the basis of conceptualization, not the other way around, because it is not the object of another.

original: dper na srid sgrub kho na gzhu thogs pa yin gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na srid sgrub kho na gzhu thogs pa yin gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, only Arjuna held the bow, not the others.

original: 'dir dris pa de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'dir dris pa de ni mi rigs te /
translated: Here, the question is not appropriate.

original: chu bo rgya mtsho ri bo rnams //
analyzed: chu bo rgya mtsho ri bo rnams //
translated: The rivers, the oceans, and the mountains

original: 'di dag sems kyi rnam 'phrul yin //
analyzed: 'di dag sems kyi rnam 'phrul yin //
translated: are the manifestations of the mind.

original: zhes bshad pas sems las logs shig na gzhan med pa'i phyir rten dang brten par gdags su mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bshad pas sems las logs shig na gzhan med pa'i phyir rten dang brten par gdags su mi rung zhe na /
translated: Since there is nothing other than the mind, it is not suitable to designate a basis and what is based on it.

original: de lta yin mod kyis mdo sde ba'i tshul gyis yul sems gnyi ga grub par 'dod pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de lta yin mod kyis mdo sde ba'i tshul gyis yul sems gnyi ga grub par 'dod pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: Although that is so, there is no contradiction because the Sautrāntika system asserts that both objects and mind are established.

original: bsgoms pa la gnas kyang rnam par rtog pa bsal bar ma nus pa'i tshul gzhan dag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgoms pa la gnas kyang rnam par rtog pa bsal bar ma nus pa'i tshul gzhan dag bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the other way of not being able to eliminate conceptualization even though one abides in meditation,🔽the root text says:

original: rmi lam tshul 'drar 'gro kun gang gis kyang //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rmi lam tshul 'drar 'gro kun gang gis kyang // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: All beings are like that, as in a dream.

original: rmi lam zhes bya ba ni sngon nyams su myong ba'i rgyus med kyang snang du rung ba ste slu ba nyid do //
analyzed: rmi lam zhes bya ba ni sngon nyams su myong ba'i rgyus med kyang snang du rung ba ste slu ba nyid do //
translated: A dream is something that is suitable to appear without a cause, due to the ripening of latent propensities.

original: ji ltar rmi lam na yul gyi bzang mo la sogs pa @223a * //🔽chags pa'i yul lam /
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam na yul gyi bzang mo la sogs pa @223a * // chags pa'i yul lam /
translated: Just as in a dream, even though there is no object, such as a beautiful woman,

original: dgra bo dang sdang ba'i yul med kyang snang ba'o //
analyzed: dgra bo dang sdang ba'i yul med kyang snang ba'o //
translated: an object of attachment or an object of anger, such as an enemy, appears.

original: tshul 'dra zhes bya ba ni de dang tshul mthun pa'o //
analyzed: tshul 'dra zhes bya ba ni de dang tshul mthun pa'o //
translated: The phrase “as in a dream” means that it is similar to that.

original: ci zhig mthun zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig mthun zhe na /
translated: What is similar?

original: 'gro ba ste snying po med pa'i 'khor ba'i gnas 'di na gnas pa'i dngos po rnams so //
analyzed: 'gro ba ste snying po med pa'i 'khor ba'i gnas 'di na gnas pa'i dngos po rnams so //
translated: The beings who are in this world of cyclic existence, which is like a meaningless dream.

original: ji ltar mthun zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mthun zhe na /
translated: How are they similar?

original: gang gis kyang ;🔽ci yang 'dzin pa nyid du mi byed par //
analyzed: gang gis kyang ; ci yang 'dzin pa nyid du mi byed par //
translated: “By no one”🔽means that they are not apprehended by anyone at all.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “In any way” means that they are not apprehended in any way whatsoever.

original: 'di ltar 'gro ba rnams kyi nang du rnam par rtog pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gro ba rnams kyi nang du rnam par rtog pa'am /
translated: Thus, in the world, the conceptual thoughts of beings

original: 'dzin pa po gang dag gis kyang yul lam gzung bar bya ba zhes pa'i dngos po phra rags ci yang 'dzin cing len pa nyid du mi byed do //
analyzed: 'dzin pa po gang dag gis kyang yul lam gzung bar bya ba zhes pa'i dngos po phra rags ci yang 'dzin cing len pa nyid du mi byed do //
translated: grasps or appropriates any object, that is, any entity, whether gross or subtle.🔽For example, in a dream, one sees and is attached to many kinds of objects, whether pleasant or unpleasant. But in reality, they do not exist at all, because they are by nature illusory.

original: dper na rmi lam na yul gyi dngos po sdug pa dang mi sdug pa rnam pa du ma mthong zhing zhen pa'i yul du gyur kyang de ni 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir yang dag par na ci yang yod pa ma yin pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam na yul gyi dngos po sdug pa dang mi sdug pa rnam pa du ma mthong zhing zhen pa'i yul du gyur kyang de ni 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir yang dag par na ci yang yod pa ma yin pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: Even though one meditates on the fact that all phenomena are like a dream,

original: bsgoms kyang rtog pa po dang rtog bya yi //
analyzed: bsgoms kyang rtog pa po dang rtog bya yi //
translated: one still comes under the influence of discursive thought,

original: rnam rtog dgra yi spyod yul nyid la spyod //
analyzed: rnam rtog dgra yi spyod yul nyid la spyod //
translated: the domain of the enemy.

original: ces bya ba ni chos thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra'o zhes thos shing shes pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni chos thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra'o zhes thos shing shes pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi //
translated: The meaning of the word “even” is that one does not just hear and understand that all phenomena are like a dream.

original: don de yang dang yang du bsgoms shing goms par byas kyang rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du gyur to zhes bya ba ni kyang gi sgra'i don yin no //
analyzed: don de yang dang yang du bsgoms shing goms par byas kyang rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du gyur to zhes bya ba ni kyang gi sgra'i don yin no //
translated: One meditates on that meaning again and again and becomes familiar with it.

original: rnam par rtog pa de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that conceptualization?

original: rtog pa po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rtog pa po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “the conceptualizer, the object of conceptualization,” etc.

original: rtog par byed pas na rtog pa po ste 'dzin pa po'i sems so //🔽rtogs shing khong du chud par bya ba yin pas na rtogs bya ste /
analyzed: rtog par byed pas na rtog pa po ste 'dzin pa po'i sems so // rtogs shing khong du chud par bya ba yin pas na rtogs bya ste /
translated: The conceptualizer is the mind that grasps because it conceptualizes.

original: gzung bar bya ba'i yul rnams so //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba'i yul rnams so //
translated: The object of conceptualization is the objects that are to be understood and realized.

original: de dag yod pa nyid du rtog pa gang yin pa de ni rtog pa po dang rtogs bya ba'i rnam rtog ste /
analyzed: de dag yod pa nyid du rtog pa gang yin pa de ni rtog pa po dang rtogs bya ba'i rnam rtog ste /
translated: The conceptualization of the conceptualizer and the object of conceptualization is the conceptualization of the grasped and the grasper.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa can rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa can rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of “those who have the conceptualization of grasped and grasper.”

original: de nyid ni bdag med pa dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas na dgra ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni bdag med pa dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas na dgra ste /
translated: Since that is the adversary of selflessness and non-conceptualization, it is the enemy.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i dgra bo de lta bu'i spyod yul du gyur pa nyid la bdag rtag tu spyod cing de'i dbang du gyur pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i dgra bo de lta bu'i spyod yul du gyur pa nyid la bdag rtag tu spyod cing de'i dbang du gyur pa'am /
translated: I always engage in the domain of that kind of conceptual enemy, and I am under its power.

original: des bcom par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: des bcom par gyur pa ste /
translated: I am destroyed by it.

original: rmi lam ltar brdzun pa yin par shes shing yul la sems blan zhing bsgoms su zin kyang thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs kyis bcom par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rmi lam ltar brdzun pa yin par shes shing yul la sems blan zhing bsgoms su zin kyang thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi rnam par rtog pa'i tshogs kyis bcom par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even though one knows that they are false, like a dream, and one meditates by restraining the mind from objects, still the host of conceptual thoughts, which have been present since beginningless time, will destroy it.

original: de ltar rnam par rtog pa bzlog dka' ba dang / rang gi gnyen po nyam chung ba @223b nyid du shes nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog pa bzlog dka' ba dang / rang gi gnyen po nyam chung ba @223b nyid du shes nas /
translated: Thus, knowing that conceptual thoughts are difficult to stop and that their antidote is weak,

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid la gsol ba gdab par bstan pa'i phyir /🔽gtso bo shin tu mi bzad 'tshe ba 'di //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid la gsol ba gdab par bstan pa'i phyir / gtso bo shin tu mi bzad 'tshe ba 'di //
translated: in order to show that one should supplicate the Bhagavān,🔽[the text] says:🔽“O Chief, please see this extremely unbearable harm

original: gzigs la bdag la lta ba dri med stsol //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzigs la bdag la lta ba dri med stsol // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: and grant me the stainless view.”

original: gtso bo zhes bya ba ni bod pa ste /
analyzed: gtso bo zhes bya ba ni bod pa ste /
translated: “Chief” is an address.

original: chos thams cad la mnga' brnyes pa'am /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mnga' brnyes pa'am /
translated: Because he has attained mastery over all phenomena

original: nyon mongs pa'i nad rnams gso bar byed pas na gtso bo'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i nad rnams gso bar byed pas na gtso bo'o //
translated: or because he heals the diseases of the afflictions, he is the Chief.

original: shin tu mi bzad 'tshe ba 'di //
analyzed: shin tu mi bzad 'tshe ba 'di //
translated: “Extremely unbearable harm”

original: zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems kyi rgyud la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rgyud las byung ba'i gnod pa 'phral dang yun du lus dang sems kyi rgyud gdung bar byed pa drag cing shin tu mi bzad pa mngon sum du gyur pa 'di la
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems kyi rgyud la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rgyud las byung ba'i gnod pa 'phral dang yun du lus dang sems kyi rgyud gdung bar byed pa drag cing shin tu mi bzad pa mngon sum du gyur pa 'di la
translated: This is the direct experience of the intense and unbearable harm that arises from the continuum of afflictions such as attachment in one's mental continuum, which torments the continuum of body and mind immediately and for a long time.

original: gzigs la bdag la lta ba dri med stsol zhes bya bar 'tsho bar gyur pa de dag gi sman du gyur pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba mi mthun pa dang nyes pa'i dri mas ma gos pa stsol cing ce'o //
analyzed: gzigs la bdag la lta ba dri med stsol zhes bya bar 'tsho bar gyur pa de dag gi sman du gyur pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba mi mthun pa dang nyes pa'i dri mas ma gos pa stsol cing ce'o //
translated: Look at that and grant me the stainless view means grant the correct view that is the medicine for those who have become like that, which is uncontaminated by adverse conditions and faults.

original: de dag ni rang gi rtsol ba'i stobs kyis bskyed mod ce na /🔽bdag ni gces pa gang dang rtog pa gang //
analyzed: de dag ni rang gi rtsol ba'i stobs kyis bskyed mod ce na / bdag ni gces pa gang dang rtog pa gang //
translated: If it is asked whether they are generated by the power of their own effort,🔽the reply is that🔽the self and the essence

original: de dang de nyid dang por rnam par nyams //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dang de nyid dang por rnam par nyams // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: are first destroyed.

original: 'di ltar gces shing snying por bya ba'i dngos po tshad med pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar gces shing snying por bya ba'i dngos po tshad med pa'am /
translated: Since there are immeasurable things that are cherished and held as essential,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnyen po'i lam gang dang gang la rtog cing dpyod par gnas pa na lam de dang de nyid dang po kho nar rnam par nyams shing 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnyen po'i lam gang dang gang la rtog cing dpyod par gnas pa na lam de dang de nyid dang po kho nar rnam par nyams shing 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: When one dwells in the investigation and analysis of the path of antidotes that is in conformity with the perfections, then that very path is first of all destroyed and ruined.

original: don du na nyon mongs pa'i tshogs gzhom pa'i phyir gnyen po gang la brten kyang de nyam chung bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis gnon par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don du na nyon mongs pa'i tshogs gzhom pa'i phyir gnyen po gang la brten kyang de nyam chung bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis gnon par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In fact, no matter what antidote one relies on in order to destroy the mass of afflictions, it is weak and is overcome by the opposing factors. This is the meaning.

original: da ni skyon rnams bdag nyid kyi nyes pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni skyon rnams bdag nyid kyi nyes pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach that the faults are the fault of the self,

original: yang na sngon tshe bgyis pa'i bdag nyid nyes //
analyzed: yang na sngon tshe bgyis pa'i bdag nyid nyes //
translated: Or else, the fault is one's own fault committed in the past.

original: 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis ci zhig mdzad //🔽ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis ci zhig mdzad // ces bya ba smos te /
translated: What did the Bhagavān do in this regard?

original: yang na 'di ni rang nyid las byung ba'i nyes pa yin pas ci zhig mdzad du mchis zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na 'di ni rang nyid las byung ba'i nyes pa yin pas ci zhig mdzad du mchis zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, this is a fault arising from oneself. What could be done?

original: gang gi tshe nyes pa byas she na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyes pa byas she na /
translated: When was the fault committed?

original: sngon tshe bgyis pa ste thog ma med pa'i dus nas brgyud pa'i sngon gyi tshe rabs rnams su yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pas bskyed pa'i phyir phyin ci log gi bag chags su bsags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon tshe bgyis pa ste thog ma med pa'i dus nas brgyud pa'i sngon gyi tshe rabs rnams su yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pas bskyed pa'i phyir phyin ci log gi bag chags su bsags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are produced by false imagination, they are accumulated as the latent impressions of error.

original: ci zhig ce na /🔽bdag gi nyes pa 'di lta ste gnyen @224a * //
analyzed: ci zhig ce na / bdag gi nyes pa 'di lta ste gnyen @224a * //
translated: What are they?🔽These faults of mine, that is, the faults of being under the control of error, etc.,

original: po la brten cing snying por byas pa la tshol yang log pa'i dbang du gyur pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa'i skyon chags pa 'di la'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das ni bdud bzhi bcom pa'am /
analyzed: po la brten cing snying por byas pa la tshol yang log pa'i dbang du gyur pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa'i skyon chags pa 'di la'o // bcom ldan 'das ni bdud bzhi bcom pa'am /
translated: which are based on and made essential by friends, are sought after.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan drug dang ldan pa ste sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan drug dang ldan pa ste sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Bhagavān is the Buddha, who has conquered the four demons or who possesses the six qualities such as lordship.

original: de lta bu bcom ldan 'das khyod kyis ci zhig mdzad ces bya ba ni bcos dka' ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bu bcom ldan 'das khyod kyis ci zhig mdzad ces bya ba ni bcos dka' ba ste /
translated: What have you, Bhagavān, done like that? It is difficult to correct.

original: nyon mongs kyi dbang du gyur cing bdud kyi spyod yul na 'khyam pa ni rang gi nyes pa yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs kyi dbang du gyur cing bdud kyi spyod yul na 'khyam pa ni rang gi nyes pa yin la /
translated: Being under the control of afflictions and wandering in the domain of Māra is one's own fault.

original: 'gro ba rnams ni las bdag gir bya ba yin pas rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu nyid la spyod kyi /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams ni las bdag gir bya ba yin pas rang gis byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu nyid la spyod kyi /
translated: Beings are the owners of their karma, and they experience the results of their own actions.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis byed pa po ni bcom ldan 'das ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis byed pa po ni bcom ldan 'das ma yin te /
translated: The Lord is not the agent of pleasure and pain.

original: de'i phyir mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las kyang /
translated: Therefore, a sutra declares:

original: nga ni zhing yin gyi sa bon ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nga ni zhing yin gyi sa bon ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: I am the field, not the seed.

original: don de nyid dpes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid dpes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To illustrate this point with an example,

original: 'jig rten kun gyi mun sel nyi ma yang //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten kun gyi mun sel nyi ma yang // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the sun dispels the darkness of the entire world.

original: 'jig rten yang yin la kun kyang yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten kun te /
analyzed: 'jig rten yang yin la kun kyang yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten kun te /
translated: The entire world is the entire world because it is the world and it is all.

original: thams cad la snang bar byed par tshul mthun pas rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i 'jig rten gnyi ga la bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad la snang bar byed par tshul mthun pas rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i 'jig rten gnyi ga la bya'o //
translated: It is called the entire world because it is similar in that it illuminates both the world of the moving and unmoving.

original: de rnams kyi mun pa ni snang ba med pa'i smag tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi mun pa ni snang ba med pa'i smag tu gyur pa ste /
translated: Darkness is the absence of light and the presence of gloom.

original: de sel cing 'joms par byed pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de sel cing 'joms par byed pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The sun dispels and destroys that darkness.

original: su zhig ce na /
analyzed: su zhig ce na /
translated: Who does this?

original: nyi ma ste 'od zer stong ldan no //
analyzed: nyi ma ste 'od zer stong ldan no //
translated: The sun is the one with a thousand rays.

original: de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i nyi ma yang /🔽dmus long dag gis mun nag sel mi bgyid //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i nyi ma yang / dmus long dag gis mun nag sel mi bgyid //
translated: The sun, which has such qualities,🔽does not dispel the darkness for the blind from birth.

original: ces pa dmus long zhes bya ba skyes ma thag nas long bar gyur pa dag gis mun nag ni sel cing 'joms par mi byed mod kyi /
analyzed: ces pa dmus long zhes bya ba skyes ma thag nas long bar gyur pa dag gis mun nag ni sel cing 'joms par mi byed mod kyi /
translated: The blind from birth, who are blind from the time of their birth, do not have their darkness dispelled or destroyed.

original: de ni nyi ma'i nyes pa ma yin gyi dmus long rang nyid kyi nyes pa las byung ba yin no //🔽de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos kyi nyi mas sde snod gsum dang ldan pa'i dam pa'i chos kyi 'od zer gyis 'gro ba'i snying la gnas pa'i mi shes pa'i mun pa 'joms par spyod na yang lta ba log pa la zhen cing shes rab kyi
analyzed: de ni nyi ma'i nyes pa ma yin gyi dmus long rang nyid kyi nyes pa las byung ba yin no // de bzhin du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos kyi nyi mas sde snod gsum dang ldan pa'i dam pa'i chos kyi 'od zer gyis 'gro ba'i snying la gnas pa'i mi shes pa'i mun pa 'joms par spyod na yang lta ba log pa la zhen cing shes rab kyi
translated: This is not the sun’s fault, but is due to the fault of the blind themselves.

original: mig dang bral ba rnams kyi nyes pa sel bar mi mdzad pa ni 'gro ba nyid kyi nyes pa yin gyi ston pa'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig dang bral ba rnams kyi nyes pa sel bar mi mdzad pa ni 'gro ba nyid kyi nyes pa yin gyi ston pa'i ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, when the sun of the Buddha Bhagavats, with the rays of the Dharma of the Three Baskets, dispels the darkness of ignorance in the hearts of beings, those who are attached to false views and are deprived of the eye of wisdom do not have their faults dispelled. This is the fault of beings, not of the Teacher.

original: de ltar rang gi nyes pa'i rang bzhin smras nas /
analyzed: de ltar rang gi nyes pa'i rang bzhin smras nas /
translated: Having thus described the nature of his own faults,

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa'i lam gyis gso bar dka' ba'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa'i lam gyis gso bar dka' ba'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate the difficulty of curing them by the noble path,🔽he says:

original: yun ring dus su nad gzhi sten byed cing //
analyzed: yun ring dus su nad gzhi sten byed cing //
translated: For a long time he has relied on the basis of the disease,

original: der yang rgyun du @224b sems ni rnam rmongs pa'i //🔽mdze can rkang pa lag pa chad pa la //
analyzed: der yang rgyun du @224b sems ni rnam rmongs pa'i // mdze can rkang pa lag pa chad pa la //
translated: and his mind is constantly confused about it.🔽What can be done for a leper whose hands and feet have fallen off

original: thang 'ga' sman bsten pa yis ci bgyir mchis //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: thang 'ga' sman bsten pa yis ci bgyir mchis // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: by his occasionally taking medicine?🔽The leper is one who is seized by a disease that cannot be cured.

original: mdze'i nad gsor mi rung bas zin pa la sman gyis ci bgyir mchis zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mdze'i nad gsor mi rung bas zin pa la sman gyis ci bgyir mchis zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: What can be done for him by his occasionally taking medicine?

original: mdze can ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mdze can ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is a leper like?

original: yun rings dus su nad gzhi rten byed cing //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yun rings dus su nad gzhi rten byed cing //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
translated: For a long time he has relied on the basis of the disease.

original: las gang gis mdze skyed par byed pa dkon mchog gi rten bshig pa la sogs pa zas dang spyod lam mi 'phrod pa la sogs pa'i nad gzhi de la yun ring po'i dus su rten cing gnas par byed pa na'ang nad gzhi ste de yang rtag par rgyun
analyzed: las gang gis mdze skyed par byed pa dkon mchog gi rten bshig pa la sogs pa zas dang spyod lam mi 'phrod pa la sogs pa'i nad gzhi de la yun ring po'i dus su rten cing gnas par byed pa na'ang nad gzhi ste de yang rtag par rgyun
translated: The karma that generates leprosy is the basis of the disease, such as destroying a reliquary, and so on, and the disease is the long-lasting support of that basis.

original: du sems rnam par rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: du sems rnam par rmongs pa ste /
translated: The disease is also the continuous delusion of the mind.

original: de bsal ba'i thabs kyi sbyor ba la thang 'ga' yang gnas par mi byed pa dang / yang zhes bya ba nad gzhi la brten pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi de la sems zhen par yang byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bsal ba'i thabs kyi sbyor ba la thang 'ga' yang gnas par mi byed pa dang / yang zhes bya ba nad gzhi la brten pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi de la sems zhen par yang byed pa'o //
translated: The method of removing that is not to remain for even a moment in the application of that method.

original: gzhan yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is it like?

original: rkang pa lag pa chad pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rkang pa lag pa chad pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said that the legs and arms are cut off.

original: de ltar nad gzhi la gnas shing gso ba ma byas pa'i dbang gis mdzes lus thams cad la khyab ste /
analyzed: de ltar nad gzhi la gnas shing gso ba ma byas pa'i dbang gis mdzes lus thams cad la khyab ste /
translated: Thus, the disease is the basis of the body, and due to not being treated, the disease spreads throughout the entire body.

original: mthar rkang pa dang lag pa dag kyang chad cing 'brul bar 'gyur ba'i mdze can la dus thang 'ga' zhig mdze la phan pa'i sman bsten cing zos kyang de yis gso ba'i don mi byed pas ci bgyir mchis zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mthar rkang pa dang lag pa dag kyang chad cing 'brul bar 'gyur ba'i mdze can la dus thang 'ga' zhig mdze la phan pa'i sman bsten cing zos kyang de yis gso ba'i don mi byed pas ci bgyir mchis zhes bya ste /
translated: What can be done?

original: des nad med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des nad med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It does not mean that he will become healthy.

original: de bzhin du rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i nad kyi rgyud ni bdag tu lta ba yin pas lta ba de la dus yun ring por gnas shing mngon par zhen par yang byed la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i nad kyi rgyud ni bdag tu lta ba yin pas lta ba de la dus yun ring por gnas shing mngon par zhen par yang byed la /
translated: In the same way, the cause of the disease of the afflictions that belong to one’s own continuum is the view of self. Therefore, one should not remain for a long time and should not adhere to that view.🔽Since one does not seek the ārya path that is its antidote, it is incurable.

original: de'i gnyen por 'phags pa'i lam yang mi 'tshol bas gsor mi rung bar gyur pa dag la ni yang dag pa'i lam gyis lam gyi bya ba mi byed de zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por 'phags pa'i lam yang mi 'tshol bas gsor mi rung bar gyur pa dag la ni yang dag pa'i lam gyis lam gyi bya ba mi byed de zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The correct path does not perform the function of a path for those who are incurable.🔽This is the meaning.

original: yang rang gi nyes pa'i tshul las byung ba'i dpe gzhan dag gis kyang bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang rang gi nyes pa'i tshul las byung ba'i dpe gzhan dag gis kyang bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this with another example that arises from one’s own faults, he says:

original: sems kyi shing ni thog ma med dus can //
analyzed: sems kyi shing ni thog ma med dus can //
translated: The tree of mind is without beginning.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here is the meaning of the verse.

original: sems ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs te /
analyzed: sems ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs te /
translated: Mind is the collection of consciousnesses.

original: de nyid dpe shing dang 'dra bas na shing ngo //
analyzed: de nyid dpe shing dang 'dra bas na shing ngo //
translated: Since it is like a tree, it is a tree.

original: dus ji tsam nas byung zhe na /
analyzed: dus ji tsam nas byung zhe na /
translated: How long has it been in existence?

original: thog ma med dus can zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: thog ma med dus can zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said to be without beginning.

original: thog ma med pa yang yin la dus kyang yin pas thog ma med dus can /🔽dus can ni nyi ma dang @225a * //
analyzed: thog ma med pa yang yin la dus kyang yin pas thog ma med dus can / dus can ni nyi ma dang @225a * //
translated: Since it is without beginning and it is time, it is without beginning.

original: zla ba dang gza' dang skar ma la sogs pas yongs su bcad pa la bya ba la /
analyzed: zla ba dang gza' dang skar ma la sogs pas yongs su bcad pa la bya ba la /
translated: Time is the division of the sun, moon, planets, stars, and so on.

original: de yang 'khor ba la thog ma med pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'khor ba la thog ma med pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Since samsara is without beginning, it is said to be so.

original: de lta bu'i dus su shing de gang gis skyed ce na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i dus su shing de gang gis skyed ce na /
translated: By what is that tree generated at such a time?

original: nyon mongs kha ba'i khu bas brlan bgos pa //
analyzed: nyon mongs kha ba'i khu bas brlan bgos pa //
translated: It is moistened by the sap of the afflictions.

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: Here is the meaning of the verse.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa yin la /
translated: The afflictions are attachment and so on.

original: de dag nyid ni 'phags pa ma yin zhing ro myangs na gdug la mi zhim pas kha ba'i khu ba ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid ni 'phags pa ma yin zhing ro myangs na gdug la mi zhim pas kha ba'i khu ba ste /
translated: Since they are not āryas and are poisonous and unpleasant when tasted, they are sap.

original: nim pa la sogs pa'i khu ba dang 'dra la /
analyzed: nim pa la sogs pa'i khu ba dang 'dra la /
translated: It is like the juice of nimba and so on.🔽It is moistened by such juice and is generated and increased.

original: de lta bu'i khu bas brlan pas bskyed cing 'phel bar bya ba yin la rgyu de nyid kyis /
analyzed: de lta bu'i khu bas brlan pas bskyed cing 'phel bar bya ba yin la rgyu de nyid kyis /
translated: By that very cause,

original: ro zhim dngos por bgyi bar mi nus la //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ro zhim dngos por bgyi bar mi nus la // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: it is not possible to make the thing sweet.🔽Just as that bitter wood is moistened and generated by bitter water, it is not possible to make it sweet and so on.

original: ji ltar shing ro kha ba de chu yang kha bas brlan cing bskyed pa dag ni mngar ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du bya bar mi nus pa dang 'dra bas na sems kyi rang bzhin nyon mongs pas bskyed pa yang 'phags pa'i lam gyis bsgyur bar dka'
analyzed: ji ltar shing ro kha ba de chu yang kha bas brlan cing bskyed pa dag ni mngar ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du bya bar mi nus pa dang 'dra bas na sems kyi rang bzhin nyon mongs pas bskyed pa yang 'phags pa'i lam gyis bsgyur bar dka'
translated: Thus, the nature of the mind generated by afflictions is difficult to transform by the ārya path.

original: ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: ji tsam zhig gis she na /
analyzed: ji tsam zhig gis she na /
translated: By how much?

original: yon tan chu yi thigs pas ci ru 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yon tan chu yi thigs pas ci ru 'gyur // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What will it become by a drop of water of good qualities?

original: shing de lta bu la mngar ba la sogs pa'i yon tan brgyad dang ldan pa'i chu'i thigs pa gcig blugs pas ci ru 'gyur te /
analyzed: shing de lta bu la mngar ba la sogs pa'i yon tan brgyad dang ldan pa'i chu'i thigs pa gcig blugs pas ci ru 'gyur te /
translated: What will it become by pouring a drop of water endowed with the eight good qualities, such as sweetness, on that wood?

original: thams cad ro zhim par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad ro zhim par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It will not become sweet.

original: de bzhin du sems kyi rang bzhin thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi nyon mongs pas bskyed pa yang dag pa'i lam gyis bsgyur cing bcos par dka' ba dag la ni gnyen po'i chos yon tan gyi chu'i thigs pa tsam gyis nyon mongs pa'i tshogs sbyong zhing 'phags
analyzed: de bzhin du sems kyi rang bzhin thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi nyon mongs pas bskyed pa yang dag pa'i lam gyis bsgyur cing bcos par dka' ba dag la ni gnyen po'i chos yon tan gyi chu'i thigs pa tsam gyis nyon mongs pa'i tshogs sbyong zhing 'phags
translated: Likewise, it is difficult to transform and correct the mind’s nature, which has been produced by afflictions since beginningless time, with the water drops of the qualities of the antidotal Dharma.

original: pa'i lam gyi chos skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pa'i lam gyi chos skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the collection of afflictions is not purified and the Dharma of the noble path does not arise.

original: yang yid kyi sgo'i nyes pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽bdag yid nyes pa kun gyi rang bzhin nyid //
analyzed: yang yid kyi sgo'i nyes pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir / bdag yid nyes pa kun gyi rang bzhin nyid //
translated: Again, in order to teach the faults of the door of the mind,

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said:🔽The nature of all faults of the mind.

original: bdag gi yid la nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyis dkrugs pas spang ba dang blang bar bya ba'i dpyod pa dang bral bas 'di dang gzhan du gnod par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyes pa kun gyi rang bzhin nam ngo bo nyid du gnas la /
analyzed: bdag gi yid la nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyis dkrugs pas spang ba dang blang bar bya ba'i dpyod pa dang bral bas 'di dang gzhan du gnod par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyes pa kun gyi rang bzhin nam ngo bo nyid du gnas la /
translated: Since my mind is disturbed by the collection of afflictions, it is free from the analysis of what to abandon and what to adopt. Therefore, the nature or essence of all faults such as attachment and anger that are harmful in this life and the next remains.

original: nyes pa de bsal ba'i gnyen po'i mchog ni byang chub kyi sems yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyes pa de bsal ba'i gnyen po'i mchog ni byang chub kyi sems yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The supreme antidote to remove that fault is the spirit of enlightenment.

original: byang chub gser sgyur rtsir gyur ngo mtshar che //
analyzed: byang chub gser sgyur rtsir gyur ngo mtshar che //
translated: It is a wondrous gold-transforming elixir.

original: yon tan de dang de nyid la sbyar nas //
analyzed: yon tan de dang de nyid la sbyar nas //
translated: It is applied to this and that good quality,

original: nyes @225b pa'i dngos po nyid du gyur te gnas //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nyes @225b pa'i dngos po nyid du gyur te gnas // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and it remains as the very substance of the faults.

original: byang chub ni bla na med pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: byang chub ni bla na med pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Enlightenment is unexcelled pristine awareness.

original: de thob pa'i sems la yang rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa'i tshul gyis byang chub ces bya ste /
analyzed: de thob pa'i sems la yang rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa'i tshul gyis byang chub ces bya ste /
translated: The mind that attains it is called enlightenment in the sense that the cause is designated by the effect.

original: de ni gser sgyur rtsi lta bu yin la /🔽ji ltar gser sgyur rtsi yis dngul chu gser du snang ba zhes bya bas lcags gser du bsgyur ba dang 'dra bar byang chub kyi sems des 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sems sbyong zhing /
analyzed: de ni gser sgyur rtsi lta bu yin la / ji ltar gser sgyur rtsi yis dngul chu gser du snang ba zhes bya bas lcags gser du bsgyur ba dang 'dra bar byang chub kyi sems des 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sems sbyong zhing /
translated: It is like a gold-transforming elixir.🔽Just as a gold-transforming elixir is called “the elixir that transforms silver into gold,” and it transforms iron into gold, in the same way, the spirit of enlightenment purifies the mind of the afflictions of cyclic existence and makes it become authentic pristine awareness.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes su 'gyur bar byed pas gser sgyur rtsi lta bu yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes su 'gyur bar byed pas gser sgyur rtsi lta bu yin te /
translated: It is like a gold-transforming elixir.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes sems //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes sems //
translated: The mind of omniscience

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: rgyu de nyid kyis na de ni ngo mtshar che ste ;
analyzed: rgyu de nyid kyis na de ni ngo mtshar che ste ;
translated: For that very reason, it is amazing,

original: rmad du byung ba yin la /🔽de lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems kyi yon tan gyi tshogs rnam pa mang po yod pa dang de nyid la nye bar sbyar zhing /
analyzed: rmad du byung ba yin la / de lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems kyi yon tan gyi tshogs rnam pa mang po yod pa dang de nyid la nye bar sbyar zhing /
translated: it is marvelous.

original: sems bskyed pa la sogs pas sems kyi rgyud sbyang bar brtsam pa na yang de dang rjes su mthun par mi 'jug pas nyes pa'i dngos po nyid du gyur te gnas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa la sogs pas sems kyi rgyud sbyang bar brtsam pa na yang de dang rjes su mthun par mi 'jug pas nyes pa'i dngos po nyid du gyur te gnas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: And when one is engaged in purifying the mindstream with the generation of the Thought, etc., by applying oneself to the many varieties of the collection of virtues of the Thought, one does not engage in them in a manner consistent with that, and so one becomes a thing of fault, a thing of sin, and remains so.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan gnyis kyis brgyan pa'i byang chub kyi sems la sbyar ba na yang nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pas /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan gnyis kyis brgyan pa'i byang chub kyi sems la sbyar ba na yang nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pas /
translated: When one is engaged in the Thought of Enlightenment, which is adorned with the two, mundane and supramundane, virtues, one, under the sway of the afflictions,

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi nyas pa'i dngos po nyid kyis rang bzhin du gyur pa blangs shing nye bar bzung nas gnas te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi nyas pa'i dngos po nyid kyis rang bzhin du gyur pa blangs shing nye bar bzung nas gnas te /
translated: takes up and holds fast to the nature of the thing of sin, of body, speech, and mind.

original: skyes bu ra ro ba'i sems dang 'dra bar yon tan 'dzin mi nus kyi nyes pa'i 'byung gnas kho nar gyur pas gnas par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skyes bu ra ro ba'i sems dang 'dra bar yon tan 'dzin mi nus kyi nyes pa'i 'byung gnas kho nar gyur pas gnas par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is like the mind of a drunkard, unable to grasp good qualities, and is only a source of faults.

original: 'di'i don mdor bsdus pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i don mdor bsdus pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is summarized:

original: 'di ltar lcags la sogs pa yongs su sbyangs pa ma byas pa gser sgyur rtsis bskus kyang rang gi dngos po mi 'dor ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ltar lcags la sogs pa yongs su sbyangs pa ma byas pa gser sgyur rtsis bskus kyang rang gi dngos po mi 'dor ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as iron, etc., not refined by the elixir of gold, does not give up its own nature,

original: yongs su ma sbyangs pa'i sems 'di yang byang chub kyi sems kyi yon tan la sbyor ba yang rang gis nyes pa'i skyon 'dor bar mi byed do //🔽de ni byang chub gser sgyur de'i rigs pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yongs su ma sbyangs pa'i sems 'di yang byang chub kyi sems kyi yon tan la sbyor ba yang rang gis nyes pa'i skyon 'dor bar mi byed do // de ni byang chub gser sgyur de'i rigs pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: so this unrefined mind, even when applied to the good qualities of the thought of awakening, does not give up its own faults.

original: sman chen nyid du gang dang gang bshad pa //
analyzed: sman chen nyid du gang dang gang bshad pa //
translated: In order to teach the very logic of that thought of awakening, the elixir of gold,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said:🔽Whatever is explained as the great medicine,

original: nyon mongs pa'i nad gso bar byed pas na sman chen te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i nad gso bar byed pas na sman chen te /
translated: The great medicine is that which cures the disease of the afflictions.
