original: byams pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi sgo'i gnyen po'i lam du gyur pa gang dang gang bshad cing bstan pa ste /🔽'dod chags kyi gnyen po mi gtsang ba dang / zhe sdang gi gnyen po byams pa @226a * //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi sgo'i gnyen po'i lam du gyur pa gang dang gang bshad cing bstan pa ste / 'dod chags kyi gnyen po mi gtsang ba dang / zhe sdang gi gnyen po byams pa @226a * //
translated: Whatever is explained and taught as the path of the antidote to the door of the Dharma such as love,🔽whatever is explained as the path of the antidote to attachment, such as the impure, and the antidote to anger, such as love,

original: dang ; gti mug gi gnyen po rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa'i lam gang dang gang bshad pa /
analyzed: dang ; gti mug gi gnyen po rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa'i lam gang dang gang bshad pa /
translated: and the antidote to delusion, such as dependent origination,

original: de dang de nyid bdag la dug tu gyur //
analyzed: de dang de nyid bdag la dug tu gyur //
translated: those very things have become poison for me.

original: zhes pa gzhan dag ma yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes pa gzhan dag ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not the case for others.

original: sman gyi dam pa de dang de dag nyid kho na bdag nyid kho na skal ba ngan cing nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pa'i phyir bdag la dug tu gyur te /
analyzed: sman gyi dam pa de dang de dag nyid kho na bdag nyid kho na skal ba ngan cing nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pa'i phyir bdag la dug tu gyur te /
translated: Those very best medicines have become poison for me alone, due to my bad fortune and being under the power of afflictions.

original: ji ltar sman sbyor ba nyes pa la sogs pa'i rgyus 'chi ba'am /
analyzed: ji ltar sman sbyor ba nyes pa la sogs pa'i rgyus 'chi ba'am /
translated: For example, due to faults in the preparation of medicine, one may die.

original: 'chi ba la thug pa'i nad bskyed pa dang 'dra bar bdag la chos kyi sman de phyin ci log tu 'gyur zhing nyon mongs pa bskyed pas dug tu gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba la thug pa'i nad bskyed pa dang 'dra bar bdag la chos kyi sman de phyin ci log tu 'gyur zhing nyon mongs pa bskyed pas dug tu gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said to be poison because it is a perversion of the medicine of Dharma for the self and because it generates afflictions.

original: de ltar gnas pa de la ci zhig gis gso zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa de la ci zhig gis gso zhe na /
translated: What is the cure for one who is in that state?

original: rigs pa nyid kyi ni bcud len mchog yin na zhes smos te /
analyzed: rigs pa nyid kyi ni bcud len mchog yin na zhes smos te /
translated: The supreme elixir is reason itself.

original: sems kyi rigs pa'i lam btsal ba nyid dam /
analyzed: sems kyi rigs pa'i lam btsal ba nyid dam /
translated: The abandonment of afflictions by means of the path of reasoning of the mind,

original: bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin la nges par gnas pa nyid dam /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin la nges par gnas pa nyid dam /
translated: by means of the definite abiding in meditative stabilization and concentration,

original: dad pas 'dug cing shes rab kyis dpyod pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa spong ba ni rigs pa yin la rigs pa de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i dam pa'i chos la brten pa yin par bshad do //
analyzed: dad pas 'dug cing shes rab kyis dpyod pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa spong ba ni rigs pa yin la rigs pa de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i dam pa'i chos la brten pa yin par bshad do //
translated: and by means of faith, abiding, and the analysis of wisdom, and so forth, is reason. That reason is explained as being based on the excellent Dharma taught by the Bhagavat.

original: de ni bcud len mchog yin na //
analyzed: de ni bcud len mchog yin na //
translated: That is the supreme elixir.

original: zhes bya ba ston pa'i gsung gi rjes su 'jug cing nyams su len pa ni nyon mongs pa'i nang sel cing 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i rgyu yin pas bcud len tha mal pa las khyad par du 'phags pas mchog yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ston pa'i gsung gi rjes su 'jug cing nyams su len pa ni nyon mongs pa'i nang sel cing 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i rgyu yin pas bcud len tha mal pa las khyad par du 'phags pas mchog yin no //
translated: The practice of following the speech of the Teacher is the cause for eliminating the internal afflictions and for freedom from the suffering of cyclic existence. Therefore, it is the supreme elixir, superior to ordinary elixirs.

original: de ltar yin na de gang gis thob ce na /
analyzed: de ltar yin na de gang gis thob ce na /
translated: If that is so, who attains it?

original: gal te yid rton med na de yod min //
analyzed: gal te yid rton med na de yod min //
translated: If there is no confidence, it does not exist.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is meant.

original: de yang gal te nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pas /
analyzed: de yang gal te nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur pas /
translated: If one is controlled by the afflictions,

original: lam la mngon par dad cing /
analyzed: lam la mngon par dad cing /
translated: one has no confidence in the path.

original: nges pa med pa yid brtan pa med na rigs pa de yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: nges pa med pa yid brtan pa med na rigs pa de yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: If one has no confidence, then this principle does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe sangs rgyas nyid sgrub pa la mngon par dad pas 'jug pa las ni grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sangs rgyas nyid sgrub pa la mngon par dad pas 'jug pa las ni grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: When one engages in the practice of attaining buddhahood through confidence, one is liberated.

original: mngon par dad na byang chub tu sems bskyed la /
analyzed: mngon par dad na byang chub tu sems bskyed la /
translated: When one has confidence, one generates the thought of awakening.

original: de las ni rim gyis grol bar 'gyur ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: de las ni rim gyis grol bar 'gyur ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: From that, one is gradually liberated. This is a natural inference.

original: yang na yid rton pa ni yid bde ba la bya ste /
analyzed: yang na yid rton pa ni yid bde ba la bya ste /
translated: Or else, confidence is mental satisfaction.

original: mnyam par 'jog pa las byung ba'i sems rtse gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba dang yid bde ba skye ba /
analyzed: mnyam par 'jog pa las byung ba'i sems rtse gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba dang yid bde ba skye ba /
translated: Mental satisfaction and the pleasure of concentration that arises from meditative equipoise arise.

original: gal te nyon mongs @226b pa spongs bar nus pa'i rigs pa de yang yod par 'gyur gyi yid bde ba de med cing sems g-yengs pa la ni rigs pa de yod pa ma yin pas nyon mongs pas bcom pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs @226b pa spongs bar nus pa'i rigs pa de yang yod par 'gyur gyi yid bde ba de med cing sems g-yengs pa la ni rigs pa de yod pa ma yin pas nyon mongs pas bcom pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that reason for being able to abandon afflictions exists, then mental satisfaction exists. But if the mind is distracted, that reason does not exist, and one is destroyed by afflictions.

original: da ni rigs pa nyid gang zhig yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /🔽gang zhig nyon mongs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;🔽de la rigs pa ni nyon mongs pa spongs pa yin pas /
analyzed: da ni rigs pa nyid gang zhig yin pa bstan pa'i phyir / gang zhig nyon mongs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ; de la rigs pa ni nyon mongs pa spongs pa yin pas /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate just what is reasonable, he says:

original: gang zhig nyon mongs bdo ba rnam sel cing //
analyzed: gang zhig nyon mongs bdo ba rnam sel cing //
translated: That which removes the blazing of afflictions,

original: gang yang nyes gzhan skyed par mi byed pa //
analyzed: gang yang nyes gzhan skyed par mi byed pa //
translated: and does not generate other faults,

original: de ni rigs pa yin zhes bdag sems na //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa yin zhes bdag sems na //
translated: I think that is reasonable.🔽Therein, reason is the abandonment of afflictions.

original: zhes bya ba rigs pa gang dang ldan na 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa bdo zhing kun du rgyu ba'i tshul du skyes pa rnams ni de nyid kyi gnyen pos spang ba ni thabs kyi dam pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rigs pa gang dang ldan na 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa bdo zhing kun du rgyu ba'i tshul du skyes pa rnams ni de nyid kyi gnyen pos spang ba ni thabs kyi dam pa ma yin te /
translated: What is the reasoning? When the afflictions such as attachment, anger, and delusion arise in a way that is intense and pervasive, it is not the best method to abandon them by means of their specific antidotes.

original: gong du bstan pa ltar gyur la /
analyzed: gong du bstan pa ltar gyur la /
translated: As explained above, that is not the best method.

original: de bas na nyon mongs pa'i rgyu'i gnyen po'i rtog dpyod ngan pa zhi bar gyur pa yang dag pa'i rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na nyon mongs pa'i rgyu'i gnyen po'i rtog dpyod ngan pa zhi bar gyur pa yang dag pa'i rtog pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the antidote to the cause of the afflictions is the pacification of negative thoughts and analysis. That is right thought.

original: 'phags pa'i lam de sbyor ba'i lam la mos pa yid la byed pas bsam pa'i man ngag de goms par byas na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam de sbyor ba'i lam la mos pa yid la byed pas bsam pa'i man ngag de goms par byas na /
translated: If one becomes familiar with that instruction on the intention of the ārya path through mental attention to the path of preparation,

original: nyon mongs pa'i tshogs ring por mi thogs par de kho na mthong bas zhi bar byed pa yang gang zhig nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyi nyes pa mngon du rgyu ba las gzhan pa bag la nyal gyi tshul du sems rgyud la gnas pa dang / gzhan zhar las byung ba'i nyes pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i tshogs ring por mi thogs par de kho na mthong bas zhi bar byed pa yang gang zhig nyon mongs pa'i tshogs kyi nyes pa mngon du rgyu ba las gzhan pa bag la nyal gyi tshul du sems rgyud la gnas pa dang / gzhan zhar las byung ba'i nyes pa ste /
translated: The path of reasoning is that which pacifies the mass of afflictions by seeing reality in no long time. It is the antidote to the mass of afflictions that exist in the mindstream in the form of latent states and to the faults that arise incidentally.

original: 'dod chags kyi gnyen por mi sdug pa sgom pa na zhe sdang 'byung ba lta bu skyod cing 'khrugs par mi byed pa'i gnyen po'i lam de ni rigs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi gnyen por mi sdug pa sgom pa na zhe sdang 'byung ba lta bu skyod cing 'khrugs par mi byed pa'i gnyen po'i lam de ni rigs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The path of reasoning is the antidote that does not agitate or disturb the mind. For example, when one meditates on the foul to remedy attachment, hatred arises.

original: tshad ma dang mi 'gal zhig yang dag pa'i ye shes bskyed pa'i gtan tshigs dang ldan pa yin pas de lta bu ni rigs pa yin no zhes bdag yid la sems shing blos shes mod kyi //
analyzed: tshad ma dang mi 'gal zhig yang dag pa'i ye shes bskyed pa'i gtan tshigs dang ldan pa yin pas de lta bu ni rigs pa yin no zhes bdag yid la sems shing blos shes mod kyi //
translated: I think and understand in my mind that reasoning is that which does not contradict valid knowledge and possesses the reason that generates correct wisdom.

original: 'on kyang ci 'dra yin zhes slar yang nges ma byas //
analyzed: 'on kyang ci 'dra yin zhes slar yang nges ma byas //
translated: But I have not ascertained what it is like.

original: zhes bya ba rnam par grol ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i rigs pa de'i lam bsgoms pas mngon sum du byas nas ye shes thob par gyur pa ni nges par byas pa yin pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rnam par grol ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i rigs pa de'i lam bsgoms pas mngon sum du byas nas ye shes thob par gyur pa ni nges par byas pa yin pas /
translated: Thus, by cultivating the path of that reasoning which is the cause of liberation, one has actualized it and attained the wisdom of certainty.🔽But since one has not attained it, one has not ascertained it.

original: de ma thob pa'i phyir ci 'dra yin zhes slar yang nges ma byas zhes pa rigs pa'i lam de bdag gis goms par ma byas so zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de ma thob pa'i phyir ci 'dra yin zhes slar yang nges ma byas zhes pa rigs pa'i lam de bdag gis goms par ma byas so zhes pa ste /
translated: One has not cultivated that path of reasoning.

original: ston pas gsungs pa'i yang dag pa'i lam thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab kyis shes par byas mod kyi /🔽bsgom pa'i shes @227a * //
analyzed: ston pas gsungs pa'i yang dag pa'i lam thos pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab kyis shes par byas mod kyi / bsgom pa'i shes @227a * //
translated: One has understood the path of the perfect truth taught by the Master through the wisdom of hearing and reflection.

original: rab kyis mngon sum du ni ma byas so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rab kyis mngon sum du ni ma byas so zhes bstan to //
translated: But one has not actualized it through the wisdom of cultivation.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi 'bras bu bstan nas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi 'bras bu bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the result of the thought of awakening,

original: da ni bsgom pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /🔽bsam dang bag la nyal dang khams bag chags //
analyzed: da ni bsgom pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir / bsam dang bag la nyal dang khams bag chags //
translated: now, in order to explain the result of cultivation,🔽it is said:🔽The antidote to the cause of the faults,

original: nyes pa'i rgyu yi gnyen po la sbyar nas //
analyzed: nyes pa'i rgyu yi gnyen po la sbyar nas //
translated: the thoughts, latent tendencies, and constituents,

original: bsam pa'i man ngag de ni bsgom pa na //
analyzed: bsam pa'i man ngag de ni bsgom pa na //
translated: is the cultivation of the instructions on the thought.

original: 'dir ni ring por mi thegs zhi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dir ni ring por mi thegs zhi bar 'gyur //
translated: Here, in no long time, there is peace.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus, it is said.

original: bsam pa ni lhag pa'i bsam pa ste sems so //
analyzed: bsam pa ni lhag pa'i bsam pa ste sems so //
translated: Thought is the superior thought, the mind.

original: bag la nyal ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i phra rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: bag la nyal ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i phra rgyas rnams so //
translated: Latent tendencies are the proclivities of attachment and so on.

original: khams ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: khams ni rang bzhin no //
translated: Constituent is the nature.

original: bag chags ni bsam pa la sogs pa de dag nyid ni bag chags sems la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: bag chags ni bsam pa la sogs pa de dag nyid ni bag chags sems la gnas pa ste /
translated: The latent tendencies of those thoughts and so on are the latent tendencies that reside in the mind.

original: bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba dang khams rnams kyi bag chags las gyur pa'i nyes pa sems la gang dag yod pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba dang khams rnams kyi bag chags las gyur pa'i nyes pa sems la gang dag yod pa ste /
translated: The faults that arise from the latent tendencies of thoughts, latent tendencies, and constituents are those that exist in the mind.

original: gang gis 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: gang gis 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de'i gnyen po ste /
translated: The causes of the arising of attachment, anger, and so on are the views of self and so on that exist.

original: de dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa bdag med pa'am /
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa bdag med pa'am /
translated: The antidote to that is the non-self that is discordant with that,

original: mi gtsang ba la sogs pa la sems sbyar zhing rjes su bsten la /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba la sogs pa la sems sbyar zhing rjes su bsten la /
translated: or the mind that is applied to and attended to the impure and so on.

original: de yang bsam pa'i man ngag ces bya ba ston pas dbang po rab dang / 'bring dang / tha ma'i rim pa la dgongs nas theg pa'i khyad par ji skad gsungs pa'am /
analyzed: de yang bsam pa'i man ngag ces bya ba ston pas dbang po rab dang / 'bring dang / tha ma'i rim pa la dgongs nas theg pa'i khyad par ji skad gsungs pa'am /
translated: Moreover, the instruction of reflection is taught by the Teacher, intending the sequence of those of highest, medium, and lowest faculties.🔽The meaning of the instruction of reflection is the ascertainment by the wisdom of hearing and contemplation of the meaning of the individual statements that are the antidotes to attachment, aversion, and delusion.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi gnyen po so sor ji skad gsungs pa'i don de thos pa dang / bsam pa'i shes rab kyis nges pa nyid du byas pa'i bsam pa'i man ngag de mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir bsgoms shing goms par byas pas rtse gcig tu byas pa las ni nyon mongs pa'i tshogs de zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi gnyen po so sor ji skad gsungs pa'i don de thos pa dang / bsam pa'i shes rab kyis nges pa nyid du byas pa'i bsam pa'i man ngag de mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir bsgoms shing goms par byas pas rtse gcig tu byas pa las ni nyon mongs pa'i tshogs de zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The assembly of afflictions will be pacified through meditation and familiarization with that instruction of reflection in order to actualize it, through making it one-pointed.

original: dus ji tsam na 'gyur zhe na /🔽'dir ni ring por mi thogs zhi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dus ji tsam na 'gyur zhe na / 'dir ni ring por mi thogs zhi bar 'gyur //
translated: If it is asked after how much time,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said, “Here, it will be pacified before long.”

original: gnas skabs 'dir man ngag gi tshul 'di legs par bsgoms shing yid la byas pas ni ring por mi thogs par myur du sems la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs bsal cing zhi bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs 'dir man ngag gi tshul 'di legs par bsgoms shing yid la byas pas ni ring por mi thogs par myur du sems la yod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs bsal cing zhi bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: In this context, by properly cultivating and keeping in mind this method of instruction, the host of afflictions that exist in the mind will be removed and pacified without delay.

original: bsgom pa la yang dag par gnas pas zhugs pa dag gi nyon mongs pa dag ni spang dka' ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsgom pa la yang dag par gnas pas zhugs pa dag gi nyon mongs pa dag ni spang dka' ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the afflictions of those who have entered and are abiding in the meditation are not difficult to abandon.

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung nyid slu ba med pa nyid @227b yin par bstan pa'i phyir /🔽skyob pa nyes pa kun dang rnam bral zhing //
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung nyid slu ba med pa nyid @227b yin par bstan pa'i phyir / skyob pa nyes pa kun dang rnam bral zhing //
translated: Now, in order to teach that the speech of the Bhagavān is itself non-deceptive,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said:🔽The Protector, free from all faults,

original: skyob pa zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams sdug bsngal las skyob par byed pas skyob pa'o //
analyzed: skyob pa zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams sdug bsngal las skyob par byed pas skyob pa'o //
translated: The Protector is so called because he protects sentient beings from suffering.

original: nyes pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'khor ba pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: nyes pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'khor ba pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: Faults are the dharmas of saṃsāra such as attachment.

original: de thams cad dang bral zhing spangs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de thams cad dang bral zhing spangs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: He is free from and has abandoned all of them.

original: gzhan yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is it like?

original: chos rnams kun gyi dam pa'i don gzigs pa //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chos rnams kun gyi dam pa'i don gzigs pa // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He sees the ultimate reality of all phenomena.🔽He is called “the one who sees the ultimate reality of all phenomena” because he possesses the nature of seeing the ultimate reality of all phenomena.

original: chos kyang yin la kun kyang yin pas chos rnams kun te /
analyzed: chos kyang yin la kun kyang yin pas chos rnams kun te /
translated: All phenomena are all phenomena that are pure or impure,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'am /🔽zag pa med pa'am /🔽rgyu ba'am mi rgyu ba'am /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'am / zag pa med pa'am / rgyu ba'am mi rgyu ba'am /
translated: with or without outflows,🔽moving or unmoving,

original: thag nye ba'am ring ba ste /
analyzed: thag nye ba'am ring ba ste /
translated: near or far.

original: chos de rnams kyi dam pa'i don ni thun mong ma yin pa'i don te /
analyzed: chos de rnams kyi dam pa'i don ni thun mong ma yin pa'i don te /
translated: The ultimate reality of those phenomena is their uncommon reality.

original: de gzigs pa'i ngang tshul mnga' bas na /
analyzed: de gzigs pa'i ngang tshul mnga' bas na /
translated: He possesses the nature of seeing that ultimate reality.

original: chos rnams kun gyi dam pa'i don gzigs pa //
analyzed: chos rnams kun gyi dam pa'i don gzigs pa //
translated: Therefore, he is called “the one who sees the ultimate reality of all phenomena.”

original: zhes bya'o // khyed kyis sna tshogs tshul du'ang nges gsungs pas //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // khyed kyis sna tshogs tshul du'ang nges gsungs pas //
translated: You have taught in various ways.

original: zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang mos tshul sna tshogs pas theg pa'i tshul du mar nges par phye ste gsungs pa'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang mos tshul sna tshogs pas theg pa'i tshul du mar nges par phye ste gsungs pa'am /
translated: You have taught by distinguishing the various ways of the vehicles in accordance with the various ways of faculties and aspirations.

original: nyon mongs pa'i tshul mtha' yas pas gnyen po'i tshul yang sna tshogs par gsungs pa gang yin pa des ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs kyi tshogs bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus par spong bar byed pas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i tshul mtha' yas pas gnyen po'i tshul yang sna tshogs par gsungs pa gang yin pa des ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs kyi tshogs bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus par spong bar byed pas /
translated: Since the afflictions are of infinite modes, the modes of their antidotes are also taught in various ways. By means of that, one eliminates the entire mass of afflictions such as desire, along with their traces.

original: nyon mongs sa bon ma lus sel bar byed //
analyzed: nyon mongs sa bon ma lus sel bar byed //
translated: It eliminates all the seeds of the afflictions.

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: This is what it says.

original: khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad ma lus par sel bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad ma lus par sel bar byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that it eliminates all the afflictions of the three realms without exception.

original: de ltar bstan pa'i yon tan bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa'i yon tan bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the qualities that are taught in that way,

original: da ni gzugs sku mthong zhing gsung thos pas nyon mongs pa spong ba'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gzugs sku mthong zhing gsung thos pas nyon mongs pa spong ba'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the way of eliminating the afflictions by seeing the form body and hearing the speech,🔽it is said:

original: khyed sku mdzes pa'i mtshan gyis 'bar gyur pa //
analyzed: khyed sku mdzes pa'i mtshan gyis 'bar gyur pa //
translated: Your body blazes with the major marks of beauty,🔽and also seeing it present in front of oneself,

original: de yang mdun na bzhugs pa mthong ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yang mdun na bzhugs pa mthong ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das khyed kyi gzugs kyi sku mdzes pa yang yin la mtshan kyang yin pas mdzes pa'i mtshan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das khyed kyi gzugs kyi sku mdzes pa yang yin la mtshan kyang yin pas mdzes pa'i mtshan te /
translated: Bhagavan, your form body is beautiful and also has the major marks, so it is a beautiful mark.

original: dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa la sogs pa mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byed bzang po brgyad cu dag gis nye bar mtshon par gyur cing /
analyzed: dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa la sogs pa mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byed bzang po brgyad cu dag gis nye bar mtshon par gyur cing /
translated: It is endowed with the uṣṇīṣa on the head and so on, the thirty-two major marks and the eighty minor marks.

original: de nyid kyis na lhan ne lham me lhang nges 'bar bar gyur ba dang / 'dzam bu chu bo'i gser lta bu'i sku mdog @228a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na lhan ne lham me lhang nges 'bar bar gyur ba dang / 'dzam bu chu bo'i gser lta bu'i sku mdog @228a * //
translated: It is radiant, shining, and blazing with just those, and the color of the body is like the gold of the Jambu River.

original: shin tu 'bar bar gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: shin tu 'bar bar gyur ba yin la /
translated: It is very radiant.

original: de lta bu'i sku de yang mdun na bzhugs pa zhes bya ba dbang po'i mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa'am /
analyzed: de lta bu'i sku de yang mdun na bzhugs pa zhes bya ba dbang po'i mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa'am /
translated: That body is also in front, meaning it is seen directly by the sense organs.

original: yid kyi mngon sum na bzhugs pa lta bur blos mthong zhing mngon sum du byed pa dang / gzhan yang //
analyzed: yid kyi mngon sum na bzhugs pa lta bur blos mthong zhing mngon sum du byed pa dang / gzhan yang //
translated: Or it is seen and made manifest by the mind as if it were in front.

original: rna bas btung ba'i bdud rtsi'ang thos gyur pa'i //
analyzed: rna bas btung ba'i bdud rtsi'ang thos gyur pa'i //
translated: Also, the nectar of hearing is heard.

original: zhes bya ba skyes bu dag gis rna ba gnyis kyis btung bar bya ba yin pas na rna bas btung ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba skyes bu dag gis rna ba gnyis kyis btung bar bya ba yin pas na rna bas btung ba ste /
translated: Since it is to be drunk by the ears of beings, it is the drink of the ears.

original: rnabs gzung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnabs gzung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term is that it is to be held by the ears.

original: ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is it?

original: bdud rtsi 'ang thos gyur pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdud rtsi 'ang thos gyur pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is the nectar that is heard.

original: 'ang zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba ste /🔽mgon po khyod kyi sku mngon sum du mthong ba'am /
analyzed: 'ang zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba ste / mgon po khyod kyi sku mngon sum du mthong ba'am /
translated: The term also includes the following.

original: yid kyis mngon du dmigs pas nyon mongs pa sel bar ma zad kyi khyed kyi gsung skyes bu gang gis thos par gyur pa de yang de la bdud rtsir 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid kyis mngon du dmigs pas nyon mongs pa sel bar ma zad kyi khyed kyi gsung skyes bu gang gis thos par gyur pa de yang de la bdud rtsir 'gyur te /
translated: Not only is the body of the Lord seen directly or mentally perceived and does it eliminate afflictions, but also the speech of the Lord is nectar for any being who hears it.

original: ji ltar snyim pas bdud rtsi 'thung bar byed pa dag 'chi bas mi tshugs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar snyim pas bdud rtsi 'thung bar byed pa dag 'chi bas mi tshugs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as those who drink nectar from their cupped hands are not harmed by death,

original: mgon po'i gsung gi bdud rtsi rna ba gnyis kyi snyim pas 'thung pa'i tshul len par byed pa dag ni nyon mongs pa'i dug gis mi tshugs kyis dge ba'i srog gi dbang po mi 'chad pas ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mgon po'i gsung gi bdud rtsi rna ba gnyis kyi snyim pas 'thung pa'i tshul len par byed pa dag ni nyon mongs pa'i dug gis mi tshugs kyis dge ba'i srog gi dbang po mi 'chad pas ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who take the nectar of the Lord's speech in the cupped hands of their two ears are not harmed by the poison of the afflictions, and so do not go to the lower realms, since the faculty of life of virtue is not interrupted.

original: nyon mongs sa bon ma lus rnam par 'jig / ces bya ba ni de lta bu'i sku mthong ba dang / gsung thos pa'i skyes bu'i nyon mongs pa khams gsum par 'khor zhing sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa sa bon dang bcas pa ma lus par mtha' dag rnam par 'jig cing /
analyzed: nyon mongs sa bon ma lus rnam par 'jig / ces bya ba ni de lta bu'i sku mthong ba dang / gsung thos pa'i skyes bu'i nyon mongs pa khams gsum par 'khor zhing sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa sa bon dang bcas pa ma lus par mtha' dag rnam par 'jig cing /
translated: The line all the seeds of the afflictions are completely destroyed means that the afflictions of the person who sees such a body and hears such speech, along with their seeds, are completely destroyed,

original: rang nyid dengs shing zad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang nyid dengs shing zad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and that they themselves vanish and are exhausted.

original: de ltar gzugs kyi sku mthong ba'i yon tan bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar gzugs kyi sku mthong ba'i yon tan bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the qualities of seeing the form body,

original: da ni chos kyi sku mthong ba'i yon tan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni chos kyi sku mthong ba'i yon tan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the qualities of seeing the truth body,🔽it says,

original: gtso bo khyod la de las rab mchog gyur /🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gtso bo khyod la de las rab mchog gyur /🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: ji ltar nyi mas phyi'i mun pa'i tshogs sel bar byed pa de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi snang bas ma rig pa'i mun pa mun gnag 'joms par byed pas nyi ma dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar nyi mas phyi'i mun pa'i tshogs sel bar byed pa de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi snang bas ma rig pa'i mun pa mun gnag 'joms par byed pas nyi ma dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as the sun removes the mass of external darkness, so the light of the intuition of the Dharma Realm destroys the darkness of nescience, because it is similar to the sun.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bla na med pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bla na med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is unsurpassed,

original: de las lhag ma gzhan med pa'am /
analyzed: de las lhag ma gzhan med pa'am /
translated: because there is nothing higher than it,

original: sa 'og ma pa thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or because it is not common to all the lower stages.

original: de nyid kyis na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na /
translated: For that very reason,

original: bsams kyang 'gro ba'i spyod yul mi 'gyur ba //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bsams kyang 'gro ba'i spyod yul mi 'gyur ba // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is not the domain of those who go, even when they think.

original: chos kyi sku'i ngo bo bsams shing bsgoms su zin kyang khams gsum pa'i 'gro ba so so'i skye bo dngos po la mngon par zhen pa rnams kyi spyod yul du mi 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i ngo bo bsams shing bsgoms su zin kyang khams gsum pa'i 'gro ba so so'i skye bo dngos po la mngon par zhen pa rnams kyi spyod yul du mi 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Even when they think and meditate on the nature of the Dharma Body, it is not the domain of those who go, of the ordinary beings of the three realms, who are attached to things,

original: de'i rang bzhin blos rtogs shing khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin blos rtogs shing khong du chud par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not understand and realize its nature with their intellects.

original: de ltar yod par ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: de ltar yod par ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How is it known that it exists in that way?

original: nyes pa'i rab rib 'joms pa ngo mtshar che //
analyzed: nyes pa'i rab rib 'joms pa ngo mtshar che //
translated: It is most wondrous that it conquers the darkness of faults.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is meant.

original: gang gi phyir ma rig pa zhes bya ba nyon mongs pa'i gzhi bor gyur pa'i nyes pa'i mun nag gi rab rib 'joms shing sel bar byed pa nyi ma lta bu gang yin pa ni chos sku ste stong pa nyid kyi ye shes yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma rig pa zhes bya ba nyon mongs pa'i gzhi bor gyur pa'i nyes pa'i mun nag gi rab rib 'joms shing sel bar byed pa nyi ma lta bu gang yin pa ni chos sku ste stong pa nyid kyi ye shes yin la /
translated: The Dharma body, which is the wisdom of emptiness, is like the sun, in that it conquers and dispels the darkness of faults, which is the ignorance that is the basis of the afflictions.

original: de ni dngos por ma dmigs shing mig gi spyod yul du ma gyur pa yin yang skyes bu rnams kyi blo'i mun pa sel bar byed pa ni ngo mtshar che ste /
analyzed: de ni dngos por ma dmigs shing mig gi spyod yul du ma gyur pa yin yang skyes bu rnams kyi blo'i mun pa sel bar byed pa ni ngo mtshar che ste /
translated: It is most wondrous that it dispels the darkness of the minds of beings, even though it is not perceived as an entity and is not an object of the eyes.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir rmad du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir rmad du gyur pa yin no //
translated: It is marvelous because it is an inconceivable object.

original: de ltar bshags shing bstod pa brtsams pa mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gyi sgo brjod de phyag 'tshal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar bshags shing bstod pa brtsams pa mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan gyi sgo brjod de phyag 'tshal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that he has paid homage to the Bhagavat by expressing the door of his qualities at the end of this praise and confession, it is said:

original: thugs mchog gang yang rung ba de yis ni /🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: thugs mchog gang yang rung ba de yis ni /🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: By whichever of the supreme minds

original: bcom ldan 'das khyed la btud cing phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das khyed la btud cing phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should supply I bow down, I pay homage to you, O Transcendent Victor.

original: ci'i phyir phyag 'tshal zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phyag 'tshal zhe na /
translated: Why does one pay homage?

original: nyes pa zhi bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa zhi bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has pacified faults.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what means?

original: thugs mchog gang yang rung ba de yis ni //🔽zhes bya ba ste /🔽gang gis gnyis su med pa'i ye shes nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs @229a * //
analyzed: thugs mchog gang yang rung ba de yis ni // zhes bya ba ste / gang gis gnyis su med pa'i ye shes nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs @229a * //
translated: By any of his supreme minds.

original: pa'i yul ma yin pa thugs su chud par mdzad pa'i thugs kyi mchog gang yang rung ba de yis so //
analyzed: pa'i yul ma yin pa thugs su chud par mdzad pa'i thugs kyi mchog gang yang rung ba de yis so //
translated: By any of his supreme minds, by which he has realized nondual knowledge that is not the domain of śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so on.

original: ci zhig la dmigs she na /
analyzed: ci zhig la dmigs she na /
translated: To what does he attend?

original: zhi gnas gang yang rung ba der bzhugs nas //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhi gnas gang yang rung ba der bzhugs nas // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To any of his states of meditative equipoise.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'jug pa lhun gyis grub pa'am rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang / bsam gtan gyi mchog la zhugs zhing rnal 'byor gyi mthar byon pa brnyes pa la bzhugs pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'jug pa lhun gyis grub pa'am rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang / bsam gtan gyi mchog la zhugs zhing rnal 'byor gyi mthar byon pa brnyes pa la bzhugs pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: He attends to any of his states of meditative equipoise, to the union of śamatha and vipaśyanā, to the spontaneous, to the vajra-like samādhi, to the supreme meditative stabilization, to the attainment of the perfection of yoga.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?🔽Homage to the Blessed One,

original: nyes kun rnam pa kun du zhir mdzad pa'i //
analyzed: nyes kun rnam pa kun du zhir mdzad pa'i //
translated: who has pacified all faults in every way!

original: bcom ldan gang yin de la phyag 'tshal lo //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /🔽'khor ba'i sdug bsngal skyed pa'i nyes pa gang yin pa de kun zhi bar mdzad cing sel bar mdzad par spyod pa ni khyed nyid yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan gang yin de la phyag 'tshal lo // zhes bya ba smos te / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal skyed pa'i nyes pa gang yin pa de kun zhi bar mdzad cing sel bar mdzad par spyod pa ni khyed nyid yin te /
translated: He alone is the Blessed One, who has pacified all faults, who has removed all faults that give rise to the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: de zlog par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de zlog par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He is the one who has turned away from them, that is, he has turned away from the faults that give rise to the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: rnam pa kun zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa kun zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In every way.

original: bag chags dang bcas pa rnam pa thams cad du sel bar mdzad pa'am /
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa rnam pa thams cad du sel bar mdzad pa'am /
translated: He has removed them in every way, together with their traces.

original: yang na rnam pa kun gyis zhi bar mdzad pa ste /🔽theg pa'i tshul sna tshogs sam /
analyzed: yang na rnam pa kun gyis zhi bar mdzad pa ste / theg pa'i tshul sna tshogs sam /
translated: Or else, he has pacified them in every way,

original: rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul la sogs pa'i thabs kyi sgo sna tshogs kyis zhi bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul la sogs pa'i thabs kyi sgo sna tshogs kyis zhi bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: through the various methods of the vehicles, or through the various means of magical power, miracles, and so on.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das gang yang rung ba de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das gang yang rung ba de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, homage to the Blessed One, whoever he may be.

original: nyes pa'i tshogs de lta bu zhi bar mdzad pa'i bcom ldan 'das gang yin pa de la lus dang ngag dang yid dang zhing gus pas 'dud cing phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyes pa'i tshogs de lta bu zhi bar mdzad pa'i bcom ldan 'das gang yin pa de la lus dang ngag dang yid dang zhing gus pas 'dud cing phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that I pay homage with devotion.

original: gang yin de la zhes smos pa ni gang gi phyir khyed kyee mkhyen pas khyab par med pa'i tshig tu smos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang yin de la zhes smos pa ni gang gi phyir khyed kyee mkhyen pas khyab par med pa'i tshig tu smos pa yin gyi /
translated: The phrase to whomever is used because you are not omniscient.

original: de lta na ni gtso bo la de skad smra ba rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni gtso bo la de skad smra ba rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not right to say to the principal one in that way.

original: de lta na khyed de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa gang yang rung ba de la bdag phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su mchi'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta na khyed de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa gang yang rung ba de la bdag phyag 'tshal zhing skyabs su mchi'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that I pay homage and go for refuge to whomever has such qualities.

original: da ni bstod pa byas pa las byung ba'i bsod nams gang yin pa de sems can rnams la bsngo ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa yin pas de dang rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bstod pa byas pa las byung ba'i bsod nams gang yin pa de sems can rnams la bsngo ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa yin pas de dang rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to dedicate to sentient beings whatever merit has arisen from the praise and to be in accord with the training of the bodhisattvas, it is said:

original: de ltar yon tan bla med la bshags pa'i //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar yon tan bla med la bshags pa'i // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, having confessed to the unsurpassed qualities,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Here, thus refers to completion.

original: yon tan bla med ni gang la yon tan gyi tshogs thun mong ma yin pa mnga' ba ste ston pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan bla med ni gang la yon tan gyi tshogs thun mong ma yin pa mnga' ba ste ston pa'o //
translated: Unsurpassed qualities refers to the Teacher who possesses an uncommon assembly of qualities.

original: @229b de la bshags pa ni rang gis sdig pa dang nyes pa gang dag byas pa de'i spyan sngar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: @229b de la bshags pa ni rang gis sdig pa dang nyes pa gang dag byas pa de'i spyan sngar brjod pa'o //
translated: Confessing means expressing in his presence whatever misdeeds and faults one has committed.

original: de lta bu'i sgo nas ci zhig byas she na /🔽yang dag bstod pa rnam sbyar dge ba ni //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sgo nas ci zhig byas she na / yang dag bstod pa rnam sbyar dge ba ni //
translated: Having done so in that way, what is done?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The virtue of composing the correct praise is stated.

original: rang gi nyes pa de brjod pa'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das la yang dag par bstod pa'i tshig rnam par 'phel zhing legs par sbyar ba las dge ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi nyes pa de brjod pa'i sgo nas bcom ldan 'das la yang dag par bstod pa'i tshig rnam par 'phel zhing legs par sbyar ba las dge ba ste /
translated: Correct praise refers to the words of praise to the Blessed One that increase and are well composed through expressing one's own faults.

original: bsod nams su byas pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams su byas pa'o //
translated: Virtue means the merit that is made.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /🔽zla mdzes ltar dkar bdag gis gang bsags des //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na / zla mdzes ltar dkar bdag gis gang bsags des //
translated: What is it like?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Whatever I have accumulated, pure like the beautiful moon, is stated.

original: bsod nams de yang ston ka'i zla ba ltar dkar zhing mdzes pa ste /
analyzed: bsod nams de yang ston ka'i zla ba ltar dkar zhing mdzes pa ste /
translated: And that merit is white, like the autumn moon, and beautiful.

original: nyes pa'i nag nog gis ma 'dres shing yid du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa'i nag nog gis ma 'dres shing yid du 'ong ba'o //
translated: It is not mixed with the darkness of faults, and is pleasing to the mind.

original: bdag gis gang bsags zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis bsgrubs shing tshogs yongs su bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis gang bsags zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis bsgrubs shing tshogs yongs su bsdus pa'o //
translated: “Whatever I have accumulated” means that I have accomplished it myself, and gathered the accumulations.

original: zla ba smos pas ni bdag nyid kyi ming zla ba zhes bya bar yang ston to //
analyzed: zla ba smos pas ni bdag nyid kyi ming zla ba zhes bya bar yang ston to //
translated: By mentioning the moon, he also shows that his own name is Candraprabha.

original: dkar ba smos pas kyang bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin dag par ston to //
analyzed: dkar ba smos pas kyang bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin dag par ston to //
translated: By mentioning the white, he also shows that his own nature is pure.

original: bsod nams de gang du bsngo zhe na /
analyzed: bsod nams de gang du bsngo zhe na /
translated: To what does he dedicate that merit?

original: 'gro kun bde ba can du 'gro bar shog / ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'gro kun bde ba can du 'gro bar shog / ces bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “May all beings go to Sukhāvatī.”

original: bdag gis de ltar bsags pa'i bsod nams des 'gro ba 'di dag thams cad 'jig rten gyi khams bde ba can du 'gro zhing der skye bar shog cig pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis de ltar bsags pa'i bsod nams des 'gro ba 'di dag thams cad 'jig rten gyi khams bde ba can du 'gro zhing der skye bar shog cig pa'o //
translated: By that merit which I have accumulated in that way, may all these beings go to the world-realm Sukhāvatī, and be born there.

original: yang na bla na med pa'i bde ba ni sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang ste /
analyzed: yang na bla na med pa'i bde ba ni sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang ste /
translated: Or else, unsurpassed happiness is the state of a Buddha.

original: de dang ldan pa'i gnas thob par gyur cig ces bya ba'i don to //🔽blo chen blo gros bzang po yis //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i gnas thob par gyur cig ces bya ba'i don to // blo chen blo gros bzang po yis //
translated: The meaning is: May I attain the state endowed with that.🔽Based on the supplication

original: gsol ba btab pa la brten te //
analyzed: gsol ba btab pa la brten te //
translated: with great intelligence and good understanding,

original: sangs rgyas zhi ba bdag gis ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhi ba bdag gis ni //
translated: I, Buddhaśānti,

original: bshags bstod 'grel pa 'di byas so //🔽zla ba'i tshig don dbyings che bas ;
analyzed: bshags bstod 'grel pa 'di byas so // zla ba'i tshig don dbyings che bas ;
translated: have composed this commentary on the Confession and Praise.

original: / bde gshegs spyod pa zab mo 'di //🔽bshags nas bstod pa'i tshul la ni //
analyzed: / bde gshegs spyod pa zab mo 'di // bshags nas bstod pa'i tshul la ni //
translated: This profound conduct of the Sugata,🔽with the great space of the meaning of the words of the moon,🔽having confessed, I have composed this

original: brten brtsams srid pa sbyang phyir yin //🔽de yi 'grel pa zla zer ltar //
analyzed: brten brtsams srid pa sbyang phyir yin // de yi 'grel pa zla zer ltar //
translated: in the manner of praise, based on the method, for the sake of purifying existence.🔽By this, my pleasing commentary

original: yid 'ong bdag gis byas pa 'dis //
analyzed: yid 'ong bdag gis byas pa 'dis //
translated: like the light of the moon,

original: 'gro ba'i nyon mongs rnam sbyangs nas //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i nyon mongs rnam sbyangs nas //
translated: having purified the afflictions of beings,

original: skyon bral sangs rgyas nyid thob shog /
analyzed: skyon bral sangs rgyas nyid thob shog /
translated: may they attain buddhahood free from faults.

original: bshags bstod kyi 'grel pa slob dpon sangs rgyas zhi bas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: bshags bstod kyi 'grel pa slob dpon sangs rgyas zhi bas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the Confession and Praise composed by the master Buddhaśānti is complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po buddha shr'i sh'anti dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba dge slong rin chen bzang pos bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa /
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po buddha shr'i sh'anti dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba dge slong rin chen bzang pos bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa /
translated: The Indian abbot Buddha Shri Shanti and the great editor, the monk Rinchen Zangpo, translated and edited this.
